title: Albums by Florence and the Machine and Meshell Ndegeocello
description: FLORENCE AND THE MACHINE

title: Citigroup and the S.E.C. Defend Their Settlement
description: Citigroup and the Securities and Exchange Commission filed legal papers on Monday defending their settlement of allegations of fraud in the banks sale of mortgage-backed securities.

title: Spotted Horses in Cave Art Werent Just a Figment, DNA Shows
description: Roughly 25,000 years ago in what is now southwestern France, human beings walked deep into a cave and left their enduring marks. Using materials like sticks, charcoal and iron oxides, they painted images of animals on the cave walls and ceilings  lions and mammoths and spotted horses, walking and grazing and congregating in herds.

title: Update: Building a Visual Time Capsule
description: Update | View Picturing 7 Billion, the completed visual time capsule.

title: Fireworks at the Beach
description: Q. Recently, at the San Diego ocean beach at night, we watched light emanating from every wave crest. News reports said it was caused by the red tide. How does it work?

title: Science, Skin and Ink
description: Photographs of science tattoos from the book Science Ink, by Carl Zimmer.

title: A Starry Roster Singing Arias Fiery and Hilarious
description: Last-minute changes to the program have become part of the tradition at the annual Richard Tucker Music Foundations gala concert. So it was on Sunday night, when a starry roster of singers  joined by members of the Metropolitan Opera Orchestra, conducted by Emmanuel Villaume, and the New York Choral Society  performed diverse arias and ensembles for a packed house at Avery Fisher Hall.

title: The mouse that got old gracefully, a computer way, way, ahead of its time and keeping patients happy.
description: The mouse that got old gracefully, a computer way, way, ahead of its time and keeping patients happy.

title: Critics Picks: The Wild Bunch
description: A. O. Scott looks at Sam Peckinpahs epic western.

title: Adventures Worthy of the Big Screen
description: Uncharted 3: Drakes Deception is the finest, most exciting action-adventure movie in years.

title: Obama Presses Job Aid for Veterans
description: President Obama renewed his campaign on Monday for measures to help veterans of Iraq and Afghanistan break into the work force, amid signs that the Senate was moving toward passing a provision of the presidents jobs bill that would give companies a tax incentive to hire returning veterans.

title: For a Baby Okapi, Dont Push Too Hard
description: Mbura, an okapi calf revealed to the public at the Bronx Zoo last week after more than 18 months of delicate husbandry work, was stretching out her stubby zebra-striped legs before a crowd of young admirers on Thursday.

title: Soda Bans in Schools Have Limited Impact
description: State laws that ban soda in schools  but not other sweetened beverages  have virtually no impact on the amount of sugary drinks middle school students buy and consume at school, a new study shows.

title: The New New List
description: Tracking the latest ideas in travel and where theyll take you next.

title: A Tool to Quit Smoking Has Some Unlikely Critics
description: If you want a truly frustrating job in public health, try getting people to stop smoking. Even when researchers combine counseling and encouragement with nicotine patches and gum, few smokers quit.

title: Focus on Home, Not Meals, Led Spiders to Diversify
description: There are thousands of species of orb-weaving spiders, found on every continent but Antarctica.

title: Old Story: Krazy Kats Love Triangle
description: It wasnt just another game of cat and mouse at the Joyce SoHo on Friday night. In Love Letters in Ancient Brick, a performance piece conceived and directed by the Swiss visual artist Mai-Thu Perret in collaboration with Laurence Yadi, characters were plucked from a treasured comic strip and brought to life on a stage. Or that was the attempt. Love Letters, a presentation of Performa 11 and the Swiss Institute, didnt really go there. It didnt really go anywhere.

title: In Andes, 2 Wrens Sing What Sounds Like a Solo
description: As plain-tailed wrens dart through Chusquea bamboo in the Andes, they can be heard singing a kind of song that no other bird is known to sing: a cooperative duet.

title: Should Joe Paterno Resign?
description: Jerry Sandusky, a former defensive coach for Joe Paterno at Penn State University, has been charged with 40 counts of sexually abusing children over 15 years, including during his tenure on Paternos staff. Tim Curley, the athletic director at Penn State, and Gary Schultz, an administrator at the university, have been charged with lying to a grand jury about what they had been told about Sanduskys behavior. (Curley has since taken an administrative leave and Schultz has retired.)

title: Fat Layer on Vocal Cords Gives Big Cats Their Roar
description: In the open savanna, a lions roar travels up to five miles, proclaiming the extent of its territory: If you can hear it, get out.

title: Matter of the Mind (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: In Touch With Patients (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: Osteoporosis Screening (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: Readers Photos: Godspell
description: A selection of readers photos of local productions of Godspell.

title: Horse Racing Par Avion
description: The three-time Breeders Cup winner Goldikova was unable to take home a fourth championship, but she is returning to France in style, nonetheless. After shipping from Churchill Downs to Chicago on Monday, Goldikova will fly home in a comfortable jet stall on Air France on Tuesday.

title: At Sony Music, a Plan to Dominate the Industry
description: A huge self-portrait of Bono hangs in the Madison Avenue office of Doug Morris, the new chief executive of Sony Music Entertainment, and on a nearby table sit his snapshots, arm-in-arm with Tupac Shakur and Snoop Dogg. Along with a determination to dominate the music industry, Mr. Morris brought them from his last job as head of the Universal Music Group.

title: On Election Day, the Candidates Have No Monopoly on Stress
description: Election Day is seldom associated with raging hormones. But three professors from Israel, where all politics is vocal, suggest that the very act of voting generates stress levels that could affect the outcome.

title: Tired of Feeling the Burn? Low-Acid Diet May Help
description: Stomach acid has long been blamed for acid reflux, heartburn and other ills. But now some experts are starting to think that the problems may lie not just in the acid coming up from the stomach but in the food going down.

title: Restored: Fading Account From the Heart of Africa
description: Researchers have rescued a 19th-century field diary by the Scottish missionary and explorer David Livingstone from literal obscurity, using 21st-century imaging and processing technology to make his writing legible after the ink had nearly vanished from the page.

title: For the Chosen Fliers, Security Check Is a Breeze
description: For the first time since 2001, travelers are going through airport security checkpoints with their shoes and jackets on, and without having to remove laptops from cases or adhere to rules like displaying carry-on liquids in containers of 3.4 ounces maximum, all packed in a single quart-size plastic bag.

title: Urban Life on a Bike
description: Michael Kimmelman considers New York from the vantage point of a bicycle seat.

title: Critics Picks Video: The Wild Bunch
description: In this weeks Critics Picks, A. O. Scott looks back at Sam Peckinpahs 1969 western The Wild Bunch. The film, which was controversial when it was released because of its violence, is sometimes thought of as a revisionist western  an effort to update a time-worn genre. But Mr. Scott sees it more as a terminal western, a final flowering of the dusty, epic spirit that had dominated American cinema in the 40s and 50s.

title: Tower Has Its Own Lawn, but Neighbors Still Look for Their Open Space
description: The view from the penthouse atop 144 North Eighth Street in Williamsburg, Brooklyn  the much-loathed finger building that by virtue of a fluke of timing and rezoning is far taller than its neighbors  goes on for miles.

title: Climate Change
description: To the Editor:

title: Euro Zone Urges Greek Parties to Commit to Bailout Terms
description: BRUSSELS  Greeces two main political parties have been told they must co-sign a letter pledging support for the countrys bailout terms in order to secure an 8 billion euro loan needed to stave off default, the head of the 17 euro zone finance ministers, Jean-Claude Juncker, said late Monday.

title: Is Death Row a Form of Psychological Torment?
description: To the Editor:

title: A Word on Andy Rooney
description: To the Editor:

title: Court Blocks Graphic Labels on Cigarette Packs
description: A federal judge on Monday blocked a Food and Drug Administration requirement that tobacco companies put big new graphic warning labels on cigarette packages by next September.

title: Reflections on Self-Improvement
description: My Shortcuts column on Saturday, Pursuing Self-Improvement, at the Risk of Self- Acceptance, looked at the notion, embedded in American culture, that we should constantly strive to make ourselves better. I talked to several experts who noted that there are limits to self-improvement, including one who found that mothers who were constantly striving to be the best at everything were often unhappier than those who accepted being good enough.

title: Giving Up on Math and Science Careers
description: To the Editor:

title: 26.2 Miles, 46 Sketches
description: My attempt at live-illustrating the New York City Marathon.

title: Justices Will Hear 2 Cases of Life Sentences for Youths
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to hear a pair of cases on whether sentencing young teenagers involved in killings to die in prison violates the Eighth Amendments ban on cruel and unusual punishment.

title: Head of Googles Public Policy Operations Resigns
description: Updated 8:20 p.m.: Added more detail on Googles lobbying spending.

title: U.S. Attorney in Brooklyn Names New Criminal Chief
description: The United States attorneys office in the Eastern District of New York will have a new criminal division chief.

title: Pre-Election Liberia Protests Turn Violent
description: MONROVIA, Liberia  Hundreds of protesters clashed with the police and United Nations peacekeepers here in the Liberian capital on Monday afternoon, leaving at least one person dead the day before a presidential runoff that the opposition has vowed to boycott.

title: A Reputation Lies in Tatters
description: STATE COLLEGE, Pa.  With his thick-framed glasses and rolled-up pant legs, Coach Joe Paterno has long been the public face of Penn State. But a driving force behind the on-field identity of many Nittany Lions football teams was Jerry Sandusky.

title: A Camera With a Phone for a Viewfinder
description: The Samsung SH100 camera is remotely interesting. That is, the most interesting thing about it is the remote.

title: The Blooey Factor
description: A thought before tomorrows markets open in Europe: might we be seeing Italy go careening off the edge in the next few days? I mean, even more than it has?

title: Americas Unnecessary Secrets
description: Washington

title: Marathon App Doesnt Go the Distance
description: Its an event designed to showcase and test the human spirit. But Sundays New York City Marathon also proved to be a test of human patience. Specifically for those who purchased the Official ING New York City Marathon Mobile Spectator App.

title: U.S. Clears Art Project by Christo in Colorado
description: DENVER  Federal regulators on Monday approved a $50 million installation of anchored fabric over the Arkansas River in southern Colorado by the artist Christo, whose larger-than-life vision has divided environmentalists, residents and politicians for years over questions of aesthetics, nature and economic impact.

title: Murdoch-Owned Tabloid Had Lawyers Investigating Phone Hacking Followed
description: The News of the World hired a detective to spy on two lawyers representing victims in the News Corporations phone-hacking scandal, and the lawyers families, Rupert Murdochs British newspaper group confirmed Monday.

title: Wall St. Pay Expected to Fall 20% to 30%
description: Wall Street bonuses are set to fall by an average of 20 to 30 percent this year from a year ago, according to a closely watched compensation survey. It would be the weakest bonus season since the financial crisis and a reflection of the leaner times confronting the industry.

title: End Bonuses for Bankers
description: I HAVE a solution for the problem of bankers who take risks that threaten the general public: Eliminate bonuses.

title: Ex-Lair of Tyrant, Now Just Any Place
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  Toothpaste and moisturizing cream, aftershave, shoes, sheep and dogs, pigeons, toilet plungers and bicycle pumps now populate the once-forbidden grounds that were the Brother Leaders private domain, a sudden reversal of fortune that must rank with the Sack of Rome in its completeness. Up to five months ago anyone lingering near the Bab al-Aziziya complex, much less trying to buy a mattress there, could expect arrest.

title: New Way to Tally Poor Recasts View of Poverty
description: WASHINGTON  The Census Bureau on Monday released what it says is a more accurate measure of poverty in America. The new measure shows more poverty among the elderly, but less among children and African-Americans.

title: Penn State President Facing Calls for Ouster
description: Among university presidents, Graham B. Spanier is known for having an unusually close rapport with students at Penn State: entertaining them with magic tricks; teaching a leadership class; even stepping in as the school mascot, the Nittany Lion.

title: China Tries to Add Cultural Clout to Economic Muscle
description: BEIJING  Last month, the cream of the Communist Party leadership gathered here to proclaim a national effort to make China a cultural tastemaker, one whose global creative influence matches its economic clout. A nation cannot stand among great powers, the official party newspaper Peoples Daily said on its front page, without its peoples spiritual affluence and the nations full expression of its creativity.

title: This Grisly Find? A Bear Paw, It Turns Out. (It Happens a Lot.)
description: The discovery was unnerving, to say the least. A severed limb found Sunday evening in a yard in Rosedale, Queens, appeared to be the foot of a young child.

title: Handling Waves and Young Rivals, Slater Wins Another Title
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Just 10 events into the 11-stop schedule, Kelly Slater clinched his 11th world title, at the Rip Curl Search San Francisco. He proved that at 39, he is still surfings most dominant force after a year in which he occasionally wavered on making a full-time commitment to the tour.

title: Big Ratings for Big Game
description: Louisiana States 9-6 overtime victory against Alabama on Saturday night was seen by an average of 20 million viewers, the most for a college football game on CBS since 1989, when 22.5 million viewers watched Miami defeat Notre Dame, 27-10.

title: Britain: Tabloid Spied on Lawyers, Newspaper Company Confirms
description: The News of the World hired a detective to spy on two lawyers representing victims in the phone-hacking scandal and their families, Rupert Murdochs British newspaper group confirmed Monday. The detective, Derek Webb, told the BBC he had been commissioned in 2010 to follow Mark Lewis and Charlotte Harris, lawyers who represented multiple clients who claimed that The News of the World, since closed, had illegally intercepted their voicemail. The BBC, citing internal newspaper documents, said the company hoped to prove that the lawyers were romantically involved, which could have forced them to decline further phone-hacking cases. News International, the British arm of Mr. Murdochs newspaper chain, said in a statement that though the surveillance was not illegal, it was clearly deeply inappropriate in these circumstances, and that no current executive had condoned it.

title: Surgery for Rangers Wolski
description: Forward Wojtek Wolski will have surgery Tuesday to repair a sports hernia and is expected to be out for four weeks, the Rangers announced. Wolski, a seven-year veteran acquired from Phoenix last season for defenseman Michal Rozsival, has two assists in six games this season. He has missed six games because of the injury, including the last two.

title: A Wedding Planner Has Many Big Days, and Flights
description: IM a big shuttle guy, usually traveling from Boston to New York City, Washington, Palm Beach or Miami. So I dont have those long flights where I can really unwind after producing an event. Plus, in the busy season, I usually have to get to Cape Cod about three times a week from Boston. Thats a puddle jumper flight, so theres not much time to do anything.

title: Wall Streets Repeat Violations, Despite Repeated Promises
description: Many big Wall Street firms have settled fraud cases brought by the government with a promise to never violate the same law. But an analysis of Securities and Exchange Commission documents by The New York Times found that since 1996, there have been at least 51 repeat violations by those firms. Bank of America and Citigroup have each had six repeat violations, while Merrill Lynch and UBS have each had five.

title: Houston Overcomes Obstacle to Reach Final
description: KANSAS CITY, Kan.  Losing one of your most experienced veterans in the first half, especially one who led the league in assists during the regular season, is not usually part of theplan to win an M.L.S. playoff game  or any game, for that matter.

title: The Molester Next Door
description: The longest, most exhaustively researched article I ever wrote for a newspaper or magazine was about a child molester who had sexually abused a little boy living down the street. The abuse went on for more than two years, beginning when the boy was 10.

title: G.O.P. Field Attacks Obama Foreign Policy With Tough Talk on Iran
description: As United Nations inspectors prepare to unveil a new report on Irans nuclear capabilities, some Republican presidential candidates have taken increasingly forceful tones on the issue, saying they would sanction or consider supporting an attack on Irans nuclear program by either Israel or the United States.

title: In Mayors Contest for a New Engineering School, Only One Judge Counts
description: Midway through a third term marked by budget-cutting and a series of political and managerial setbacks, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg and members of his inner circle are increasingly focused on the competition they created to build a high-tech graduate school in New York City, which many of them believe could become a major part of his legacy.

title: With Eyes on First, Jets Sweated Giants Win
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  When the Jets flight from Buffalo landed Sunday at Newark Liberty International Airport, the clock read 1:36. Not in New Jersey, but in Foxborough, Mass.

title: Q&A: Stopping Mobile Text Ads
description: Q.

title: High Bank Fees Give Wal-Mart a Money Aisle
description: DICKSON CITY, Pa.  Americans say they are fed up with banks. They are protesting on Wall Street and raising a ruckus over outsize fees. Now there is a surprising beneficiary: Wal-Mart.

title: The Serious One
description: In the Marx Brothers movie that is the Republican presidential race, Mitt Romney is Zeppo. He doesnt spin out one-liners. Hes not the rambunctious one. Hes just the earnest, good-looking guy who wants to be appreciated.

title: Library President Charged With D.W.I.
description: Anthony Marx, the president of the New York Public Library, was arrested on drunken-driving charges on Sunday after the library-owned car he was driving backed into a parked vehicle in Upper Manhattan, the police said.

title: Dispute Over Jerusalem Engages Court
description: WASHINGTON  The justices seemed divided during arguments on Monday over whether the Supreme Court should wade into a dispute between Congress and the executive branch over the status of Jerusalem.

title: A Mother Fights the Past, for the Future
description: When Jeanette Rivera, 29, gets excited, her hands pinwheel, her sentences tumble and her voice nearly squeaks.

title: Sharing Catches On at Airports
description: For years, frustrated air travelers have wondered why they had to sit on the tarmac waiting for a gate to open up when they could see empty gates outside the planes windows.

title: For McNamara, a Final Out That Wasnt Meant to Be
description: The former manager, now 79 years old, watched the World Series at his home outside Nashville. John McNamara would see the veteran baseball men on the screen and remember them in their athletic primes, when they wore the same uniform as he did.

title: Gilded Blinders to the Reality of a Collapse
description: Our mayor encompasses multitudes.

title: N.B.A. Players Face Choices, None Too Appealing
description: Thirty players, the designated union representatives for their N.B.A. teams, will gather Tuesday afternoon in Manhattan to mull their negotiating options  none of them particularly attractive.

title: A Greek Political Scion Undone by Economics
description: ATHENS  George Andreas Papandreou, elected prime minister of Greece in 2009, is a son and grandson of popular former prime ministers. But two years later, with Greece on the verge of default and a possible exit from the euro, not even the Papandreou name could save him.

title: A Seasoned Combatant of Tornadoes Now Finds the Earth Is Moving, Too
description: SHAWNEE, Okla  The Rt. Rev. Lawrence R. Stasyszen, the chancellor of St. Gregorys University here, gazed up at the damage inflicted this weekend by the most violent earthquake ever recorded in Oklahoma and found a teachable moment.

title: Its Leader on Sidelines, Regulator Faces Biggest Test in MF Global
description: A few days before MF Globals collapse, regulators stationed at the firm were assured its books were in order.

title: Voters Head to the Polls in an Array of Local Races
description: Voters in New York Citys suburbs and upstate will decide on Tuesday in numerous local elections who they believe is best suited to create jobs and face challenging budgets in an election season colored by the bleak economy.

title: Reyes Looms as Giants Get Cabrera From Royals
description: The San Francisco Giants, one of the teams believed to be in the running for the free-agent shortstop Jose Reyes, made a preliminary move to aid their lineup Monday, dealing Jonathan Sanchez and the minor league pitcher Ryan Verdugo to the Kansas City Royals for Melky Cabrera.

title: Big Paydays in a Merger
Memory Lapse
description: Memory is nothing else than a certain concatenation of ideasBaruch Spinoza, Ethics

title: Behind the Woes at H.P., Wall St. Banks Lurk
description: How much would you pay for advice that turned out to be questionable? Would about $81 million sound unreasonable?

title: In Tebow Debate, a Clash of Faith and Football
description: Tim Tebow is an N.F.L. quarterback, and Tim Tebow is an outspoken Christian. And while quarterback controversies are almost as common as quarterbacks, who play perhaps the most scrutinized position in American sports, what has erupted around Tebow this season is altogether different.

title: The Worlds Largest Sandbox
description: If it bleeds, it leads, goes the journalistic dictum. But the reverse is also true, which is why, through all the millions of words published in the last nine months about Libya, youve never heard of UNASOG, the United Nations Aouzou Strip Observation Group. Stuck along the Libyan-Chadian border, the 1994 peacekeeping mission has neither suffered casualties nor inflicted any, but it does have one particular claim to fame: at a duration of only one month, with a mere nine observers and a $64,000 price tag, it is reputed [1] to have been the United Nationss shortest, smallest and cheapest peacekeeping mission ever.

title: Woman Accuses Cain of Groping; He Denies Charge
description: Putting a face and a name for the first time to accusations of sexual harassment against the Republican presidential candidate Herman Cain, a woman stepped forward on Monday to say that Mr. Cain made an unwanted physical advance on her 14 years ago when he was the chief of the National Restaurant Association.

title: Showdown in the Atlantic
description: The Old Bahama Channel, lying between the Bahamas and the northern coast of Cuba, must have seemed worlds away from the deepening hostilities of the American Civil War on Nov. 8, 1861. Yet for a short while around noon that day, it would become the wars most important battleground.

title: Teaching With the Enemy
description: Last month, Randi Weingarten held a book party for Steven Brill, the veteran journalist and entrepreneur who had just published Class Warfare: Inside the Fight to Fix Americas Schools, his vivid account of the rise of the school reform movement. When Brill told me this recently, I nearly fell out of my chair. Weingarten, you see, is the president of the American Federation of Teachers, and for much of his book, Brill treats Weingarten the way reformers always treat her and her union: as the enemy.

title: Staring Into the Budgets Abyss
description: Republicans, looking for leverage to slash federal spending, created the phony debt-ceiling crisis that led to creation of the Congressional deficit-cutting supercommittee. But with the committee close to a deadlock  largely because Republicans will not agree to higher taxes on the rich  and the deadline for an agreement approaching, some Republicans are now talking about undoing the process.

title: Who Gets to Vote?
description: Next November more than 5 million Americans will not be allowed to vote because of a criminal conviction in their past. Nearly 4 million of these people are not in prison, yet they remain disenfranchised for years, often for decades and sometimes for life.

title: Bad Theory, Bad Legislation
description: The Houses campaign to undercut environmental laws has now migrated to the Senate. Rand Paul, a Republican of Kentucky, is expected to offer a resolution this week to block a new federal regulation requiring cuts in soot- and smog-forming gases from power plants east of the Mississippi River. Joe Manchin III, a Democrat of West Virginia, and Dan Coats, an Indiana Republican, are then expected to try to delay all new rules governing power-plant pollution.

title: In Turmoil, Greece and Italy Deepen Euro Crisis
description: ROME  With political turmoil still plaguing Greece and descending upon the much larger economy of Italy on Monday, the fate of the euro and market stability worldwide hinged on whether two of Europes most tangled and unresponsive political cultures could deal with their tightening fiscal gridlock.

title: Good First Half Is Nothing New for Giants; Neither Is Worse Second Half
description: The Giants hit the midway point of their regular season Sunday by rallying for a victory over the New England Patriots that was so stirring that their beaming 65-year-old coach, Tom Coughlin, actually allowed running back Brandon Jacobs to pick him up for six seconds in the locker room afterward before carefully placing him back down.

title: Imagining Local Roads as the Scene of a Race
description: It might seem unlikely, the notion of turning a stretch of local streets in New Jersey  peppered with speed bumps, traffic and stoplights  into a Formula One racecourse.

title: Frustration in Connecticut as Wait for Power Drags On
description: NEWTOWN, Conn.  It is not that Roger Sprung has gotten used to 10 days and nights in the dark at the end of his narrow 1,200-foot-long, dirt driveway in this sprawling Fairfield County town.

title: Special Parking Rules
description: Because of Election Day and Id al-Adha, the Islamic Feast of Sacrifice, alternate-side street-cleaning regulations will be suspended on Tuesday in New York City. Other regulations will remain in effect.

title: A Vision of Spirituality Returns to Broadway
description: Go easy on the caffeine if youre heading to the Broadway revival of Godspell that opened on Monday night at the Circle in the Square. The cast of this relentlessly perky production of the 1971 musical, which transformed parables from the Gospels into a series of singable teaching moments, virtually never stops bopping, bouncing, bounding, even trampolining across the stage and up the aisles of the theater. Its like being trapped in a summer camp rec room with a bunch of kids who have been a little too reckless with the Red Bull.

title: Lottery Numbers
Tuesday: Cookie With Creme in the Middle
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  Some constructors like to hang out in certain parts of the week. Im an early-week constructor, although Ive also made my share of Sunday puzzles. I hang out in those parts because Im so attached to the process of theme development, and frankly, Im just not that great at stacking quads.

title: For Birthplace of Hip-Hop, New Life
description: After a long struggle, ownership of a Bronx building known as the birthplace of hip-hop, which had fallen into neglect and foreclosure, was taken over on Monday by a group that specializes in preserving working-class housing.

title: A Gridiron Family: The Star Quarterback Is Just Daddys Little Girl
description: Not so long ago, for a reviewer to compare a work of theater to a television show would have been a sign of obvious displeasure. Thats hardly the case anymore, as the cable stations have pushed the series form forward artistically and the networks have scrambled to follow suit. So when I say that Julia Brownells play All-American reminded me in many ways of the superlative NBC show Friday Night Lights, which ended its five-season run this year, I certainly mean it as a compliment.

title: Man Is Convicted in the Rape and Harassment of Women
description: A man from Ivory Coast who convinced several women in Manhattan to go on dates with him by claiming he was a renowned international journalist was convicted on Monday of raping one of them and harassing and stalking others.

title: The F.D.A. Ups Its Numbers
description: The Food and Drug Administration recently reported that in the last fiscal year it had approved 35 new drugs, a near-record for the decade, of which 24 were approved here before they were approved in any other country. The new report is consistent with a similar finding in June by independent analysts that new cancer drugs were approved in greater numbers and faster times in the United States than in Europe between 2003 and 2010.

title: Lavin Era Begins Next Phase, With Lavin at Home
description: St. Johns began a new era for its basketball program last year, with the newly installed coach Steve Lavin pacing the sideline with his slick hair and quick tongue. The excitement Lavin injected into the Red Storm was palpable in that first season, but the real Lavin era  with nearly an entirely new roster of his choosing  did not tip off until Monday night at Carnesecca Arena. Lavin, however, was not in the building with the 4,142 fans.

title: All That Glimmers
description: Gold has had a remarkable ride  doubling in price over the last three years, as investors who lost faith in equities and bonds piled into the stuff. Conservative politicians are even more bullish, pushing gold to replace the dollar and get the government out of the business of managing the economy. It has been money for 6,000 years, Representative Ron Paul, a Republican presidential candidate, told the Federal Reserve chairman, Ben Bernanke, during Congressional hearings in July. Its an economic law. Other Republicans, including Newt Gingrich and Herman Cain, have hinted that they might also like to peg the dollar to gold, which would limit the growth of money in the economy to the growth of gold in reserve, stopping the Fed from printing more dollars.

title: Ivory Soap Refreshes Its Ads and Its Look, but Is Resolutely Simple
description: PROCTER & GAMBLE is bringing one of its oldest and one of its most known brands, Ivory soap, into the 21st century with new packaging, advertising and social media initiatives.

title: G.O.P. Talks of Limiting Tax Breaks
description: WASHINGTON  Republican members of a Congressional panel seeking ways to cut the federal budget deficit indicated on Monday that they might allow some additional tax revenue as part of a deal with Democrats.

title: Promises Made, and Remade, by Firms in S.E.C. Fraud Cases
description: WASHINGTON  When Citigroup agreed last month to pay $285 million to settle civil charges that it had defrauded customers during the housing bubble, the Securities and Exchange Commission wrested a typical pledge from the company: Citigroup would never violate one of the main antifraud provisions of the nations securities laws.

title: Senate Acts on 2 Pieces of Proposal on Hiring
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate on Monday cleared the way for a measure that would repeal a tax withholding program on government contractors and provide tax incentives for companies that hire veterans, making them the first pieces of President Obamas jobs plan to gain some momentum in Congress.

title: California Dispensaries Moving to Block U.S. Marijuana Crackdown
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Lawyers for the medical marijuana industry said on Monday that they would seek court orders to halt a threatened federal crackdown on marijuana dispensaries, their landlords and marijuana growers.

title: Australian Senate Approves Emissions Trading Plan
description: SYDNEY, Australia  The upper house of Australias Parliament on Tuesday approved the governments proposal to adopt an ambitious emissions trading program, marking the end of a prolonged political battle that the business community has watched anxiously and that dragged Prime Minister Julia Gillards public approval ratings to historic lows.

title: Theadora Van Runkle, Costume Designer, Dies at 83
description: Theadora Van Runkle, a self-taught costume designer who earned an Oscar nomination for her first picture, Bonnie and Clyde, and whose signature outfit for Faye Dunaways Bonnie Parker  beret, calf-length skirt and sweater  ignited a fashion trend on the films release in 1967, died on Friday in Los Angeles. She was 83.

title: Should Voting Be Mandatory?
Word of the Day | prevaricate
description: prevaricate \pri-ver--kat, -va-r-\ verb

title: Racing Weehawken
description: A reporter takes a 2007 Chevy Malibu through its paces on the recently announced 2013 Formula One race course in Weehawken and West New York, New Jersey.

title: Texas: Court Halts Execution of Henry Skinner
description: The states highest criminal court on Monday stopped the execution of a man who claims that DNA tests of evidence will prove his innocence. The inmate, Henry Skinner, who was convicted in 1995 of murdering his girlfriend and her two sons and was scheduled to be executed on Wednesday, has fought for the tests for 10 years. His lawyers had not requested DNA testing on all the evidence available at trial out of fears that the results would go against him. After the state enacted a broad postconviction DNA testing law in 2001, Mr. Skinner began a string of appeals that reached the United States Supreme Court. The Texas Court of Criminal Appeals on Monday cited recent changes in Texas law on DNA testing, and said it would be prudent to fully review the changes in the statute as they pertain to this case.

title: Olympus Hid Investing Losses in Big Merger Payouts
description: TOKYO  Olympus said Tuesday that more than $1 billion in merger payouts were used to hide years of losses on investments, an acknowledgment that is an abrupt about-face for the company, which had denied any wrongdoing in the wake of a widening scandal.

title: Vermont: New Bridge Opens
description: A new Lake Champlain Bridge, between Addison, Vt., and Crown Point, N.Y., opened Monday after a two-year replacement project. The previous 80-year-old bridge was deemed unsafe in October 2009 and demolished two months later, leaving the 3,400 drivers who used the bridge daily to take a ferry or roundabout routes to cross between the two states. Gov. Peter Shumlin of Vermont and Lt. Gov. Robert Duffy of New York attended the ribbon-cutting for the $70 million bridge.

title: $71 Million in Art Is Sold at Phillips, Near Low Estimate
description: Perhaps it was the wobbly economy or high estimates, or it could just have been that collectors were saving up for the next two nights, when the auction giants Sothebys and Christies hold their fancier postwar and contemporary art sales.

title: Cuba Takes Lead Role in Haitis Cholera Fight
description: MIREBALAIS, Haiti  The family from a nearby village arrived at the small hospital here vomiting and with uncontrollable diarrhea, at first glance maybe a typical case of consuming bad food or water.

title: Joe Frazier, Ex-Heavyweight Champ, Dies at 67
description: Joe Frazier, the former heavyweight champion whose furious and intensely personal fights with a taunting Muhammad Ali endure as an epic rivalry in boxing history, died Monday night at his home in Philadelphia. He was 67.

title: Journalists Overhear Private Exchange Between Obama and Sarkozy, Report Says
description: It marks another chapter in the close, if occasionally awkward, relationship between President Obama and President Nicolas Sarkozy of France. After the two leaders appeared together at a news conference during a G20 summit meeting in Cannes last Thursday, they retired to a room for what they thought was a private conversation.

title: Numberplay: The White Halloween Horror
A Champion Who Won Inside the Ring and Out
description: Some people mean more together than they do apart, whatever the stage. Churchill and Hitler. Bogart and Bacall. Ali and Frazier. And for all the deserved accolades for Muhammad Ali, Ive always believed that each at his best, Joe Frazier, who died Monday night at age 67, was the better fighter. And the better man.

title: A Heartburn-Free Thanksgiving
description: If you think heartburn and Thanksgiving always go together, think again. Choosing the right foods and being careful not to overeat can put you well on your way to a heartburn-free holiday.

title: For Christmas, J.C. Penney Ads Emphasize Fun and Frugality
description: You do not need to know Whos your daddy, J. C. Penney declares in its Christmas 2011 advertising campaign, as long as you know Whos your Santa!

title: Newswallah: In the English-Language Press Tuesday
description: A committee formed by the Union government to address residents safety concerns about the Kudankulam nuclear power project is planning to meet the Tamil Nadu government on Tuesday, and the former president, A.P.J. Abdul Kalam, has developed a 40-page special development plan for villages surrounding the project site following his visit to the plant (The Hindu). The $40 million plan includes connecting villages within a radius of about 19 miles to nearby highways with four-lane roads, the creation of industries around the project site that employ 10,000 and self-employment loans for young entrepreneurs.

title: Corrections: November 8
description: FRONT PAGE

title: NYT Front Page for 11/08/2011
description: NYT Front Page for 11/08/2011

title: Looking Back at the Life of a Boxing Great
description: Joe Frazier, former heavyweight champion and rival of Muhammad Ali, died Monday at 67.

title: Top Obama Aide, Under Pressure, Relinquishes Some Duties
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas chief of staff, William M. Daley, has turned over some of his day-to-day management responsibilities to another senior aide, Pete Rouse, according to several officials with knowledge of the change. The shift comes after a turbulent period in which the White House has struggled with a weak economy and a hostile Congress.

title: Cain, on Late-Night Television, Speaks to Accusations
description: Herman Cain used the forum of late-night television to confront the latest accusation of sexual impropriety against him, which was leveled on Monday by a woman who said Mr. Cain had made advances 14 years ago when she sought his help in finding a job.

title: At the G-20, Small Victories for India
description: History is being written in Cannes, trumpeted billboards around the Mediterranean resort city when world leaders met there last week. And it was, though not as the French might have hoped.Nicolas Sarkozy had no lesser ambition when France assumed the presidency of the Group of 20 last year than to oversee a complete overhaul of the international monetary system. His ambitions were dashed by the European debt crisis and a failure by the advanced economies to provide solutions for a global economic crisis largely of their making.

title: News Quiz | Nov. 8, 2011
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper.

title: In Turmoil, Greece and Italy Deepen Euro Crisis
description: ROME  With political turmoil still plaguing Greece and descending upon the much larger economy of Italy, the fate of the euro and market stability worldwide hinged Tuesday on whether two of Europes most tangled and unresponsive political cultures could deal with their tightening fiscal gridlock.

title: Nov. 8, 1960 | Kennedy Is Elected President
description: On Nov. 8, 1960, Senator John F. Kennedy of Massachusetts defeated Vice President Richard M. Nixon for the presidency in one of the closest and most contentious elections in American history. Mr. Kennedy would end up defeating Mr. Nixon by just 0.1 percent in the popular vote, and the results of the election were still uncertain on Tuesday night.

title: South Korea Approves Sending Medical Aid to the North
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Korea on Tuesday authorized the World Health Organization to resume the distribution of medical aid to North Korea, financed by the South Korean government, amid growing international calls for assistance for malnourished North Korean children.

title: The True Measure of a Pass-Heavy Offense
description: The popular perception is that the Green Bay Packers are great because of Aaron Rodgers and the passing offense. And for good reason: Rodgers (and by extension, the entire Green Bay passing offense) is on a record-breaking pace. Rodgers leads the league in completion percentage, touchdowns, touchdown percentage, yards per attempt, adjusted net yards per attempt and adjusted yards per attempt. Hes averaging 11.2 adjusted yards per attempt, the highest mark after a teams first eight games of any quarterback in over 50 years.

title: Verdict: Guilty
description: WHO was found guilty on charges related to the death of Michael Jackson?

title: Passers-By, Preoccupied
description: Growing up in New York as a street photographer, I knew I always had to be aware of my surroundings. Id scan the sidewalks not only to look for the perfect moment, but also to avoid any problems that could blindside me.

title: How to Save Money on Train Trips in Italy
description: Taking a train has always been one of the most economical, and easiest, ways to travel around Italy. And thanks to promotions from Italys main train operator, Trenitalia, taking the train just got even cheaper.

title: Test Yourself | English, Nov. 8, 2011
description: The question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the article, Sleep Medication: Mothers New Little Helper.

title: Societe Generale Profit Falls 31% in Third Quarter
description: PARIS  Socit Gnrale said on Tuesday that its third-quarter net profit fell by nearly a third, weighed down by the cost of writing down its exposure to Greece.

title: Have You Experienced Sexual Harassment?
description: A new national survey found that nearly half of students in 7th through 12th grades experienced sexual harassment  defined as unwelcome sexual behavior that takes place in person or electronically  in the past year. Have you experienced sexual harassment in any way? What, if anything, do you think can and should be done to address it?

title: With Profit Down 19%, Toyota Withdraws Its Forecast
description: TOKYO  Just as Toyota has seemed to find its footing after the devastating earthquake and tsunami in Japan, a painful jump in the yen is weighing on quarterly profit and a shortage of parts from flooded suppliers in Thailand has led the company to scrap its outlook.

title: Roadside Bomb Kills 11 in Western Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Afghan officials said Tuesday that insurgents once again attacked during the Id al-Adha holiday, killing 11 people, most of them civilians.

title: Part 2: Answers to Your Questions on Applying with a Learning Disability
description: Marybeth Kravets is fielding questions this week on The Choice about applying to college with a learning disability, the subject of my column published over the weekend in The Timess Education Life supplement.

title: Driving the Rolls-Royce 102EX Phantom Experimental Electric
description: Rolls-Royce found 2,700 buyers worldwide for its Phantom and Ghost models last year. And to hear company executives tell it, roughly 2,699 of them are perfectly content with their V-12 gasoline engines. But that hasnt stopped the 102EX, a 6,000-pound, all-electric version of the brands Phantom sedan, from barnstorming around the globe. It brought its nearly silent stump speech to Manhattan on Monday.

title: The Early Word: Accusations
description: Todays Times

title: Can the Fed Stimulate Growth or Only Inflation?
description: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of the coming book The Benefit and the Burden.

title: As Syria Hits City, U.N. Says Toll Climbs
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  More than 3,500 Syrians have been killed in a crackdown by the government of President Bashar al-Assad on an uprising that has persisted for eight months, the United Nations said Tuesday, as the government pressed its assault on Homs, the city where the uprising has demonstrated its greatest strength.

title: Linnaeus Tripes 19th Century India
description: On Nov. 15, Sothebys in London will auction off some of the earliest photographs ever taken in India, which have been out of public view for more than a century. The collection of more than 220 images from India and Burma, taken by Linnaeus Tripe shortly before the first war of independence in 1857, is unusual both for its content and its provenance.

title: Whats Behind Dynegys Unusual Bankruptcy
description: A big piece of Dynegy, the company that once tried to save Enron from bankruptcy, has entered Chapter 11 bankruptcy.

title: What Can Happen When You Try to Go Big
description: In my last post, Carissa Reiniger, a member of our business group and founder of Silver Lining Limited, described the missteps that left her $410,000 in debt by early 2008. We pick up her story here, as she explained it to the group.

title: Profit Slumps 22% at Lloyds Banking Group
description: LONDON  The Lloyds Banking Group reported on Tuesday that third-quarter pretax profit fell 22 percent, to 644 million, from the period a year earlier, and the bank said it was unlikely to meet its financial goals by the end of 2014.

title: On the Streets, Discovering the Voice of the City
description: I have a fancy that every city has a voice. Each one has something to say to the one who can hear it.  O. Henry

title: Breakfast Meeting, Nov. 8
description: The guilty verdict in the trial of Dr. Conrad Murray, Michael Jacksons doctor, was covered live on Monday by HLN, CNN, Fox News and MSNBC, Variety reported. The Big Four broadcasters broke in with special reports, with Diane Sawyer anchoring for ABC, Harry Smith for NBC, Scott Pelley for CBS, and Bill Hemmer anchoring for Fox stations, it wrote, while taking note of a very special absence, the HLN anchor Nancy Grace:

title: TV Watch: Cain Charts New TV Territory in Dealing With Charges
description: When I made the statement that Im done talking about it, I was talking about the firestorm last week. That is how Herman Cain on Monday explained why he was addressing a fresh accusation of sexual harassment on the ABC late night show, Jimmy Kimmel Live!

title: The Case for Not Paying Matt Forte
description: Brian Burke of Advanced NFL Stats had a suggestionfor the Titans in August, when the team was locked in a contract dispute with running back Chris Johnson: Take the $12 million per year, put it into your offensive line, and draft a couple 4th round RBs. Youll thank me later.

title: The G.O.P. Campaign Goes On Unnoticed
description: The biggest surprise in the Republican presidential campaign? That its still going on, despite the news media frenzy surrounding Herman Cain.

title: Ranking Historys Atrocities by Counting the Corpses
description: Browsing the bookstore shelves can pose its grim challenges for the ordinary mortal. The reproachful cover of 1,000 Places to See Before You Die is bad enough. Theres also 100 Birds to See Before You Die, 100 Belgian Beers to Try Before You Die! and 1,001 Video Games You Must Play Before You Die. Make your way through 50 Places to Play Golf Before You Die and youre still not done: 50 More Places to Play Golf Before You Die is staring right at you.

title: Getting Names Wrong
description: Notes from the newsroom on grammar, usage and style. (Some frequently asked questions are here.)

title: Getting Names Wrong
description: Notes from the newsroom on grammar, usage and style. (Some frequently asked questions are here.)

title: PPR Acquires Italian Suit Maker Brioni
description: LONDON  The French luxury goods group PPR said on Tuesday that it had reached an agreement to buy the Italian mens fashion brand Brioni for an undisclosed price.

title: Tapping the Tappan Zee for Wind
description: Replacing the Tappan Zee Bridge, which carries the New York State Thruway across the Hudson River between Westchester and Rockland Counties, is expected to be one of the biggest infrastructure projects in the New York region in coming years. Some experts have suggested including some green features, like tracks for commuter trains or a bus rapid transit lane.

title: Russian Lessons
description: MOSCOW  The university is no place for spreading leaflets or shouting out slogans.

title: Opinion Report: The Gold Standard
description: From the editorial page

title: Mississippi Voters Reject Anti-Abortion Measure
description: Voters turned a skeptical eye toward conservative-backed measures across the country Tuesday, rejecting an anti-labor law in Ohio, an anti-abortion measure in Mississippi and a crackdown on voting rights in Maine.

title: Political Tensions Dampen Liberias Runoff Vote
description: MONROVIA, Liberia  President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf, who won the Nobel Peace Prize this year for helping to stabilize her country after years of conflict, was poised to win a second term in an uncontested presidential runoff on Tuesday.

title: Nokias Comeback Strategy in Smartphones
description: The challenge Nokia faces in the smartphone market was grimly detailed last week. In the third quarter, according to IDC, Nokias worldwide smartphone sales fell 37 percent to 16.8 million phones from 26.5 million a year ago.

title: Credit Suisse to Turn Over Data on Some U.S. Accounts
description: 11:31 a.m. | Updated

title: Morning Take-Out
description: Wall St. Bonuses Expected to Fall 20% to 30% | Wall Street bonuses are set to fall by an average of 20 to 30 percent this year from a year ago, according to a closely watched compensation survey. It would be the weakest bonus season since the financial crisis and a reflection of the leaner times confronting the industry.

title: Trouble for a Library Chief and for a Tappan Zee Protester
description: For more local news, including a look at Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg as the deciding judge on which of seven engineering school proposals will be accepted, a severed bears limb that was mistaken for human in Queens and New Jersey streets as a Formula One race course, see the N.Y./Region section.

title: Tweed Protesters Denounce 'Privatization' of Schools
Students Say Sexual Harassment Is Pervasive in Schools
The Get | Herms Collier de Chien Bracelet
description: The latest and most extreme-slash-sparkly-slash-jaw-dropping addition to Herms signature Collier de Chien series is this: a studded rose gold cuff fully encased in brown diamonds. Introduced by the companys artistic director for jewelry, Pierre Hardy, as part of the houses Haute Bijouterie collection, the significant cuff comes in at 30 carats. O.K., so maybe a high-res image is as close as were going to get to this piece, but look (and dream) all you like. Or better yet, add it to your holiday wish list and see what happens.

title: Fired From a Shelter After Photographing the Animals
description: Photography was not part of Emily Tanens job description at the Manhattan branch of Animal Care and Control of New York City. But soon after she started working there in August 2009, she began taking photos of animals who were scheduled to be euthanized.

title: In the Flooded Thai Capital, Residents Are Now Refugees
description: BANGKOK  At the flood-ravaged Don Muang airport, children play with luggage carts while their parents hang laundry above check-in counters. The signs read Departures, but the families camped out at the airport will not be leaving anytime soon.

title: Everybody Laugh: Sarah Silverman Sings Broadway
description: As if to compensate for last weeks announcement that a new revival of Funny Girl wont be coming to Broadway any time soon, the universe delivered a different funny girl to Broadway  or at least to its general vicinity  to surprise us with a few selections from her personal songbook.

title: European Debt Crisis as Berlusconis Last Stand
description: ROME  The European debt crisis appeared to claim its most prominent victim on Tuesday when Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi of Italy, cornered by world markets and humiliated by a parliamentary setback, pledged to resign after Italys Parliament passes austerity measures demanded by the European Union.

title: Tuesday Reading: Hospitals Now Seek Patient Approval
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

title: Vain Glorious | Sisleys First Scent for Men
description: Who: Sisley

title: Markets Turn Higher After Berlusconi Offers to Resign
description: Stocks gyrated Tuesday before ending higher on a day of significant political developments in Italy, the latest country to come under fire in the drawn-out euro zone debt crisis.

title: What Were Reading
description: Food Safety News: A study found that three-quarters of the honey bought in groceries had no pollen, indicating that it had been ultrafiltered so its origin couldnt be traced. Safety advocates fear that much of it could have come from China, which has been a source of contaminated honey. The F.D.A. says honey without pollen isnt honey.  Nick Fox

title: States Versus Countries, Rodrik Edition
description: Dani Rodrik has just posted on the same subject I briefly addressed yesterday  why arent US states subject to the same stresses facing European nations? He asks, Why is the bankruptcy of the Greek government different from the bankruptcy of California?

title: Christies Backing Starts Paying Dividends for Romney
description: Less than a month after endorsing Mitt Romney on the day of a Republican debate in New Hampshire, Gov. Chris Christie will make his debut as a surrogate for Mr. Romney, once again on the day of a debate in New Hampshire.

title: Mayor Presses Both Parties to Cut U.S. Deficit
description: 10:17 p.m. | Updated Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said Tuesday that it was time for Washington to take serious steps to address the federal deficit, starting with a measure certain to be unpopular with some of his financial industry friends: a change to the way that hedge fund managers are taxed.

title: A New Edition of Betsy-Tacy Greets Fans, Old and New
description: A ramshackle four-story brownstone in mid-20th-century Manhattan. A Lower East Side tenement at the turn of the last century. The woods of Wisconsin in 1964.

title: Evangelicals Woo Brazils Upwardly Mobile
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The neighborhood of Xerm, 30 miles north of downtown Rio, sits at the foot of mountains. It has made a name for itself as a home to the car industry, drug-related violence and the Fluminense Football Club. For the better part of the last century, wealthy Brazilians cut through it on their way to fancy weekend mountaintop hideaways.

title: How Is a Grizzly Bear Like a Wolf?
description: In Saturdays paper, I wrote about the repercussions of a Congressional decision in April to remove the gray wolf from the endangered species list through legislation.

title: Help Us Choose Sentence of the Week
description: Close all the other tabs in your Web browser. Turn off your satellite radio. Call a baby-sitter for your dependents. Throw your iPhone into the garbage disposal. Anesthetitize your co-workers. Tell your boss that youre tired of his incessant yakking, that something crucial has come up  something bigger than you, bigger than your boss, bigger than all of us put together.

title: David C. Utz, Surgeon Who Operated on Reagan, Dies at 87
description: Dr. David C. Utz, a prominent urological surgeon at the Mayo Clinic who drew wide attention when he performed prostate surgery on President Ronald Reagan in 1987, died on Oct. 30 in Scottsdale, Ariz. He was 87.

title: Liberia Holds Presidential Runoff Election
description: Tension hangs over the Liberian runoff election the day after deadly pre-election clashes and with the opposition party planning a boycott.

title: Remembering Joe Frazier, the Working Mans Champion
description: Finally, in death, it appears Joe Frazier finally stepped out of Muhammad Alis shadow.

title: Express Scripts Cuts Termination Fee in Medco Deal
description: Express Scripts announced on Tuesday that it had cut the termination fee for its  $29 billion takeover of Medco Health Solutions as part of an effort to settle lawsuits tied to the deal.

title: Green Movement
description: Asia takes eco-resort to the next level.

title: For Stieg Larsson Fans, New Editions to Savor
description: Fans of Stieg Larssons blockbuster Millennium trilogy can count on a few more editions to collect.

title: On Electric-Vehicle Incentives, Diesel Defenders Cry Foul
description: The U.S. Coalition for Advanced Diesel Cars, a Washington-based advocacy group whose members include Bosch, Honeywell and BorgWarner, all major automotive suppliers, released a white paper on Monday to make the case for technology-neutral policy-making on fuel efficiency.

title: The Return Of Secular Stagnation
description: Steve Randy Waldman has a characteristically interesting post on interest rates. He starts from the observation that real rates are now negative  lenders are actually willing to accept a negative yield on inflation-protected bonds:

title: No Link Seen Between Low Credit Scores and Bad Job Behavior
description: 12:15 p.m. | Updated  To more clearly distinguish between credit reports and credit scores. Employers dont use credit scores in employment screening, but they can and do access credit reports.

title: If I Don't Grade My Students' Regents Exams, Who Will?
Black and White Quinoa Dressing With Butternut Squash and Pecans
description: The light-colored version of quinoa is a fluffier grain than the black version, so its almost as if there are two completely different grains in this colorful mixture.

title: Red and Black Rice Stuffing With Red Lentils, Almonds and Cranberries
description: This is particularly colorful because of the beautiful salmon-colored red lentils. They are soaked, not cooked, and contribute a fresh flavor and crunchy texture to the mix.

title: Top Obama Aide Relinquishes Some Duties
description: WASHINGTON  A year before Election Day, President Obama has realigned the West Wing to consolidate power among his closest and most trusted campaign advisers, putting Pete Rouse, a confidant with decades of Capitol Hill experience, at the center of White House operations.

title: In North Dakota, After the Water, the Winter
description: MINOT, N.D.  There are four seasons up here, the joke goes: winter, winter, winter and construction.

title: Handling Sexual Harassment in Schools
description: What would you tell a daughter who said she was being sexually harassed at school?

title: Red Rice and Quinoa Stuffing With Mushrooms and Kale
description: Mushrooms lend a meaty element to this savory mixture of red rice and quinoa, and kale adds color in addition to its many nutrients.

title: On Our Radar: Gas Pipeline Links Russia and Germany
description: The leaders of Germany and Russia inaugurate a $10.2 billion pipeline that links Western Europe directly with Siberias vast natural gas reserves for the first time. The pipeline will transport gas under the Baltic Sea from Vyborg, near St. Petersburg in northern Russia, to Lubmin, Germany. [Associated Press]

title: Oppression Is Not a States Right
description: Stop me if youve heard this one: Elected officials in Southern states barring the schoolhouse door, shaking their fists at the federal government over civil rights, the Constitution and their right to oppress minority groups without Washingtons meddling.

title: Boom For Whom
description: While Im talking about inequality and the crisis, I realized recently that theres another channel not usually talked about, via the misperception of success.

title: Black and Brown Rice Stuffing With Walnuts and Pears
description: Pears and walnuts complement dark black and pale brown rice in this sweet and savory mixture. Make sure you dont overcook the pears; they need only a quick sear in the pan. The optional red lentils or cranberries add some color to the mix.

title: Cain Speaks Out to Deny Accusations; 2nd Voice Heard
description: Herman Cain, the embattled Republican candidate for president, convened a nationally televised news conference Tuesday in which he insisted that he is innocent of all sexual harassment accusations, even as another woman put her name to allegations that he had approached her inappropriately.

title: Im Number 97
description: For what its worth  or rather, what its Worth  Worth magazine says Im the 97th most powerful person in finance. That plus $5.65 gets me a sandwich at the Wilson School cafeteria.

title: Sarkozy Reportedly Called Netanyahu a Liar in Overheard Remarks to Obama
description: Updated | 5:53 p.m. During a private conversation last week that was accidentally broadcast to several journalists covering the Group of 20 economic summit meeting in Cannes, France, President Nicolas Sarkozy of France reportedly told President Obama that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel was a liar.

title: Jackson Doctor Trial Fails to Ignite Audience Interest
description: In a bit of anticlimax, Dr. Conrad Murray was found guilty late in the day on Monday of involuntary manslaughter two-and-a-half years after the death of Michael Jackson. Networks broke in for live coverage, cable networks hit the hyperdrive button and pundits played Ping-Pong with the verdict deep into the night, but audiences seem to shrug. Ratings on the verdict coverage are not known yet, but The Hollywood Reporter said during the trial that the case failed to ignite audience interest on HLN, CNNs sibling networked that had promised wall-to-wall coverage.

title: Excerpt: 'Venus in Fur' on Broadway
description: Nina Arianda and Hugh Dancy in a scene from David Ives's play at the Samuel J. Friedman Theater. (Video courtesy of Manhattan Theater Club.)

title: Now Showing | Mobilier National
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Depression Drug Results Disappoint Targacept and AstraZeneca
description: An experimental drug for depression, developed from studies of how nicotine affects the brain, has failed in its first late-stage clinical trial, the companies developing the drug said Tuesday.

title: An Infusion of Money for Soundtracking, a Social Music App
description: SoundTracking, a social mobile application that allows people to create musical postcards that can then be shared with friends on social sites, announced Tuesday that it had received $4.75 million in financing.

title: Amylin and Eli Lilly Part Ways Over Diabetes Drug
description: After Amylin Pharmaceuticals accused longtime partner Eli Lilly of cavorting with another partner, it was perhaps only a matter of time before they split.

title: Penn State Said to Be Planning Paterno Exit Amid Scandal
description: STATE COLLEGE, Pa.  Joe Paternos tenure as the coach of the Penn State football team will soon be over, perhaps within days or weeks, in the wake of a sexual abuse scandal that has implicated university officials, according to two people briefed on conversations among the universitys top officials.

title: Tragedy on the Banks of the Ganges
description: At least sixteen people, mostly older women, died Tuesday during a religious ceremony in the temple city of Haridwar, on the banks of the Ganges River.

title: Low Point Watch
description: When a Herman Cain Super PAC released a high-tech lynching ad last week, I wondered if wed hit the low point of the Republican primaries. But then I thought, fat chance, itll get worse.

title: More Churn in Job Market Is Hopeful Sign
description: The number of people leaving or receiving jobs picked up in September, the Labor Department reported Tuesday, a sign that that the labor market may be regaining its health.

title: As Runner and Volunteer, Warm Memories of Finish Lines
description: 11:20 a.m. | Updated My friend Sally Olds has seen a lot of finish lines in her running career, but she had a new vantage point last Sunday at the New York City Marathon.

title: Crown Heights, 10:30 A.M.
description: Its Election Day, and poll workers, like these at Clara Barton High School, are lonely.

title: Seeing a Former Champion Beyond His Combative Side
description: There was a funeral after a snowstorm. Most of us were able to get to the synagogue on a peninsula on Long Island, but we knew it would be tough, driving from Philadelphia.

title: Stopping Short of the Right Thing
description: The scandal at Penn State is not about whether or not Joe Paterno should be fired or step down, but the question of why he stopped short of doing the right thing, says William C. Rhoden.

title: Bankers Reap Windfall in Groupon I.P.O.
description: Its good to be a banker  at least one working for Groupon.

title: Sports of The Times: Stopping Short of the Right Thing
description: The scandal at Penn State is not about whether or not Joe Paterno should be fired or step down, but the question of why he stopped short of doing the right thing, says William C. Rhoden.

title: With Real Presence
description: AT the Fivestory pop-up, on the third floor of an Upper East Side town house, shoppers will get a sneak peek at what Claire Distenfeld plans for the boutique she will open there in February. Ms. Distenfeld, who was raised on the U.E.S., fled an art-world job to hone her sophisticated retail aesthetic. For the preview, she filled two rooms with contemporary wares in a range of prices that includes, yes, affordable.

title: Protester Arrested During Bomb Scare Evacuation
description: An Occupy Wall Street protester in Zuccotti Park was arrested Tuesday morning after refusing to obey police orders to evacuate the park steps during a bomb scare, the authorities said.

title: NBC to Televise Derby Preps
description: The Jockey Club, making good on its promise to bring more television coverage of horse racing, announced Tuesday it was partnering with the NBC Sports Group to broadcast six major Kentucky Derby prep races next spring.

title: In Overheard Comments, Sarkozy Calls Netanyahu a Liar
description: JERUSALEM  The president of France, Nicolas Sarkozy, told President Obama that he could no longer bear Benjamin Netanyahu, the prime minister of Israel, and went on to call Mr. Netanyahu a liar in a private conversation overheard by several French journalists last week at the Group of 20 summit meeting in Cannes.

title: Government Counting Sheep? Now, Only in Its Dreams
description: Last year, Wisconsin led the nation in mink farming, producing 833,430 pelts. Texas was the undisputed king of pansies, growing 1.8 million flats of the flowers. And no state harvested more hops than Washington, with 24,336 acres.

title: Air Force Officials Disciplined Over Handling of Human Remains
description: WASHINGTON  Three senior officials at Dover Air Force Base in Delaware, sacred ground for the military and the main entry point for the nations war dead, knew they had lost body parts of two service members killed in Afghanistan but did nothing to correct sloppy practices at the base mortuary, the Air Force said Tuesday.

title: Shirley Bassey | A Fans Notes
description: Shirley Bassey, the 74-year-old Welsh pop singer beloved and berated for her brassy excess, rose to fame on the success of Goldfinger, the theme song to the 1964 James Bond film of the same name. A tabloid-ready love life and a closetful of fishtail bumster frocks, paved with kilos of caviar beads, have also done their part.

title: Gloves Are No Guarantee Your Doctors Hands Are Clean
description: Warning: Those latex gloves your doctor is wearing may be covered in germs.

title: Hey, Officer! What Do You Mean Im a Skylarker?
description: Lush Worker: one who rolls drunks for their money.

title: TimesCast | November 8, 2011
description: The longtime football coach Joe Paterno is expected to step down; A key ally of Italian prime minister Silvio Berlusconi asks him to resign; and Herman Cain confronts sexual harassment allegations.

title: Greek Squabbles Delay Selection of New Leader
description: ATHENS  Lucas Papademos, a respected economist, seemed on the verge Tuesday night of being named Greeces next prime minister, Greek news outlets reported, but party leaders were still engaged in a bitter and drawn-out fight over the makeup of his cabinet.

title: Ghost Hunters Captured Oklahoma Earthquake on Video
description: There was a bump in the night. And then another, and another. The ghost hunters have it all on tape.

title: No Such Place as Post-Racial America
description: Dear America,

title: I Do Not Think That Word Means What Politico Thinks It Means
description: In case anyone thought that my post about widespread misunderstanding of the meaning of the word hypocrisy was arguing with a straw man, now comes Politico, telling us  without a hint that there might be some misunderstanding here  that Elizabeth Warren may not be credible in her campaign against economic injustice because shes personally affluent.

title: U.N. Agency Says Iran Data Points to A-Bomb Work
description: United Nations weapons inspectors have amassed a trove of new evidence that they say makes a credible case that Iran has carried out activities relevant to the development of a nuclear device, and that the project may still be under way.

title: Pairings: Black-Bean Cakes With Smoked Salmon
description: Thanksgiving generously welcomes white, red or sparkling. But no matter what direction the drinks take, the host must also provide some food as guests arrive and mingle. Something small, a tidbit in a modest quantity, is the goal, not an appetite assassin. Bowls of nuts, olives and even popcorn would be fine.

title: Wines for Thanksgiving Dinner
description: THE Thanksgiving wine panel, in which the home team gathers for a preliminary holiday feast, is one of our traditions here at the Dining section. We test specific bottles with representative dishes, and, even more important, we reassess the coherence of our assumptions about which wines to serve with the bird.

title: A Fracking Method With Fewer Water Woes?
description: Heres a quick review of developments related to the fast-expanding extraction of natural gas using hydraulic fracturing, otherwise known as fracking, that point to a route forward amid concerns about everything from earthquakes to water pollution.

title: Cain Campaign Goes After Accusers Credibility
description: Herman Cains campaign began an outright assault on the credibility of his latest accuser on Tuesday, saying in an e-mail to supporters that Sharon Bialek had a long and troubled financial history that should undermine her allegations against him.

title: Political Ad Spending Spurs Local TV Mergers
description: A period of consolidation is under way in local television  and with it, a renewed debate about the implications of merger and acquisition activity on the industry.

title: A Silly World of Little Outrage and No Consequences
description: So much for golfs silly season. The period from Halloween to New Years Day used to be when the sport switched into sleep mode. This regenerative time, when games were repaired and rebuilt, has gradually given way to a global dash for cash that would make Phileas Fogg proud.

title: How J. Hilburn Managed to Expand Online
description: Last week, we profiled a dilemma facing J. Hilburn, a Dallas clothing company that uses direct sales and multilevel marketing to sell custom shirts and other menswear. Founded in 2007 by Hil Davis and Veeral Rathod, two Dallas financial industry workers, the companys sales rose from $1 million in 2008 to $3.25 million in 2009 and $8 million in 2010, a year in which it sold 60,000 shirts (starting at $89).

title: Little, Brown Pulls Novel, Citing Plagiarism
description: 4:30 p.m. | Updated Little, Brown & Company has pulled a mystery novel from the shelves after passages in the book were found to have been plagiarized from a variety of classic and contemporary spy novels, the publisher said on Tuesday. The book, Assassin of Secrets, a debut novel by Q. R. Markham, was released last week by Mulholland Books, an imprint of Little, Brown.

title: Yelp Hires Goldman and Citigroup to Lead I.P.O.
description: Yelp, the online reviews site for local businesses, has hired Goldman Sachs and Citigroup to lead its initial public offering of stock, according to several people briefed on the situation.

title: Vucciria Will Bring Puglian Food to the Film Center Cafe Space
description: What had been the Film Center Cafe in Hells Kitchen will become Vucciria, an Italian restaurant to open in December. Though it is taking its name from the main food market in Palermo, Sicily, the food will be from Puglia and Sardinia, the specialties of the chef, Giovanni Tenace, who is Puglian. The menu is likely to include burnt wheat pasta with blood sausage and broccoli rabe, chestnut fettuccine with porcini and black truffle sauce, Adriatic fish soup with langoustines, razor clams and mackerel, and braised veal cheeks.

title: Beer Authority Primes Its Taps Across From the Port Authority
description: Beer Authority, a sprawling restaurant and bar set to open in a few weeks, gets its name from its neighbor across West 40th Street, the Port Authority bus terminal.

title: Sadies Kitchen, 30s-Style Comfort in Cobble Hill, Brooklyn
description: The macaroni and cheese that will be the signature at Sadies Kitchen, a 1930s-style retro cafe and prepared-food shop that opens in Brooklyn on Monday, comes from Sadie Smith.

title: Thanksgiving Countdown | Youre Going to Need Wine With That Dinner
description: Its time to consider a crucial part of the Thanksgiving feast. Should the wine on the table be light, agile and versatile? Or should it be heavy, big and over-the-top? Eric Asimov, Florence Fabricant, Julia Moskin, Pete Wells and Bernie Kirsch, The Timess tasting coordinator, each brought a red and a white  costing no more than $25 apieceto the annual pre-holiday tasting. Their suggestions, and some lively debate, are here.

title: A Reservation With Reservations
description: When Saddam Hussein fell from power following Americas 2003 invasion of Iraq, widespread looting of his palaces scattered valuables of every ilk to the far corners of Iraq and of the world. Among the most plentiful and otherwise banal were also among the most symbolic: Husseins plates, upon which the autocrat and his cohorts supped well at the expense of the citizenry. Through Nov. 26, New Yorkers can dine on some of those plates, through the latest collaboration between Creative Time, a Manhattan-based nonprofit arts group, and Park Avenue Autumn restaurant, at 63rd Street and Park Avenue.

title: Whose Woods These Are I Think Youll Know
description: You might not arrive at the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx knowing who underwrote the lovely restoration of its venerable 50-acre forest along the banks of the Bronx River. But you wont leave ignorant.

title: Photo Replay: Nov. 8
description: The day in sports included land-mine victims playing soccer and more flies than birdies during preparations for the Australian Open golf tournament in Sydney.

title: Q. and A. | Times Reporters Answer Student Questions
description: Several weeks ago, in honor of the National Day on Writing, we asked seven Times reporters from a variety of beats to answer questions about what they write, how and why.

title: Head Start Is Given New Rules for Grants
description: YEADON, Pa.  President Obama visited a schoolhouse in this suburb of Philadelphia on Tuesday to announce stricter financing standards for the governments Head Start program, which offers preschool training for children from low-income families.

title: Paternos Tenure Coming to an End
description: November 8, 2011  Penn States head football coach Joe Paterno is expected to step down at some point this season.

title: On the Bright Side of Heritage
description: STOP me if youve heard this one before: Williamsburg, heritage, durables, outdoorsy, Americana, elbow patches, tie-dye, artisan. Mens fashion  the nontailored sort  has become reducible in recent years, almost to the point of parody.

title: In N.B.A. Proposal, an Option Worth Considering
description: Player representatives from all 30 N.B.A. teams will meet in New York Tuesday to consider each of the possible ways to navigate David Sterns Wednesday deadline to accept a deal. They should have a full docket; there is a long list of issues pertaining to the N.B.A.s current offer, its reset proposal, and the growing possibility of union decertification that will need to be addressed, all while tension continues to build and emotions run high.

title: Five Workers Injured in Brighton Beach Building Collapse
description: For the final version of the article that appeared in the newspaper, click here.

title: Transformers Director Michael Bay Produces Trailer for Need for Speed: The Run
