description: Ryan Skeen, of Resto, Irving Mill, Allen & Delancey, 5 & Diamond and Fish Tag will be the executive chef for the growing Pera enterprises. Joining the companys first restaurant, Pera Medtierranean Brasserie in Midtown, and the Pera Turkish Taco Truck, Pera Soho will open next month at 54 Thompson Street (Broome Street). Mr. Skeen will be in charge of its kitchen there.

title: Medicaid Whistle-Blower Wins in Court, but Not Yet at Love
description: There were a few matchmaking offers from people in his sister-in-laws shul, and one from an actual shadchen (Jewish matchmaker), offering, by e-mail: sister and granddaughter of rabbi; graduate of Wesleyan; entrepreneur, passionate foodie; VERY beautiful (soulmate?).

title: Discovery Executive to Leave
description: After two years as the chief operating officer of Discovery Communications, Peter Liguori will leave at the end of the year, the company said Wednesday.

title: Italy Bound
description: Just in time for Italys 150th anniversary (and a major financial crisis), a flurry of new books present the country as frustrating, inscrutable and magnificent.

title: Accused Al-Qaeda Leader Is Arraigned in U.S.S. Cole Bombing
description: FORT MEADE, Md.  A Saudi man accused of plotting the 2000 bombing of the American destroyer Cole walked into a military courtroom at the naval base at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, on Wednesday morning, appearing in public for the first time since his capture nine years ago.

title: Sun and Sand on Your Agenda? Its Time to Book
description: LOOKING for a bargain beach vacation? Better act fast.

title: Its the Economy: The Patient Is Having a Heart Attack
description: Over on the Planet Money blog, Adam Davidson, author of our new Its the Economy column, has posted responses from John Cochrane of the University of Chicago and Dean Baker of the Center for Economic and Policy Research to his first column, Can Anyone Really Create Jobs?

title: Its Official: American Is Now a Bolshoi Dancer
description: Last Friday night, David Hallberg made his debut as a principal dancer at the Bolshoi Ballet, becoming the first American in history to do so.

title: Toyota Recalls 420,000 Models for Possible Steering Flaw
description: Toyota is recalling about 420,000 of some of its most popular vehicles because an engine issue may cause an unexpected increase in steering effort.

title: Memo to Penn State: Ignoring a Scandal Doesnt Make It Go Away
description: Anyone with an ounce of sense happening by the Penn State campus these days might want to deliver a message to the people ostensibly running the place: Your scandal isnt going away. With hundreds of reporters roaming their campus looking for answers to the obvious questions that come with a sexual abuse case university officials  including Coach Joe Paterno  allegedly sat on for years, and a public cry for some defense for what appears to be an institution-wide moral collapse, the university brain trust has found a very large sand pit for those brains and decided not to deal with it. So, on top of a crisis, the university has heaped a public relations catastrophe.

title: Paterno Is Finished at Penn State, and President Is Out
description: STATE COLLEGE, Pa.  Joe Paterno, who has the most victories of any coach in major college football history, was fired by Penn State on Wednesday night in the wake of a sexual abuse scandal involving a prominent former assistant coach and the universitys failure to act to halt further harm.

title: Retro Games, and a Joystick to Play Them
description: Remember plunking down your whole allowance in quarters to play Centipede and Asteroids at the local arcade?

title: Which Way Home? A Special Section on Home Ownership
description: In a special section  called Which Way Home?  the Your Money team takes a look at housing, including the continuing fallout from the bursting of the real estate bubble, through the stories of homeowners who run the gamut. One negotiated a short sale, others walked away from underwater houses and yet another persevered to get a loan modification. Other features include a family that consolidated several generations on one property.

title: Former Moscow Mayor Returns to Russia
description: MOSCOW  Moscows former mayor, Yuri M. Luzhkov, returned to Russia on Wednesday, ending speculation that he might remain abroad rather than submit to questioning in an embezzlement case against the Bank of Moscow.

title: Georgia and Russia Sign Trade Deal
description: MOSCOW  Georgia and Russia on Wednesday signed an agreement that clears the path for Russia to join the World Trade Organization, ending nine months of often rocky negotiations between the two countries on monitoring trade flows over the Georgian-Russian border.

title: Romney Seizes on Obamas Netanyahu Comments
description: Mitt Romney has added his intentional comments Wednesday to the mix of ones unintentionally overheard last week about Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel.

title: Questions for the Candidates
description: The Republican presidential candidates are meeting in Michigan tonight for a CNBC-hosted debate. I often feel that moderators are too soft on the candidates, so, in collaboration with Times editorial board members Lawrence Downes, David Firestone, Carol Giacomo, Juliet Lapidos, Teresa Tritch and David Unger, Ive come up with some questions (actually, a whole lot of questions, but were talking about the presidency, not an application to run a pizza franchise). CNBC, if youre reading, please feel free to plagiarize.

title: When Ozone Drops, Farm Workers Step Up the Pace
description: Opponents of stricter regulation of air pollution typically argue that jobs would be lost if the federal government tightened limits on industrial emissions of ozone. A new study presents a counterpoint: lower ozone levels seem to increase worker productivity.

title: Regis May Be Going, but Well Have Kelly for a While
description: Regis Philbin is leaving the daytime talk show Live! with Regis and Kelly later this month, but his co-host, Kelly Ripa, is planning to stay awhile.

title: With Anger Over Dirty Air Rising, Beijing Tries Tours of Monitoring Center
description: BEIJING  Environmental officials who have resisted releasing comprehensive data about air pollution here in the capital announced that they would take action to address increasing complaints that the governments monitoring system fails to report on the most dangerous airborne particles emitted by the growing ranks of cars and trucks.

title: E.U. Poised to Overtake U.S. as Biggest Oil Importer
description: LONDON  The European Union is expected to overtake the United States as the worlds biggest oil importer in 2015, the International Energy Agency said Wednesday in its annual report.

title: Reporting From Syria in Secret
description: Updated | 2:17 p.m. As The Lede has reminded readers for months, because of restrictions imposed by the Syrian government on independent reporting, much of the information about the uprising there, including video of the security crackdown on protesters this week, reaches the Web only after it has been smuggled out of the country by a network of activists.

title: Iran Escalates Anti-U.S. Rhetoric Over Nuclear Report
description: WASHINGTON  Angered by the release of an incriminating United Nations report on their nuclear ambitions, Irans leaders sought on Wednesday to cast it as an American fabrication.

title: Energy Forecast: Fracking in China, Nuclear Uncertain, CO2 Up
description: This years World Energy Outlook report has been published by the International Energy Agency, and says wealthy and industrializing countries are stuck on policies that threaten to lock in an insecure, inefficient and high-carbon energy system.

title: For Soldiers, the End of the Mail Means the End of the War
description: When the war was violent and stupid and terrifying, and I was hot and cold and tired, I joked that my goal in life was to have a job in which I would walk into the office each day in a suit and tie, carrying a briefcase, a newspaper and a cup of coffee. I would say hello to my office assistant on the way to a comfortable chair by my nice desk. There would be no ruck laden with mortar rounds, no ammo magazines with tracer rounds carefully interspersed, no disembodied voice on a radio.

title: Stay Calm: It Is Just a Test. Probably.
description: Nov. 10: Read Brian Stelters post on Media Decoder to see how the test turned out.

title: Gem Palace
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Stage Scenes: Alan Rickman
description: A look at some of the actors past performances.

title: Judge to Release Summary of Detectives Notes in British Phone-Hacking Scandal
description: Rupert Murdochs son James, the deputy chief operating officer of News Corporation, will most likely face tough questions at a hearing by a British parliamentary committee on Thursday over his role in the phone-hacking scandal at The News of the World tabloid, as my colleagues Sarah Lyall and Don Van Natta Jr. reported, and a ruling by a judge released on Tuesday could add to the pressure.

title: Union Negotiator Apologizes for Plantation Comment
description: Jeffrey Kessler, the chief negotiator for the N.B.A. players union, apologized Wednesday for making a racially charged comment about N.B.A. owners. Discussing the taut labor negotiations between the league and the union, he had told The Washington Post that the league was treating the players like plantation workers.

title: Move Over, Christies, U.S. Marshals Want a Piece of the Action
description: Even the United States Marshals Service is getting in on the fall auction season.

title: 2011 Milan Motorcycle Show
description: Highlights from the industrys annual showcase.

title: A Neglected Vaccine
description: Like many other grown-ups, I hadnt given any thought to what we used to call the D.P.T. vaccine  for diphtheria, pertussis and tetanus  for decades. I got the shots when I was a child, and I made sure my daughter got them during her childhood immunizations. Every now and then, my doctor tells me its time for a tetanus booster, so I get one. Thats enough, right?

title: Have an N.F.L. Question? Judy Battista Has Answers
description: Can the Bears beat the Lions in this Sundays rematch? How worried should Patriots fans be? Why cant the Eagles sustain any momentum? Judy Battista,The Timess N.F.L. reporter, will again answer selected questions from readers this week. Use the comment field below to ask your questions, and the answers will appear on The Fifth Down on Friday.

title: Designer Lipstick: A New Splurge
description: KATHLEEN MUKAMAL, a homemaker who lives in Miami and New York, was waiting in a long line last Tuesday evening in the beehive-like basement of Bergdorf Goodman to meet Tom Ford, the designer who has introduced a cosmetics line there, with plans to arrive at Neiman Marcus and Saks Fifth Avenue in the months ahead.

title: The Renault 4 Gets Reimagined for Design Competition
description: In the pantheon of emblematic European passenger cars, right alongside the Volkswagen Beetle, Fiat 500 and Citron 2CV, is the Renault 4, a family mover of petite proportions.

title: On Our Radar: Viciously More Expensive Energy
description: The global demand for energy is set to increase 40 percent by 2035, the International Energy Agency says. And it will become viciously more expensive and more polluting if governments do not promote renewable energy and nuclear power in the next two decades instead of burning coal, it warns. [Bloomberg News]

title: Photos of The Moment | Versace for H&M
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Trading Up: The Town Coat
description: It is designed with modern man in mind  he of the gym membership.

title: Short and Shapely, the Town Coat Steps In
description: WITH the vicious game of chicken between Mercury and Mother Nature showing no signs of abating  will tomorrow be 30 and snowing or 65 and shining?  it seems increasingly certain that the future of dressing well will require a vast arsenal of garments designed to meet the weathers every mood swing.

title: The Caucus | Debate Preview
description: Nov. 9, 2011  A look ahead as Republican candidates prepare to gather for their first debate since sexual harassment allegations were uncovered against Herman Cain.

title: Ahead of Vote, Egypts Parties and Skepticism Are Growing
description: CAIRO  At the rally kicking off his campaign for Parliament, Basem Kamel, a core member of the youthful council that helped spur the end of the Mubarak government, wrestled with his stump speech calling for civilian rule.

title: Home Is Where the School Is
description: An article by Patricia Heidenry from the October 19, 1975 issue of The New York Times Magazine.

title: A New Book Argues Against the SAT
description: When Wake Forest University announced three years ago that it would make the SAT optional for its undergraduate applicants, among those cheering was Joseph Soares, a sociology professor at the university. Mr. Soares has channeled his enthusiasm for Wake Forests decision  as well as for similar policies at several hundred other colleges  into a new book, SAT Wars, that argues for looking beyond standardized test scores in college admissions. (The book was published last month by Teachers College Press.)

title: ESPN Acquires Rights to Euro Playoffs (but Theres a Twist)
description: ESPN, which will carry next summers Euro 2012 from Ukraine and Poland, said Wednesday that it has acquired the rights to the eight-team playoffs for the four remaining spots in the tournament. But there is a twist: the games will only be available on ESPN Deportes, a Spanish-language channel, and ESPN3, its online service that is not available to all.

title: TimesCast | November 9, 2011
description: Investors remain skeptical Italy can tackle its financial crisis; Wednesday is the first G.O.P. debate since allegations against Herman Cain surfaced; and N.B.A. owners give players a 5 p.m. deadline.

title: E.U. to Tighten Web Privacy Law, Risking Trans-Atlantic Dispute
description: BERLIN  The European Commission is planning a legal change next year that may prompt U.S. Web giants like Google and Facebook to rethink how they store and process consumer data, raising the prospect of a trans-Atlantic dispute over Internet privacy.

title: Powerful Storm Pummels Western Alaska
description: A powerful storm with hurricane-force winds slammed into western Alaska on Wednesday, causing power failures in some tiny coastal villages and warnings that the area could suffer major flooding.

title: The Case for Optimism
description: All right, hope had a good run. It elected a president, made people feel good for a while, and sold some expensive artwork. Three years later, the unemployment rate is still high, most homeowners are still licking their wounds from diminished values, and many companies are not back to where they were before the Great Recession.

title: Caucus Video: Debate Preview
description: A look ahead as Republican candidates prepare to gather for their first debate since sexual harassment allegations were uncovered against Herman Cain.

title: Cain to Appear on Letterman
description: Herman Cain is making one more stop on the late-night television comedy circuit. Next up, Late Show With David Letterman.

title: The Off-Year Election
description: One of the big mistakes that the more extremist Republican politicians make is thinking that when they campaign on conservative ideas like small government and lower taxes, and then get elected, that they have a mandate to pursue every wing-nut idea that pops into their heads.

title: Lens: Lively Morgue Aviators
description: Lens: Lively Morgue Aviators

title: Focus on a Star and a System
description: TOKYO  Other than their quirky and often misunderstood name, the Nippon Ham Fighters do not arouse much interest in the United States.

title: Trade War in Solar Takes Shape
description: HONG KONG  The United States and China are gearing up for a trade war that could catch American users of solar energy in the crossfire.

title: Cuomo Declares Big Victory at the Polls
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo on Wednesday declared the Democratic Partys successes in several major local government elections on Tuesday to be a big victory for the people of the state, and he said that he believed the races offered evidence that voters wanted the same kind of reforms in their communities that Mr. Cuomo has pushed on the state level.

title: Adobe to Kill Mobile Flash, Focus on HTML5
description: Adobe Systems, the software company, said Wednesday that it is killing its Flash for mobile browsers, and will instead focus its efforts on HTML5 for mobile developers.

title: It Was Only a Test, but What a Test
description: 3 p.m. | Updated  At 2 p.m. Eastern time on Wednesday, all television channels and radio stations in the United States were supposed to be interrupted by a brief test of the nations Emergency Alert System. But, like most tests, some passed and some failed.

title: The Fulton
description: FANCY Manhattan therapists have, on occasion, been known to steer their single female clients to a rarefied southern swath of the island, where men outnumber women to an extent not often witnessed outside a gay club. The odds are certainly in their favor at the Fulton, a new gastropub in a former Blarney Stone space, which draws a steady stream of finance guys fresh out of the office, who talk shop over cold beers and beefy sliders. The mens rooms are stocked with toiletries like cologne and hair gels, should the occasional female enter their fraternal cave.

title: Tip of the Week: Selecting the Right Program to Open a File
description: Need to open a file in a program other than the one that automatically pops open when you double-click? In either Mac OS X or Windows, right-clicking in the files icon and choosing Open With lets you select a different program from a list of applications that can also handle that file type.

title: Cashman Says Its Still Too Early for Dealing
description: Brian Cashman, the general manager of the Yankees, said Wednesday that it was still too early in the off-season for any serious discussions about free agents or potential trades.

title: Today to Show an Interview With Michael Jacksons Doctor
description: Dr. Conrad Murray, who was convicted on Monday of involuntary manslaughter in the death of Michael Jackson, did not take the stand while on trial, but he did defend himself to television interviewers.

title: TimesCast | Italy's Financial Crisis
description: November 9, 2011 - Investors remain skeptical Italy can tackle its financial crisis

title: Oscar Show Replaces Key Player After Furor
description: LOS ANGELES  Brian Grazer, a prominent film producer with recent credits on both J. Edgar and Tower Heist, is stepping in to produce next years Oscar awards show, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences said on Wednesday, a move intended to quickly repair the damage caused by the sudden departures of the ceremonys co-producer, Brett Ratner, and its host, Eddie Murphy.

title: Afghan Soldier Said to Attack His Instructors From Australia
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Australian troops on a training mission in southern Afghanistan were attacked Tuesday by one of the Afghan soldiers they were training, officials said Wednesday.

title: France Cant Afford to Give Up Nuclear Energy, Utility Chief Says
description: So you are thinking that, after the Fukushima nuclear disaster in Japan, you would like to drop nuclear energy? Fine. But you had better be prepared to pay the price.

title: Thoughts of a Peacetime Veteran
description: Im marching in my first Veterans Day parade this week and I doubt whether I really belong.

title: Italy Pushed Closer to Financial Brink
description: A day after Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi offered his resignation in the face of rising global market skepticism, investors revolted Wednesday, suggesting they do not believe that even a new leadership could fix Italys intransigent financial problems and revive its economy.

title: A Tokyo With Two Moons and Many More Puzzles
description: One of the many longueurs in Haruki Murakamis stupefying new novel, 1Q84, sends the books heroine, a slender assassin named Aomame, into hiding. To sustain her through this period of isolation she is given an apartment, groceries and the entirety of Marcel Prousts Remembrance of Things Past.

title: Bookshelf: Grandparents
description: LOVE, MOUSERELLA  Written and illustrated by David Ezra Stein.  30 pp. Nancy Paulsen Books. $15.99. (Picture book; ages 4 to 8)

title: The Cain Scrutiny
description: Heres a revealing snapshot of race and American politics in the year 2011. Just hours after Sharon Bialek came forward to accuse Herman Cain of sexual harassment, the liberal panelists on Martin Bashirs MSNBC show took turns ruminating about how Cains conservative backers would no doubt freak out over the idea of a black man putting the moves on a blond white woman. I think it will be interesting to see if these guys rally around Herman Cain, the Democratic strategist Karen Finney commented, now that its clear that a whole other layer of black sexuality has been infused into this.

title: Grandparents
description: Childrens books about grandparents.

title: China Investigates Pricing by 2 Broadband Companies
description: SHANGHAI  In a rare move, Chinas state economic planning agency said Wednesday that it was investigating whether two of the countrys biggest state-run telecommunications companies were engaging in monopolistic behavior and overcharging consumers for broadband Internet.

title: Into the Wild
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Beauty Spots
description: These days, if you sing on television, you must also have a scent. Just ask Beyonc, Jennifer Lopez, Katy Perry or any of the following pop stars who introduced new perfumes this fall.

title: Photo Replay: Nov.9
description: A look at the day in sports, including weight lifting championships and cricket with a view.

title: Global Markets Are Buffeted as Italian Bond Yields Surge
description: Italys economic and political situation has highlighted a range of unpleasant possibilities for the European Union. The New York Timess Graham Bowley reports on investor reaction to the crisis in the worlds eighth-largest economy.

title: Regents Chief Says No to a Run for Mayor
description: Merryl H. Tisch, chancellor of the New York State Board of Regents, is not interested in running for mayor, despite the buzz that has circulated in recent weeks about her possible candidacy.

title: Overseas Update, How N.B.A. Players are Faring
description: While professional basketball in the United States is on hold until further notice, the show goes on around the world, and many N.B.A. players have sought temporary employment overseas. Most have gone to Europe, but some have gone to China and South America. Many are Europeans simply picking up where they left off in their native countries, while others are Americans enjoying varying degrees of success innew environments. Almost all the players have an out clause should the N.B.A. season commence.

title: Kaat, Tiant, Reynolds: Who Belongs in the Hall?
description: The Baseball Hall of Fame should be a place to celebrate the best players of each era. Thats it, a nice simple criteria  the nuances of that definition are what we get to argue about.

title: Iowa Grants Nelsons Graduation Dream
description: It is not unusual for a star basketball player to leave college for the pros before earning his degree. But it is unusual when the player finishes the requirements for graduation  at age 71.

title: In Some Areas, Home Ownership Is Still Out of Reach
description: The housing market may have crashed in many parts of the country, but there is still a contingent of would-be buyers living an alternate reality. They make a decent living, they save, but its still not enough to break into the gated communities formerly known as New York, Los Angeles and Boston.

title: Panel Rules Against Regulators in Thomas Weisel Case
description: In a victory for Thomas Weisel Partners, a hearing panel for the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority has cleared the investment bank of nearly all charges related to the sale of auction-rate securities during the last financial crisis.

title: Have Your Spray Paint and Eat It Too
description: Of all the adjectives that come to mind when speaking of spray paint, edible is not generally one of them. Until now. The Deli Garage, a self-titled Food Cooperative based in Germany, has recently released Food Finish, a metallic spray paint specifically made for food. According to their Web site, its tasteless; an adjective many people used to describe graffiti in response to our recent article on spray paint of the nonedible variety.

title: Why I Didnt Search for My Daughters Birth Parents
description: Two months ago, I turned down the opportunity to search for my adopted daughters birth parents.

title: Channel Surfing: Coast Guard Alaska
description: Weve had Alaska State Troopers. Weve had Sarah Palins Alaska. And on Wednesday night, the Weather Channel rolls out Coast Guard Alaska.

title: NCIS Locks Down TV Audience
description: Can anything stop the television ratings juggernaut that is the NCIS franchise? Apparently not. On Tuesday night the original NCIS on CBS scored its highest ratings of the season, breaking the 20-million-total-viewer barrier (at 20.3 million to be exact), while its spin-off, NCIS: Los Angeles reached 15.9 million.

title: Images and Ink: Identifying Significant Science Symbols
description: Overview | In this lesson, students view a collection of science-themed tattoos. They consider the scientific significance of the tattoo designs and their meaning to the people who have them. They then create their own designs using personally meaningful science images and share their choices with the class and a larger community.

title: Tailgating Recipe: Big Red Bears Smoked Salmon Club Sandwich
description: Just because your team doesnt play in prime time doesnt mean your tailgate party lacks championship quality fare. They prove as much at Cornell. Of course, the Big Red festivities have to be declared semiprofessional. The students at the universitys School of Hotel Administration  led by the Hotel Ezra Cornell organization  throw a tailgate party every year that is open only to hotel school students, alumni and registered guests. There have been reports of people trying to sneak under the ropes.

title: Justin Biebers Holiday Album Is a Surprising No. 1
description: In a week crowded with new music releases, Justin Biebers new holiday album topped the Billboard chart with more than 200,000 sales.

title: Homebody Cuomo Will Venture Out of State, Briefly
description: After steadfastly refusing invitations to attend events outside New York State throughout his first 10 months in office, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is finally going on a business trip. But he will not be taking his overnight bag.

title: Thanksgiving Countdown | Notes on Brining
description: The questions are starting to pour in to the Help Line, and a theme has emerged: widespread confusion over the ifs and hows and whens of brining. You may want to refer to this brining primer that Sam Sifton wrote last year. Have more specific questions on brining or anything else Thanksgiving? Just ask.

title: More Penalties Possible in Base Mortuary Scandal
description: Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta is holding out the possibility of further action against three top officials at Dover Air Force Base in Delaware who knew about lost body parts at the base mortuary but did nothing to fix a sloppy system, Pentagon officials said Wednesday.

title: Bird Diversity on the Trobriand Islands
description: Jack Dumbacher, curator of ornithology and mammalogy at the California Academy of Sciences, writes from Milne Bay, Papua New Guinea, where he is studying island birds and their diseases.

title: Eddie Murphy Follows Ratner Off the Oscars Telecast
description: Eddie Murphy is dropping out as the host of the Oscars telecast, the Academy of Motion Pictures Arts and Sciences said on Wednesday, just one day after the shows co-producer, Brett Ratner, stepped aside amid a storm of criticism over his use of an antigay slur.

title: New School Guide for Parents Now Available
In Prospect Heights, a Celebration of Play
Tisch Says She Will Not Run for Mayor
He Wants to Retire?
description: There is still a lot we dont know about what happened at Penn State, or why the school remained silent for so long about child sexual abuse allegations against former football coach Jerry Sandusky. But we know enough for me to feel appalled at the idea that head coach Joe Paterno thinks it is sufficient to retire at the end of the current season.

title: Five Things to Watch: The Michigan Debate
description: Debate season is back.

title: Penn State Scandal Foreseen by a Few
description: Considering that the grand jury investigating sexual abuse charges against former Penn State defensive coordinator Jerry Sandusky did so over 18 months, and several newspapers  particularly the Patriot-News of Harrisburg, Pa.  were reporting on its progress, it is not entirely surprising that some people were pondering its impact before the entire world found out last week when Sandusky was finally charged.

title: Egypt's Liberal Political Rally
description: Basem Kamel is campaigning for parliament as a member of the liberal Egyptian Social Democratic party.

title: Agency Restores Doctor Discipline Files  With a Catch
description: A federal health agency on Wednesday restored to its Web site a database of doctor disciplinary actions two months after pulling it off the Internet in response to a doctors complaints.

title: Live Blogging the Michigan Debate
description: After a hiatus of several weeks, the Republican candidates for president will gather in Michigan on Wednesday night for a 90-minute exchange meant to focus on economic issues.

title: Collect Call | Jill Demling and Her Sports Memorabilia
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Clip: 'Into the Abyss'
description: A clip from Into the Abyss, Werner Herzogs documentary about a triple homicide that took place in Conroe, Tex.

title: 7 Charged in Web Scam Using Ads
description: It was a subtle swap: a cheesy advertisement for a vacation timeshare site atop the home page of ESPN.com, in a spot that might have been claimed by a well-known brand like Dr Pepper.

title: Second Solyndra Loan Discussed With Energy Dept., E-Mail Suggests
description: WASHINGTON  House Republicans on Wednesday tried to use newly released e-mails to tie an Obama campaign donor with a stake in the troubled Solyndra solar energy company to an effort to lobby the White House for approval of loan guarantees to the company. But Democrats said the complete record showed exactly the opposite.

title: Pictures of the Day: England and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from England, Chile, India and Thailand.

title: North Carolina Is Top Seed in Field Hockey
description: In the 2011 N.C.A.A. field hockey championship tournament, North Carolina (20-1) is the top seed in the field of 16. Old Dominion (20-2) is second, Syracuse (18-3) third, and Connecticut (17-2) is fourth.

title: Security Forces Kill at Least 26 in Syria
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Syrian security forces killed at least 26 people on Wednesday across Syria, according to activists and residents, while defectors clashed with armed men loyal to the government of President Bashar al-Assad in central Syria.

title: Burst of Interest in Penn State Tickets
description: The allegations against Jerry Sandusky and officials at Penn State have led commentators to wonder how fans will react when the Nittany Lions play the Nebraska Cornhuskers on Saturday in State College, Pa.

title: A Brief Programming Note
description: Beginning with todays offering (on race and Herman Cain) and continuing through the November election, Ill be writing a Wednesday column for the Times Campaign Stops page, where Ill be joined by Charles Blow, Thomas Edsall, Timothy Egan and a rotating cast of talented contributors. So please stop by and check it out.

title: Returning to Form After Some Fancy
description: Sting was alone onstage, cradling an acoustic guitar, during the final moments of his supremely self-possessed show at the Roseland Ballroom on Tuesday night. It was the third encore, and as has been customary during his Back to Bass tour, he was playing a stripped-down version of Message in a Bottle, one of the springier No. 1 singles from his tenure with the Police. The lyrical gist of the song  in brutal shorthand, crushing isolation softened by a bleak epiphany  came across more clearly than usual, even as the crowd giddily sang along. Love can mend your life, but love can break your heart, Sting admonished, his singing nearly drowned out by cheers.

title: Investment Groups Prod Other Companies on James Murdochs Board Membership
description: 5:46 p.m. | Updated The problems at News Corporation could eventually affect other companies  in industries ranging from art to health care to baseball.

title: Philippine President Offers to Fly Doctors In to Treat Predecessor
description: MANILA  President Benigno S. Aquino III offered Wednesday to bring in foreign doctors to examine his predecessor, Gloria Macapagal Arroyo, but he insisted that a travel ban for Mrs. Arroyo stay in place until corruption allegations against her were resolved.

title: N.B.A. Talks Yield Progress but No Breakthrough Yet
description: Pushing aside ultimatums, threats and caustic rhetoric, N.B.A. owners and players returned to the bargaining table Wednesday for a 12-hour session that produced modest movement, but nothing close to a final deal.

title: A Deco Moment
description: Among the unexplained trends to appear with some regularity in the spring 2012 runway shows  aside from a preponderance of mesh  Art Deco took the cake. Frida Giannini was the biggest proponent of the streamlined 1920s look with her collection for Gucci, called Hard Deco, but there were echoes at Etro as well, and flappers could be found at Ralph Lauren and elsewhere. But why?

title: RIM Critic Pushes Change, but His Sway Is in Doubt
description: TORONTO  With its stock down about 65 percent this year, Research in Motion, the maker of the BlackBerry, has no shortage of unhappy shareholders. But few of its investors have sought and received as much attention over the past few months as Victor P. Alboini, the chairman and chief executive of Jaguar Financial.

title: Excerpt: 'Milk Like Sugar'
description: A scene from Kirsten Greenidge's play at Playwrights Horizons. (Video courtesy of the theater.)

title: Moderator for a Day
description: Earlier on I listed dozens of questions Id love to hear asked during tonights Republican debate at Oakland University in Michigan. I also invited readers to chime in. Heres a selection from the comments section. (N.B.: Some of these have been trimmed or edited for clarity. Links are to the original comments.)

title: #OccupyWallSt Roundup, Day 54
description: Occupy Wall Street goes to Washington, with about two dozen protesters leaving Zuccotti Park on a two-week march to support a repeal of the Bush tax cuts. The marchers are posting on Twitter feverishly, of course:

title: Is That a Fish in Your Ear?
description: To the Editor:

title: At World Championship, Indonesians Skillfully Read the Cards
description: The Indonesian womens team was the surprise of the world championships last month in the Netherlands. Not expected to figure prominently, Lusje Olha Bojoh, Julita Grace Tueje, Suci Amita Dewi, Kristina Wahyu Murniati, Fera Damayanti and Ririen Riantini, reached the final of the Venice Cup.

title: A Man of Few Words
description: To the Editor:

title: Shopping Snapshots: Nov. 10
description: The Fivestory pop-up; a Greg Lauren retail installation; and Tourneau teams up with J. Crew to revive Mougin & Piquard.

title: The Meaning of Freedom
description: To the Editor:

title: Another View: The Science and Strategy of College Recruiting
description: Marina Keegan is a senior English major in the writing concentration at Yale University.

title: Timeless Performance
description: To the Editor:

title: Homes for $859,000
description: An apartment in Washington, a house in the foothills of Santa Fe, N.M., and a Tudor on the North Shore of Chicago.

title: The Horror Show at Penn State
description: Gail Collins: David, I cant get over the horror show at Penn State. I wish I knew more about football so I could make some smart comments about the meaning of Joe Paterno. But all I can think about is: If youre the coach and you hear that a man is hurting a kid in the shower, this was not the moment to send a report up the chain of command.

title: Pictures of the Day: England and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from England, Chile, India and Thailand.

title: What You Get for ... $859,000
description: WASHINGTON

title: For a Family of Israeli Settlers, Eviction Before Salvation
description: To whom does the West Bank belong?

title: Separating Royal Myth From Fact
description: IRVINGTON, N.Y.  Robert K. Massies new book, a biography of Catherine the Great, is out this week, and although Mr. Massie is 82, he is already thinking ahead to his next one. There are all these things I want to do when I dont have to finish a book, he said last week, sitting in the upstairs study at his home here in Westchester County. But I have to keep writing because I keep having children.

title: Exercise Alternatives to Boot Camp
description: If boot camp isnt your bag, try some of New Yorks other fall fitness offerings.

title: Boot Camps Vie to Make You Sweat
description: SINCE June, New Yorkers have been paying for the privilege of doing sprints and hills on treadmills, alternated with weightlifting, to the blare of nightclub music in a mirror-lined Chelsea studio. The class is Barrys Bootcamp, a West Hollywood staple that migrated east in search of a wider audience, much like Spinning before it. The cost is $285 for 10 hourlong sessions, compared with $165 at the original outpost  this despite the absence of the instructor Barry Jay, a founder of the company with John Mumford, the chief executive, and his wife, Rachel Mumford, the president.

title: Hedi Slimane, at the Top of His Game, Again
description: Mr. Slimane seems to have left fashion behind with nary a second thought, reinventing himself as a photographer.

title: In Charlotte Gainsbourg, Indifference and Whispers Prove Alluring
description: STANDING near her co-star Alexander Skarsgard, Charlotte Gainsbourg looked every bit the glamorous French star ready to seduce America. Her dark brown mane was sexily volumized, her eyes were rimmed in kohl, and she wore a simple black silk jersey, strappy high heels and pleated, silver-spangled trousers  all by Balenciaga, the French fashion house for which she is a muse.

title: Fire Prompts Partial Evacuation at Bronx Hospital
description: Updated 6:55 p.m. | A fire in the boiler room at Montefiore Medical Center in the Bronx on Wednesday afternoon shut down two emergency rooms and two intensive care units, prompting a partial evacuation but causing no serious injuries or deaths.

title: A Monitor of Health, Worn Lightly
description: Maybe youve heard. We Americans are not, ahem, the very models of physical fitness. Were overweight, underexercised and underslept.

title: Returning to a Renovated Stage, Exuding a Dash of Modernity
description: For just this one week, American Ballet Theater is presenting itself as modern, up to date, adventurous  if not by all standards, then by those of most ballet companies. Returning for the first time in three years to New York City Center, newly renovated, its dancing a different assortment of four or five works in each program, totaling nine in all. Seven of these are by four famous American choreographers from nonballet backgrounds  Merce Cunningham, Paul Taylor, Twyla Tharp and Martha Clarke  and five of them do not involve pointwork. Only some of Ballet Theaters usual stars are involved; a good many of the companys soloist and corps dancers are being given individual opportunities. The season avoids the standard ballet clichs of familiar stories and displays of conventionally bravura technique. The emphasis is on freshness and contemporaneity.

title: Public Opinion and the Occupy Movement
description: What are your thoughts about the movement? Do you agree with the protesters methods?

title: Samurai Shopper | The Razors Edgy
description: Samurai Shopping often depends on serendipity: wanting nothing, needing less, one stumbles across a jewel of a thing, and stuff-lust suddenly sparks your amygdala. Youth & Beauty: the Art of America in the 20s is an exhibition at the Brooklyn Museum (till Jan. 29) full of low-key charms and even some revelations. Take Gerald Murphys 1924 painting Razor: a vividly rendered matchbox, Parker fountain pen, and Gillette safety razor, looking so fresh and modern, and yet, its an elegy to everyday tools beautifully rendered but quaint in todays plastic, junk-tastic universe.

title: A Familiar Site for Bachmanns Foreign Policy Speech
description: Attention campaign advance teams: Looking for a photo opportunity for a foreign policy speech? Need to project strength and military preparedness? Bonus if it is in an early primary state?

title: Cain Camp Turns Google Searches to Its Benefit
description: Searching Google for information about Cain Sharon Bialek and other keywords related to the sexual harassment allegations against Herman Cain?

title: 2 Stars Spice Up Verismo Opera
description: From the packed house at Carnegie Hall on Tuesday night for the Opera Orchestra of New Yorks concert performance of Cileas Adriana Lecouvreur, and from the ecstatic ovations for the soprano Angela Gheorghiu and the tenor Jonas Kaufmann, the evenings stars, you would not have guessed that two years ago it looked as if this valuable company might go under.

title: Ciscos Quarterly Results Beat Analysts Estimates
description: SAN FRANCISCO  John T. Chambers, chief executive of Cisco Systems, said Wednesday that he had largely completed the task of reshaping the company, a maker of the gear that runs the Internet.

title: Note to Self: Remember to Read This Article
description: Like a lot of people in the 80s, I bought a microcassette recorder to capture great ideas the way Michael Keatons character did in Night Shift. (Idea to eliminate garbage: edible paper.)

title: For Beethoven and Eliot, Missed Connections
description: The connection between Beethovens String Quartet No. 15 (Op. 132) and T. S. Eliots poem cycle Four Quartets seems undeniable.

title: A Three-Bedroom Town House With Skylights in Southwest London
description: A three-bedroom town house in Ramsden Gate, in Southwest London, is on the market for 1 million pounds ($1.6 million.)

title: Spinning Gold
description: Hip clubgoing fans of the D.J. known as Kaskade might be surprised to learn that he is a 40-year-old former Mormon missionary who does not drink.

title: Parsing Many Forces in Nature
description: The world is suddenly upside-down. Or at least it feels a little that way with all the Australian dance in New York these days. Last week the Australian Ballet performed at City Center as part of the Fall for Dance Festival, and Chunky Move, a contemporary troupe, appeared at the Joyce Theater. On Tuesday evening the Joyce hosted another group, Sydney Dance Company, making its return to the theater under its still-relatively new artistic director, Rafael Bonachela.

title: How Ryan Raddon Became the $200,000-a-Night D.J. Known as Kaskade
description: KASKADE is actually God, said Ivy Daniels, 23, waiting in line at the Roseland Ballroom near Times Square at around 9 p.m. It was a few nights before Halloween, and her rave-girl costume  black tutu, kandi bracelets  was ambiguously self-referential. Was she going to a rave?

title: House Hunting in ... London
description: A THREE-BEDROOM TOWN HOUSE WITH SKYLIGHTS IN SOUTHWEST LONDON

title: The Game Will Go On for the Nittany Lions, but Sports Books Struggle to Set the Odds
description: LAS VEGAS  Oddsmakers rely on precedent to help them set wagering lines and anticipate betting action for sporting events. Over the years, games have been played under so many circumstances and in so many different conditions that there is almost always something to look back upon for guidance.

title: Sources Say EMI Sale Will Split Company in Two
description: EMI, the storied music company that is home to the Beatles, Pink Floyd and Coldplay, is nearing a sale that would split the company in half.

title: Gmails New Look: Easier to Read, Easier to Use
description: Sometimes, less really is a lot more.

title: A Fashion Designers Second Act
description: WHEN Hedi Slimane stepped down as artistic director at Dior Homme in 2007, Fashion Wire Daily summed up his tenure this way: Slimane leaves Dior with the well-earned reputation as the single most influential mens designer this century, the most copied of his peers and the only one to achieve the status of a rock star.

title: Defiance With a Demure Smile and Tunes of the 60s and 70s
description: As Maureen McGovern sang a forceful rendition of Jonatha Brookes ballad The Angel in the House on Tuesday evening at Birdland, I had a vision of Ms. McGovern as the traditionally perfect woman and the pop-jazz singer rolled into one, and the limitations of perfection.

title: Power Envy
description: WHEN the snowstorm hit a week ago Saturday, Evan Sidel was driving home from the supermarket, having stocked up on soup ingredients, thinking she and her two daughters would have a cozy evening in. But while she was unpacking the groceries, the power went out with an audible bang, said Ms. Sidel, who lives in a 100-year-old farmhouse in Wilton, Conn.

title: Keystone XLs Cousin Shuts Down Twice
description: The company proposing a contested oil pipeline that would stretch from Canada to the Texas Gulf Coast had a related pipeline that it operates shut down over the last two days after the line experienced power problems.

title: Study Finds Signs of Awareness in 3 Vegetative Patients
description: Three severely brain-injured people thought to be in an irreversible vegetative state showed signs of full consciousness when tested with a relatively inexpensive and commonly used method of measuring brain waves, doctors reported Wednesday. Experts said the findings, if replicated, would change standards in treating such patients.

title: The People Have Spoken, and They Have Spoken for Beckett
description: It was a late, tense night at Sentence of the Week headquarters. We were up well past midnight counting election results. Our chief statistician had a nervous breakdown just before dawn, and at some point one of the interns managed to lose her engagement ring in the coffee machine. It was, in other words, another wild ride on the unbroken horse of democracy.

title: Russia Dismisses Calls for New U.N. Sanctions on Iran
description: MOSCOW  Russia on Wednesday sharply dismissed calls for further sanctions against Iran in the aftermath of a new United Nations report on suspect Iranian nuclear activities, signaling the Kremlins departure from the cooperation on Iran that was a hallmark of the reset in relations with the United States.

title: Programming for Children, Minus Cryptic Syntax
description: When Howard Abrams, a software engineer in Beaverton, Ore., wanted to teach his daughter, now 10, and son, now 8, how to program computers, he thought of the fun he had playing with Logo, the first programming language he learned.

title: Another Service Interruption for BlackBerrys
description: 8:09 p.m. | Updated  Adding RIM saying that service is back to normal.

title: Coping With the Flies of Fall
description: NEARLY a million people live alone in New York City, according to Census Bureau figures. And at one time or another, almost all of them have probably had the same thought: if I die unexpectedly tonight, watching an episode of The Millionaire Matchmaker, who will find the body?

title: Cork Furniture From Portugal
description: Ana Mestre, 33, a Portuguese furniture designer interested in sustainability, has been researching the uses of cork since 2004. It grows as the bark of a tree, she said. You can extract it without damaging the tree, and every nine years, you can extract again. You keep the forest, the biodiversity and the eco-system.

title: Moroso Plans a North American Pop-Up
description: Over the coming year, the Italian furniture company Moroso will present a traveling road show with a pop-up showroom and exhibition making stops across North America.

title: Sales at Green Depot, Denyse Schmidt and Others
description: Green Depot is taking 10 percent off humidifiers and Austin air filters through Saturday (the Austin Air HealthMate air purifier, regularly $489, is about $440; the Air-O-Swiss digital humidifier, pictured, regularly about $210, is about $189; the Crane Drop humidifier, regularly about $50, is about $45); 222 Bowery (Prince Street), (212) 226-0444 or greendepot.com.

title: Todd Oldhams Alexander Girard
description: At 672 pages and a hefty 15 pounds, Alexander Girard ($200; Ammo Books), by Todd Oldham and Kiera Coffee, might appear to be a catalog raisonn featuring all of the prolific designers textiles, graphics, illustrations, furniture, interiors, products and buildings.

title: Cranbrook Art Museum Reopens
description: The designer Charles Eames studied at the Cranbrook Academy of Art in Bloomfield Hills, Mich., and Harry Bertoia taught there. The Cranbrook Art Museum owns works by both men, including one of the largest collections of Mr. Bertoias monoprints. But whats the point if no one can see them?

title: Roz Chast Brings Her Characters to Fishs Eddy
description: October has never been one of Roz Chasts favorite months. The New Yorker cartoonist, who has made a career out of anatomizing anxiety, is particularly skittish around Halloween, which her husband, the fiction writer Bill Franzen, celebrates with gusto, in an annual spectacle involving a guillotine, severed hands, scented smoke machines and multitudes of other props, on their Ridgefield, Conn., front lawn. In recent years, though, he has scaled back the production, from 26 tableaus to just eight, she said.

title: When the Neighbors Are Renzo Piano and Philip Johnson Icons
description: The director of the Menil Collection and his wife built a house just 200 yards away from the museum in Houston.

title: For the Director of the Menil Collection, an Unadorned Home
description: HOUSTON

title: Retail Site Raids a Big Closet
description: SINCE its debut in February, Moda Operandi, the online retailer that sells designer clothes right off the runway, has become a surprise competitor on the lucrative trunk show circuit. During the September fashion shows, for example, the average transaction on the site reached $1,800, and one customer, on a single visit, spent $42,000 on clothes that wont be available in other stores until spring.

title: Thursday Matchup: Raiders at Chargers
description: Raiders (4-4) at Chargers (4-4), Thursday, 8:20 p.m. Eastern, NFL NetworkLine: Chargers by 6.

title: The Buzz
description: A PREVIEW of the must-attend parties, talked-about openings and fashionable night spots for the week ahead.

title: Liu Delays Giving Names of Campaign Fund-Raisers
description: John C. Liu, the New York City comptroller, is declining to reveal the identities of the people who raise money for his campaign, despite a pledge several weeks ago to do so after reports of irregularities in his fund-raising operation.

title: A Treehouse Grows in Brooklyn
description: I THINK everyone has this special place in their brain  a primal nostalgia  for a treehouse, said Alexandra Meyn, bundled up in a sweater on a recent afternoon inside the airy perch she built behind her garden apartment in Brooklyn. Peoples eyes light up when you tell them you have a treehouse.

title: A Treehouse in Bed-Stuy
description: Secured to an old mulberry, a backyard treehouse mixes refined and bohemian elements.

title: Michigan Governor Warns Candidates on Auto Bailout
description: ROCHESTER, Mich.  Gov. Rick Snyder, a Republican, offered a word of warning on Wednesday to his partys field of presidential candidates: dont spend time trashing the bailout of the auto industry.

title: Lessons From the Penn State Scandal

title: Market Ready
description: Q. We have a historic house with colorful period wallpapers. Should we replace them with something more neutral before selling?

title: Shopping for Bar Stools
description: Michael Barrett, an owner of the Tippler, a new bar at Chelsea Market, searched for bar seating for the home.

title: Bar Stools
description: MICHAEL BARRETT has worked as a New York City police officer, an antiques dealer and an exterminator, doing some of those jobs simultaneously. He has also owned several bars, including Chelsea Central, which opened on 10th Avenue in 1980, where the Red Cat restaurant is now, and the once-hot China Club, which he sold last year.

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: The Military Budget
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: Despite Tepid Ratings, Anderson Nears Renewal
description: Anderson Coopers two-month-old talk show was effectively renewed for a second season on Wednesday when several big station owners said they had signed up for another year.

title: On Location | Berlin
description: Christoph Roedig and Uli Schop live in a duplex in the 10-unit co-op building they designed in Berlins Mitte neighborhood.

title: Angels Rushing In Where Others Fear to Tread
description: CIUDAD JUREZ, Mexico  Angels are not a common sight here in Mexicos most violent border city, where the public cemetery is putrid and overflowing, and where a handful of churches worship the skeletal saint of death, Santa Muerte.

title: A Showpiece of Communal Living in Berlin
description: BERLIN  One day in 2002, the architect Christoph Roedig and his partner in business and life Uli Schop were biking through what was then an ungentrified corner of Berlins Mitte neighborhood, on a street not far from where the Berlin Wall once divided the city. World War II-era bombings had knocked down 19th- and early-20th-century housing developments in that part of the former East Germany. Though the former East German government had cleared away the rubble, they had never rebuilt.

title: Judge Picks Monitor to Oversee Minority Hiring by the Fire Department
description: Five weeks after issuing a ruling that called the New York Fire Department a stubborn bastion of white male privilege based on its unsuccessful efforts at racial integration, a judge on Wednesday named a monitor to oversee the departments minority recruitment and hiring.

title: One by One, Marketers Plan for a Singular Event
description: MARKETERS are betting on a daily numbers game again, taking advantage of a calendar coincidence to drum up interest in their goods and services.

title: N.H.L.s Revised Rule Gives Referees an Option
description: The Ottawa captain, Daniel Alfredsson, had just passed the puck on Oct. 29 when he collided with the Rangers Wojtek Wolski, who lifted his elbow reflexively as Alfredssons head hit Wolskis arm. Alfredsson went down in a heap and lay flat on the Madison Square Garden ice before being helped off to be treated for a concussion.

title: Somali Lawmaker Killed in Mogadishu Shooting
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  A Somali lawmaker was gunned down on a Mogadishu street on Wednesday, a day after four explosions in several neighborhoods of Somalias capital killed at least one person and injured several more, including government soldiers.

title: Green Mountain Takes a Pounding
description: Count another feather in David Einhorns cap.

title: Ohio Vote on Labor Is Parsed for Omens
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  The landslide vote to repeal an Ohio law that limits collective bargaining has sounded a strong note of caution for Republican governors and lawmakers across the country, raising questions about some of their legislative efforts, especially those that would weaken labor unions. But the victory, while trumpeted by labor leaders, may not necessarily improve the prospects of unions or the Democrats, their traditional allies, in 2012, political analysts said.

title: OMalley Interested in Owning the Dodgers Again
description: Peter OMalley wants to buy the Los Angeles Dodgers back 13 years after selling the team to Fox.

title: An Unruly Election Campaign Mirrors Congos Lingering Political Instability
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  First, Cmdr. Ntabo Ntaberi Sheka ordered his militia to join an attack on a group of villages in eastern Congo, where the fighters gang-raped at least 387 women, men, girls and boys, according to a United Nations report of the atrocities.

title: Mets Could Go From Bad to Dreadful
description: We are conditioned to think of the American League East as baseballs superpower division. The Yankees and the Boston Red Sox spend lavishly. The Tampa Bay Rays have made three playoff appearances in the past four seasons. The Toronto Blue Jays have stockpiled young talent and are expected to spend when the time is right.

title: Are We a Democracy?
Had This Been an Actual Emergency... Oops!
description: At 2 p.m. Eastern time on Wednesday, during the first nationwide test of the Emergency Alert System, all television channels and radio stations in the United States were supposed to be interrupted by piercing emergency tones. Not a song by Lady Gaga.

title: Investigation of Sandusky in 1998 Raises Questions
description: In 1998, the Penn State campus police and local law enforcement authorities investigated an allegation that Jerry Sandusky, then a prominent coach with the universitys football team, had engaged in inappropriate and perhaps sexual conduct with a boy in the football facilitys showers.

title: Central Florida Officials Resign Over Recruiting
description: The athletic director and an assistant football coach at the University of Central Florida resigned Wednesday amid an N.C.A.A. investigation into illicit recruiting practices tied to a man identified by the N.C.A.A. as a recruiter for a sports agent.

title: L.I. Inquiry on Cheating Now Covers Five Schools
description: The Nassau County district attorneys office has broadened its inquiry into suspected cheating on college admissions exams to at least 35 students in five schools, including students believed to have paid for a stand-in to take the ACT, a standardized test that is growing in popularity in the Northeast, as well as the more common SAT.

title: Dont Book That Trip Just Yet. Mercury Will Be in Retrograde.
description: When Jeffrey Moran needs advice about his daily commute into Manhattan or his next business trip, he does not plug his destination into HopStop or consult a travel Web site.

title: How to Leave the Euro
description: Irvine, Calif.

title: Giants Thrive on Mannings Late-Game Poise
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Early Sunday night, with 96 seconds left in the fourth quarter and the Giants trailing the New England Patriots, Eli Manning stepped into the huddle and simply called the next play, which is pretty much his standard operating procedure.

title: Ed Macauley, Basketball Hall of Famer, Dies at 83
description: Ed Macauley was voted the national college basketball player of the year in 1949 and the most valuable player in the N.B.A.s first All-Star Game in 1951. The second-highest-paid player in the N.B.A. in the early 1950s, he made the all-star team in 7 of his 10 pro seasons.

title: Panel Is at Impasse, but Obama Sees No Reason to Step In
description: WASHINGTON  The White Houses expectations for the special Congressional committee on deficit reduction, never high, have been all but dashed now that the panel has reached a partisan impasse less than two weeks before it is supposed to recommend a compromise plan.

title: Superseding Indictment Against Larry Seabrook
description: A superseding indictment stated that Larry Seabrook solicited a stream of checks from Arlington Leon Eastmond, totaling about $50,000, most of which went to a political club with which Mr. Seabrook was affiliated.

title: Our High-Tech Health-Care Future
description: Cambridge, Mass.

title: Seeking a Cure for Troubled Hospitals in Brooklyn
description: When the pain in his groin was too great to bear, Ralph Hutchins, who works as a mover, headed to the crowded emergency room at the nearest hospital one recent Tuesday, his life at risk. Tanya Boynton, a mother of four who works 12-hour shifts, hobbled into another emergency room from a homeless shelter, afraid illness would end her job.

title: Corporate Japan Rocked by Scandal at Olympus
description: TOKYO  In June 1998, a disturbing rumor tore through trading floors in Tokyo: Olympus had suffered colossal losses on derivatives trading, punching a large hole in its balance sheet. The companys shares spiraled down 11 percent in three days.

title: An Aspiring Coach in the Middle of a Scandal
description: STATE COLLEGE, Pa.  When Mike McQueary went to Penn State Coach Joe Paternos house on the morning of March 2, 2002, he was a graduate assistant  the lowest rung on the coaching ladder beneath Paterno. Still, McQueary, 28 years old and a football lifer, had aspirations of one day becoming a head coach, maybe even at Penn State.

title: Tighter Controls on Market Funds
description: American money market funds have played a supporting role in the euro zone crisis: they are short-term lenders to European banks. Before that, they lent to the likes of Lehman Brothers.

title: Back to Common Sense at the Polls
description: It might have been too much too soon, a chastened Gov. John Kasich of Ohio admitted on Tuesday night, after his states voters overwhelmingly rejected his attempt to break public employee unions. He certainly was right about too much, an analysis that also applies to other examples of Republican overreach around the country that were kicked into the gutter: an anti-abortion amendment in Mississippi, a voting restriction in Maine, the radical anti-immigrant agenda of a politician in Arizona.

title: The Truth About Iran
description: Tehran was in full dudgeon on Wednesday, denouncing the International Atomic Energy Agency  calling its top inspector a Washington stooge  after it reported that Irans scientists had pursued secret activities relevant to the development of a nuclear device. The agency did not back down, and neither should anyone else.

title: Googles Chief Works to Trim a Bloated Ship
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif.  Larry Page, Googles chief executive, so hates wasting time at meetings that he once dumped his secretary to avoid being scheduled for them. He does not much like e-mail either  even his own Gmail  saying the tedious back-and-forth takes too long to solve problems.

title: Checkpoints: A U.S. Veteran in Baghdad
description: Checkpoint, Sorry

title: Euro Fears Spread to Italy as the Debt Crisis Deepens
description: PARIS  Since the start of the euro crisis two years ago, the big fear has been contagion, that market unease about the high debt and slow growth in Europes southern rim would infect the core. On Wednesday, contagion arrived with brute force.

title: After Losing Their Father, Finding Small Ways to Cope
description: Charles Thornton had it all mapped out on a handwritten list atop his dresser:

title: My Second-Rate Red Carpet
description: When I moved to Los Angeles to write for The Tonight Show with Conan OBrien in 2009, I was careful not to offend the locals. Id heard many stories of New Yorkers relocating to Los Angeles, only to bemoan the inferior bagels, early bar curfews and glaring absence of public transportation. Not me, though.

title: Shermans Demons
description: By the end of the Civil War, William T. Sherman was one of the most important and celebrated Union commanders, and the most reviled in the Confederacy. During the last year of the conflict, his army conquered Atlanta, reversing a flagging Union war effort and securing Abraham Lincolns re-election. After that his men scorched much of Georgia in his famous March to the Sea, then cut a huge swath up through the Carolinas. Not only did his army destroy men and material, but Sherman articulated a ruthless policy of destruction that deeply demoralized Southern morale. He gained perpetual infamy in the South as the grim reaper of the Union war effort, a task he undertook quite consciously, with both anger and joy.

title: Taking Aim at Internet Rules
description: The Senate is expected to vote on Thursday on a resolution that would stop the Federal Communications Commission from enforcing rules that prohibit Internet service providers from discriminating against the transmission of content that might compete with their own.

title: Cains Lawyer on Accusing: Think Twice
description: L. Lin Wood, the lawyer hired by the Republican presidential candidate Herman Cain to fend off sexual harassment accusations, has warned that any other women who might be considering coming forward with similar allegations should think twice.

title: Do You Need a Place to Stay? Can You Prove It?
description: Ask about home, and Calvin Miller points to a soot-gray hulk of a former psychiatric hospital on East 30th Street, where dead vines run like varicose veins up the brick.

title: Jets Rediscover Their Center
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Many interviews with Nick Mangold begin with a smile and some sarcasm, and so it was on Wednesday afternoon when he was asked how his right ankle felt.

title: A Bad Ruling on Cigarette Warnings
description: A Federal District Court judge in the District of Columbia has blocked new regulations requiring tobacco companies to put large graphic warnings on cigarette packages. If his ruling stands, the government will not be able to warn against the hazards of smoking in a way thats actually noticed.

title: After Chefs Hitler Remark, Bankers Change Lunch Plans
description: Del Posto and Babbo have the same celebrity chef as an owner, reputations for impossible-to-get reservations, and customers who can afford, say, Del Postos seven-course menu tradizionale at $145 a person. It is not unreasonable to imagine that a good number of those customers make a living on Wall Street.

title: Lottery Numbers
Hal Bruno, Director of Election Coverage at ABC, Dies at 83
description: Hal Bruno, who helped shape political coverage at ABC News for nearly two decades and was a frequent analyst on its radio and television broadcasts, died on Tuesday, Election Day, in Bethesda, Md. He was 83. The cause was heart arrhythmia after a fall, his son Harold III said.

title: Piers Morgan to Leave Talent Show
description: Piers Morgan, the host of a prime time interview show on CNN and a judge on a prime time talent show on NBC, said Wednesday night that he was quitting the latter of the two.

title: Parks Chief Blocked Plan for Grand Canyon Bottle Ban
description: Weary of plastic litter, Grand Canyon National Park officials were in the final stages of imposing a ban on the sale of disposable water bottles in the Grand Canyon late last year when the nations parks chief abruptly blocked the plan after conversations with Coca-Cola, a major donor to the National Park Foundation.

title: A Clash of Titans Exposes Russias Seamy Underside
description: LONDON  In one corner sits Oligarch No. 1, Boris A. Berezovsky, beefy, pugnacious, litigious, voluble, intent on revenge. In the other sits his erstwhile associate and current archenemy, Oligarch No. 2, Roman A. Abramovich, trim, reserved, terse, angry, extremely rich and extremely unhappy about being here.

title: Man Not Charged for Shooting After His Son Was Wounded
description: The first shot went straight up in the air. The second one struck Bobby Baltazars 4-year-old son, Cincere, in the chest as the father was returning the boy to his mothers home.

title: Italian Bond Yields Soar
description: Italys benchmark 10-year bond yield soared above 7 percent in market trading Wednesday. Such high levels led to bailouts of Greece, Ireland and Portugal.

title: Quake Kills at Least 3 in Turkey
description: ISTANBUL  A 5.6-magnitude earthquake on Wednesday in the same region hit by a larger quake two weeks ago killed at least three people and trapped others who had moved into damaged buildings that collapsed Wednesday, the Turkish media reported.

title: Witness Says Councilman Never Asked for Kickbacks
description: A key prosecution witness in the corruption trial of City Councilman Larry B. Seabrook had been expected to testify that Mr. Seabrook had solicited kickbacks. But the witness appeared to surprise prosecutors on Wednesday when he said that Mr. Seabrook had not.

title: Thursday: Fills, as Black Squares
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  O.K., lets get this one out of our systems right from the start: yes, we all loved the Patrick Berry suite of puzzles featured in the Crossing Words contest a few weeks ago.

title: Inside the Whirlwind Set Spinning by War
description: Portraying an eccentric Austrian artist in the new musical The Blue Flower at Second Stage Theater, Marc Kudisch performs the challenging feat of singing several snatches of song in a made-up language created by his character, Max. Its called Maxperanto, and its incomprehensible, naturally, although the talented Mr. Kudisch sings it with the same expressive gusto he brings to the rest of his performance. Unfortunately these moments of sweetly sung gibberish are not the only ones in this high-minded muddle of a musical that may leave you scratching your head.

title: The Blue Flower
description: Photos from the musical at Second Stage.

title: Learning from Phung, and Helping Her
description: My Thursday column argues that we need to absorb more of an education culture, like the one so common in the Confucian belt of East Asia. I make the argument partly through the story of a teenage girl named Phung who won my heart with her amazing work ethic and vaulting ambition. Im pretty sure that Ill be deluged with readers who want to help Phung, and so an aid group named Room to Read  the subject of my Sunday article about it and its founder, John Wood  has set up a fund to help Phung and girls like her. You can find out more at its website here.

title: Alabama Governor Fails to Prevent Countys Record $4 Billion Bankruptcy Filing
description: Last-ditch efforts by the governor of Alabama to prevent a record-breaking municipal bankruptcy in his state broke down on Wednesday, as the Jefferson County Commission voted 4 to 1 to declare bankruptcy on roughly $4 billion of debt.

title: Russians Fight to Save Mars Probe After Mishap
description: Russian space engineers scrambled Wednesday to salvage an ambitious science mission to Mars after the unmanned spacecraft became stranded in Earth orbit. If they are not successful, the probe, which is loaded with toxic fuel, could re-enter the atmosphere within days or weeks.

title: Panel Votes to Reduce a Forage Fish Catch
description: BOSTON  A fishing oversight group voted Wednesday to sharply reduce the allowable East Coast catch of menhaden, an oily forage fish that does not show up on dinner plates but is vital, scientists say, to the ocean ecosystem.

title: GPS Units So Faulty, They Showed Fire Trucks in New York Harbor
description: The Bloomberg administration spent millions of dollars to put custom-made GPS tracking units in fire and garbage trucks, only to have vehicles inexplicably show up on computer screens as if they had sunk to the bottom of Long Island Sound or New York Harbor, the city comptroller has found.

title: Girls Just Want to Go to School

title: Cuomo Calls Vote Results Big Victory for New York
description: Facing an increasingly worrisome budget and eager for additional political allies, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo on Wednesday celebrated Democratic triumphs in several important local government races, calling the election results a big victory for the people of the state.

title: Air Force Mortuary Sent Troop Remains to Landfill
description: WASHINGTON  The mortuary at Dover Air Force Base in Delaware disposed of some body parts of the nations war dead from 2003 to 2008 by burning them and dumping the ashes in a Virginia landfill, an Air Force official said on Wednesday. The practice has since been stopped and the ashes are now put in urns and buried at sea.

title: Database on Doctor Discipline Is Restored, With Restrictions
description: A federal health agency on Wednesday restored to its Web site a database of doctor disciplinary actions two months after removing it from the Internet in response to a doctors complaints.

description: Futures trading, which caters to farmers as well as to hedge funds, was left largely untouched when lawmakers took on Wall Street after the financial crisis.

title: The Once-King of Penn State
description: Few coaches ever attained the level of success and longevity that Joe Paterno enjoyed at Penn State.

title: Bil Keane, Creator of The Family Circus, Dies at 89
description: In the single-panel cartoon that Bil Keane drew for publication on Sept. 10, 1964, the mother is looking at the shopping list posted on the kitchen wall. In her handwriting are the words: Cereal, tea, soap. Following on the list, in sloppy kids scrawl: Ice cream, cookies, plastic soldiers  with all the Ss reversed.

description: If only hed written them on his wrist.

description: ROCHESTER, Mich.   A day after an embarrassing stumble raised new questions about his presidential candidacy, Gov. Rick Perry of Texas said Thursday that he had no intention of leaving the race, and he tried using humor to deflect a fresh round of stinging Republican criticism.

title: Lou Maletta, Gay-Television Pioneer, Dies at 74
description: Lou Maletta, who founded the Gay Cable Network in 1982, when the gay rights movement was not receiving broad media attention, died on Nov. 2 in Kingston, N.Y. He was 74.

title: Republicans Debate in Michigan
description: The Republican candidates for president gathered in Michigan on Wednesday night for a 90-minute exchange that mostly focused on economic issues.

description: In Wednesday nights Republican debate on the economy, Herman Cain suggested that the chief problem holding back companies was regulatory uncertainty. Other candidates, including Gov. Rick Perry of Texas, have made similar claims about regulatory burdens.

description: With pundits lining up post-debate to declare Rick Perrys oops-I-forgot-one-of-the-agencies-I-would-get-rid-of gaffe disastrous for his once high-flying candidacy, another flubbed line was largely overlooked.

title: A Rebound in Europe, Followed by the U.S.

title: Alan Mootnick, Who Studied and Gave a Home to Gibbons, Dies at 60
description: Alan Mootnick once said he felt a certain kinship with gibbons, a small, acrobatic and endangered member of the ape family. Like them, he said, I was lean, agile and comical.

title: As Stocks Fall, Art Surges at a $315.8 Million Sale
description: Despite (or perhaps because of) the stock markets nearly 400-point plunge, on Wednesday night collectors raced to put their available cash  and lots of it  into art.

title: Is Perry Toast?
description: Almost immediately after what will probably be remembered as the Bill Buckner moment of primary debates, when Gov. Rick Perry  of Texas literally forgot which governmental agencies he would cut and concluded his answer with a sheepish Oops, Mr. Perrys stock on the betting market Intrade dropped in half. Tabbed as having about a 9 percent chance of winning the Republican nomination before the debate, the market revised his odds downward to 4 percent just moments after the gaffe.

title: Obama Cuts $4 Billion, Then Uses It Elsewhere
description: WASHINGTON  Cutting wasteful government spending is one of those exercises that even the most ardent political opponents agree is a good thing. But what one does with those savings is quite another matter.

title: David Utz, Surgeon Who Removed Reagans Prostate, Dies at 87
description: Dr. David C. Utz, a prominent urological surgeon at the Mayo Clinic who drew wide attention when he performed prostate surgery on President Ronald Reagan in 1987, died on Oct. 30 in Scottsdale, Ariz. He was 87.

title: Honoring Ernie Pyle, Hometown Hero and the Grunts Bard
description: Two years ago, the state of Indiana cut off funds to a museum in Dana, Ind., that honors Ernie Pyle, the acclaimed war correspondent. A local group is now managing the site, which still has a lot to offer.

title: Gunman Wounds Nurse and Guard at Bronx Hospital
description: A man pulled out a gun and fired at least one shot in a waiting area at a hospital in the Bronx on Wednesday night, injuring a nurse and a security guard, the police said.

title: Justices Likely to Overturn California Law Against Slaughtering Downer Animals
description: WASHINGTON  A California law that seeks to keep animals that are unable to walk out of the food supply seemed unlikely to survive scrutiny from the Supreme Court, judging from the justices questions during arguments on Wednesday.

description: The effort to reduce costs by cutting capacity has often meant closing smaller hospitals.

description: This year for Wells Vegetarian Thanksgiving we are highlighting some of our favorite recipes from Vegetarian Thanksgivings past. We love the look of these Butternut Squash Cannoli from chef Daniel Humm, who modified his recipe for Well to make it vegetarian by omitting the gelatin. A note of caution: For the truly ambitious cook  the kind who keeps N2O cartridges in their kitchen.

title: Wal-Mart to Start Its Sales at 10 P.M. on Thanksgiving
description: With major retailers, including Kohls, Macys, Target and Best Buy, saying they will open at midnight on Thanksgiving this year to offer holiday deals, Wal-Mart is trying to do them one better. It is expected to announce Thursday that it will start deals at 10 p.m. on Thanksgiving Day nationwide.
