title: Listening Again to Rocks Wild Child and Finding Grandeur and Dread
description: The best piece of advice Ive heard someone give an aspiring rock critic is this: For Gods sake, dont try to write like Greil Marcus.

title: At Schools, Making Pizza a Vegetable
description: Is pizza a vegetable? Maybe not in most homes, but in public school cafeterias it is.

title: Apple Makes Changes to Its Board
description: Apple on Tuesday named Arthur D. Levinson as its nonexecutive chairman. Mr. Levinson, chairman of the biotechnology company Genentech, has been a member of Apples board since 2005. Apple also announced that Robert A. Iger, president and chief executive of the Walt Disney Company, would join Apples board. They were the first changes to Apples leadership since the death last month of Steven P. Jobs, the co-founder and chairman. Read the article by Nick Wingfield.

title: Why Turkey Turned Away From Syria
From an Heir Apparent, European Earthiness and an Abundance of Energy
description: The New York musical worlds courtship dance with the conductor Fabio Luisi took a few more turns on Sunday afternoon and Monday evening, when Mr. Luisi brought the Vienna Symphony Orchestra to Avery Fisher Hall. Mr. Luisi, the Metropolitan Operas principal conductor and James Levines heir apparent as music director, has been getting a workout at the opera house as Mr. Levines health problems have kept him off the podium. Mr. Luisi has already picked up the companys new productions of Don Giovanni and Siegfried, with Gtterdmmerung still to come, and he has also deputized effectively for Mr. Levine with the Met Orchestra at Carnegie Hall.

title: A Military Alliance on Full Display
description: Thousands of American and Filipino marines carry out military exercises in the Philippines.

title: A Haircut Returns From the 1930s
description: CLEAN-CUT young men have been going to F.S.C. Barber in the West Village and asking for the same haircut: buzzed on the sides, longer on top and slicked back with a dab of pomade. You could call it a modified McSqueeb, a J. Edgar Hoover or maybe a Jimmy Darmody, after the character in Boardwalk Empire.

title: Surprise Eviction at Zuccotti Park? One Twitter-Friendly Celebrity Saw It Coming
description: It turns out that the Paul Revere for the Occupy Wall Street movement has 1.76 million followers on Twitter. He also plays the drums for The Roots.

title: Dispute Over Bare Islands Underscores Philippines Rocky Relations With China
description: PALAWAN, Philippines  The rhetorical missiles fired by a state-owned Chinese newspaper late last month landed squarely on the shores of this westernmost province and a few dozen kilometers from the coral reefs and scrub-covered islets claimed by China, the Philippines and a number of other nations.

title: Quiet, Please: Sushi Being Served
description: WHEN a good friend insisted a few years back on dining by herself at the French Laundry, the renowned Napa Valley restaurant, I found it hard to comprehend. Wouldnt she miss out on the communal relishing of shared flavors, delights and memories?

title: Reviewing Sushi Yasuda
description: Like many people, I love seafood but Im confused by the many conflicting reports over what is abundant and fished in a sustainable manner, and what is threatened and ought to be avoided. I try to keep up with things by consulting Web sites like the Monterey Bay Aquarium Seafood Watch. But even that information can be perplexing because of the many variables. Was that Atlantic cod line-caught? Thats O.K., Seafood Watch says, but not if was caught in a trawl net.

title: Facebook Fights a Nasty Spam Attack
description: Facebook said a deliberate spam attack was behind a flood of graphic images that some users had reported seeing in their news feeds.

title: Cain Defends His Handling of Libya Question
description: URBANDALE, Iowa  Herman Cain said on Tuesday that he had nothing to explain and no reason to apologize for a rambling pause-filled response when asked in a videotaped interview about President Obamas policy on Libya, raising new questions about his command of foreign policy and his readiness to serve in the Oval Office.

title: Meyer Discusses and Dismisses Arizona Job
description: Urban Meyer met with Arizonas athletic director, Greg Byrne, in Miami early last week to discuss the Wildcats job, according to a person with knowledge of the meeting, but ultimately decided he was not interested. The person said that Meyer, who has expressed his desire to return to coaching, was intrigued but informed Byrne in a telephone call Monday night that he was not going to pursue the job.

title: Google Allows Wi-Fi Owners to Opt Out of Database
description: BERLIN  Google, under pressure from privacy regulators in the Netherlands, said Tuesday that it had agreed to give people around the world the option of keeping the names and locations of their home or business Wi-Fi routers out of a company database.

title: Site to Be Seen | CHCM
description: Established retailers have long sought a presence online, in the hopes of establishing a virtual foothold every bit as solid as their traditional stores. Now, in reverse order, shops that originated on the Web are opening up their own brick-and-mortars. CHCM (Clinton Hill Classic Menswear) just celebrated its first anniversary at 2 Bond Street in New York City, even though the owner, Sweetu Patel, has been selling clothes via the site from his Brooklyn apartment for almost three years. Whether online or in NoHo, shoppers can expect to find a mix of classic brands (Mackintosh parka, $975) and more obscure, under-the-radar labels (Fil Melange sweatshirt, $255; Chauncey turtleneck, $325; and Ovadia and Sons trousers, $265).

title: How Can I Convince My Mother-in-Law to Let Me Cook?
description: Q.

title: E! Keeps Chelsea Handler
description: The star of the late-night hours on E!, Chelsea Handler, will remain attached to the channel through 2014, the channels president, Suzanne Kolb, said Tuesday. Ms. Handler has been the host and a producer of the 11 p.m. talk show, Chelsea Lately, since 2007. Five months ago, in what was perhaps a bit of public negotiating, Ms. Handler hinted to The Hollywood Reporter that she might leave the channel. I cant keep doing the same thing; my brain is bleeding, she said then. I want to do something thats more mindful and isnt celebrity-centered. Already she is involved in a scripted adaptation of her book Are You There, Vodka? Its Me, Chelsea for the NBC network which, like E!, is owned by NBCUniversal. Through the contract announced on Tuesday, Ms. Handlers production company will develop and produce new programs for E! and for other NBCUniversal properties. She will continue to produce After Lately, a semiscripted show that has run after her talk show. Terms of the contract were not disclosed.

title: Facebook Timeline Bumps Online Narcissism Up a Notch
description: There is really only one word to describe Facebooks coming Timeline feature: Mine.

title: Grobanites Get What They Came For
description: Josh Groban, the 30-year-old pop-classical heartthrob, stages his grandiose concerts to show off his assets: his inordinately charming stage presence, his cherubic features and tousled long locks, and (not least) the crystalline baritone he brings to a repertory of operatic ballads. On Monday night at Madison Square Garden his two-hour set, the final show of his Straight to You national tour, was replete with heart-rending orchestral laments and deadpan interludes: You all smell like Chanel No. 5 and pizza.

title: Nets Hold a Rally Amid a Lockout and an Uncertain Season
description: On Tuesday, the day after one of the bleakest in the history of the National Basketball Association  when the players rejected the leagues contract offer, disbanded their union and the season seemed closer to being doomed  the Nets held a rally to promote their Brooklyn Experience outside Borough Hall.

title: A Summer of Freedoms in Boyhood
description: If you didnt know the title of the French movie Tomboy, an intimately scaled film about a 10-year-old girl who wants to be a boy, or at least enjoy some boyish freedoms, you might not know the sex of the pretty child in the opener. And you might not think it mattered. The short hair gives nothing away and neither does the image of this sprite standing up in a cars open sunroof, face in the wind under the light-dappled trees. The driver  the father, you think  has one hand on the wheel and the other on the child, a nice image for a story about lifes balancing acts.

title: Eye Shadow Pencils as an Alternative
description: EYE shadow pencils are a no-fuss way to perk up eyes: they dont crumble like shadows in a pan, or require swabs and brushes. And many have a creamy consistency that feels soothing on the eyelid. But whats their staying power?

title: Bringing Back the Baroque in a Revival Tailored to the Met
description: The Metropolitan Operas production of Handels Rodelinda, created in 2004 as a showcase for the soprano Rene Fleming, went a long way toward establishing Baroque opera  and with it, elements of period performance practice  as something more than a novelty item at the house. So it is fitting that as the Met prepares a grand antiquarian experiment  The Enchanted Island, a Baroque-style pastiche with music by Handel, Vivaldi, Rameau and others, to open on New Years Eve  the signal Rodelinda production should usher it in, in a revival that opened on Monday evening.

title: Apple Appoints New Chairman and Elects Disneys Chief to Board
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Apple on Tuesday named a new board chairman, in another signal that the technology giant would not be run the same way as it was under its co-founder, Steven P. Jobs.

title: Jazz at Lincoln Center to Expand, First in Qatar
description: Jazz at Lincoln Center has plans to expand abroad, creating a new jazz club in Doha, Qatar, and four other cities as part of an unusual partnership with the St. Regis chain of luxury hotels.

description: Q.

title: Recruiting the Inner Military Hero in Men
description: If there were a draft in this country, video games about war probably wouldnt be so popular. The fantasy would be less appealing if the reality of killing and dying in combat with other human beings were more imminent for more people.

title: Trailer: Battlefield 3
description: The combat game is by Electronic Arts.

title: In Fort Worth, A 53 Caddy Takes a Swan Dive Toward Immortality
description: On Friday, Nov. 11, 2011, at 11:11 a.m., the Frank Kent Motor Company of Fort Worth, Tex., broke ground on a new, 85,000-square-foot Cadillac dealership by destroying a vintage Cadillac in spectacular fashion.

title: Zuccotti
description: We dont yet have the full story  because Bloomberg tried to keep anyone from getting it! What we do have is an obviously specious rationale, and a lot of indications of excessive force.

title: Tommy Tune Reimagines Disco Eras Glittery Mecca
description: CORAL GABLES, Fla.  Tommy Tune was once the fleet-footed prince of Broadway, whose flair and Tony Awards triumphs put him in the company of musical auteurs like Bob Fosse and Michael Bennett. And then he disappeared. A pair of painful flops in the 90s led to a self-imposed exile from commercial New York theater, which has not seen anyone quite like Mr. Tune  a triple-threat actor, director and choreographer  since.

title: Limited Broadway Run for Disneys Newsies
description: In a break from its traditionally lavish approach to Broadway, Disney Theatrical Productions announced plans on Tuesday to mount a low-budget, three-month run of its new show Newsies the Musical in New York this spring, limiting its financial risk after two costly flops.

description: The conductor Fabio Luisi led the Vienna Symphony Orchestra, with Eroica Trio, at Avery Fisher Hall on Monday.

title: J. C. Penney Shakes Up Ad Agency Roster, Just Before Christmas
description: Weeks before the crucial Christmas shopping season, J. C. Penney  led by new managers who are grappling with softening sales  is making a big change in its advertising agency roster.

title: What Are the Best Apples for Apple Pie?
description: In preparation for Thanksgiving, Melissa Clark on what apples are best to use in pie.

title: Union Loses Appeal on Teacher Ratings
How Much Nokia Has Lost
description: A report from Gartner says consumers bought 115 million smartphones in the third quarter of 2011, up 42 percent from the third quarter of 2010. As Nokia slipped, its Symbian operating system fell to 16.9 percent of smartphones sold from 36.3 percent. Androids market share doubled, while Apples iOS slipped slightly.

title: Foley Square: A Runners View
description: Odd day. There were helicopters overhead during the night. That happened last for the marathon, and before that when they killed Osama bin Laden. (Theyll be there Thanksgiving, for sure.) But Ive learned that if theres no big event scheduled it means Something Is Going On.

description: Greenwich, Conn., is known for being a haven for multimillionaires. But even businesses based in the wealthy town arent immune from bankruptcy.

title: Step Right Up!
description: Casey Spooner, of the art-rock performance group Fischerspooner, recently spent time in Sarasota, Fla., the resort town better known as the longtime winter quarters of the Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus, to perform in the Wooster Groups production of Hamlet at the Ringling International Arts Festival. Here, he shares his photo and audio diary of the Ringling Circus Museum and the Ca dZan, a marvelous Venetian Gothic mansion built by John and Mable Ringling. Go to interactive feature >>

title: Square Updates App to Highlight Customer Rewards
description: I have piles of loyalty cards from my local coffee shop sprinkled around my house. Each one is half-empty, just a few stamps away from a free cup of coffee. The problem is, I keep losing the cards and have to start over.

description: A look at Tommy Tunes new musical based on Studio 54.

title: Thanksgiving Countdown | Toss Out the Marshmallows
description: Humbly submitted, an alternative to sweet potatoes blitzed with marshmallow and baked to mush: baby sweet potatoes, which need only be scrubbed and roasted to turn into candy themselves. More information is here.

title: Got More Voters? Get More Electoral Votes
description: Republicans in many states are pursuing two avenues to tilt elections their way  changing the electoral college rules in the middle of the game and using laws and regulations to block likely Democratic voters from exercising their legitimate franchise. Both ploys demand new thinking to enhance our elections, not constrain them in partisan ways.

title: The Life Report: Matthew Kirk Gooding
description: The following Life Report was submitted in response to my column of Oct. 28, in which I asked readers over 70 to write autobiographical essays evaluating their own lives.

description: So you want to be an Internet billionaire. Its not just about having a great idea and building a world-class business at light speed.

title: International Team Has Familiarity and History on Its Side
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Forget Tiger Woods and Phil Mickelson. The real star of the Presidents Cup this week is likely to be Royal Melbourne Golf Club, with an assist from Mother Nature.

title: The OWS Ruling
description: This afternoon the New York Supreme Court ruled against the Occupy Wall Street protesters, saying it was kosher for the city to ban tents in Zuccotti Park. Its a short opinion (you can read it here) that comes down to two essential points:

title: Beyond Seizing Parks, New Paths to Influence
description: The anti-Wall Street protests, which are being driven from their urban encampments across the nation, now face a pivotal challenge: With their outposts gone, will their movement wither?

title: A Kentucky City Reinvents a Faded Downtown
description: OWENSBORO, Ky.  Ron Payne, the energetic and determined 65-year-old mayor of this small city on the Ohio River, keeps a map of new development projects in a corner of his City Hall office. There are more than a dozen sticky notes fixed to the map, each designating the location and cost of a local construction project recently completed, under way or planned.

title: Q&A: Answers To Where on Earth to Eat?
description: ITS no secret that Anthony Bourdain knows his way around food  but hes also a world traveler. His new show, The Layover, on the Travel Channel, has him visiting cities for 48 hours or less, looking for the best places for travelers to eat and drink. Here are excerpts from a conversation about some of his all-time favorites.

title: Shrinking Middle as Income Inequality Rises
description: The share of American families living in middle-income neighborhoods has decreased, while the share in affluent or poor neighborhoods has increased.

title: Netflix Goes Android First, but Barely
description: The bounty of apps for iPad and iPhone are one of the cornerstones of Apples strategy for promoting the devices. It isnt a great sign for the company then, when an important developer says its going to do a superior app first for Googles rival Android operating system.

title: S.E.C. Claws Back $2.8 Million From CSK Executive
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission announced on Tuesday that it had reached a deal to claw back $2.8 million in compensation from CSK Auto Corporations former chief executive and chairman, who ran the company during an accounting fraud scandal.

title: The Right Questions
description: Bob Costass interview on Monday night with Jerry Sandusky, the former Penn State assistant coach who has been charged with 40 counts of sexual abuse, underscored his ability to ask the right questions, and in this case, ask the right questions despite the lurid and unsettling details of the accusations.

title: A Room of Their Own for 2-Wheeled Commuters
description: Creating a bicycle room for tenants at 345 Hudson Street turned out to be a good fit. The blocklong building in the quiet streets of northern TriBeCa has a low carbon footprint, and many employees of businesses there, like Penguin Putnam, Starbucks and CBS Radio, were already biking to work. And there was an unused storage space off Charlton Street, adjacent to a loading dock and with access to the lobby.

description: Q.

description: Apple is pushing out its i-device update, which is supposed to cure battery problems that have plagued some iPhone 4Gs owners, although owners report uneven results from the update.

description: The Op-Ed columnist Nicholas D. Kristof visits displaced Occupy Wall Street protesters and witnesses arrests.

title: Congress Blocks New Rules on School Lunches
description: WASHINGTON  A slice of pizza still counts as a vegetable.

title: Solyndra Was Asked to Delay Layoff News Till After Midterms, Memo Says
description: WASHINGTON  The Energy Department asked the Solyndra solar equipment company to delay an announcement about impending layoffs until after last years midterm elections, according to a memo by the Republican staff of the House subcommittee that will call the energy secretary to testify Thursday about a government loan to Solyndra.

title: Debating Legacy Preferences in Admissions
description: Why do top schools still take legacy applicants? The Timess Room for Debate team asked that very question this week, assembling an online forum of six academics, administrators and admissions experts who delivered their own, different answers and arguments.

title: Larry and Paul and Dave and Ian
description: A belated note on the Munk debate. Felix Salmon has a summary. The weird thing is that to the extent there was an argument about the economics, it was three-sided, and didnt correspond to the teams: Larry Summers and me basically doing liquidity-trap macro, David Rosenberg not too different in analysis of the problem but expressing deep pessimism about the prospects for policy even given the political will, and Ian Bremmer making the case that America is better than other countries, which even if true had no bearing on the question, as far as I could see.

title: Paterno Passes on Home to His Wife for $1
description: STATE COLLEGE, Pa.  Joe Paterno transferred full ownership of his house to his wife, Sue, for $1 in July, less than four months before a sexual abuse scandal engulfed his Penn State football program and the university.

title: As U.S. Looks to Asia, It Sees China Everywhere
description: The last time the remote Australian city of Darwin played a significant role in American military planning was during the early days of World War II, when Gen. Douglas MacArthur used the port as the base for his campaign to reclaim the Pacific from the Japanese.

title: Middle-Class Areas Shrink as Income Gap Grows, New Report Finds
description: WASHINGTON  The portion of American families living in middle-income neighborhoods has declined significantly since 1970, according to a new study, as rising income inequality left a growing share of families in neighborhoods that are mostly low-income or mostly affluent.

title: A.L. Cy Young Winner, and Perhaps More
description: Voters for the Cy Young Awards did not have to dig too deeply into advanced statistics this season. By every meaningful metric, modern or traditional, the best pitchers in the league were obvious.

title: Campaigns Bring Art and Artists to Life
description: ANEW commercial for the Detroit Institute of Arts opens with a woman responding to an off-camera interviewer, although the question is not revealed: He had olive skin.

title: London Protesters Warily Watch New York
description: LONDON  The news reached London as the first dim glimmers of dawn crested the great dome of St. Pauls Cathedral.

title: Whats an Updated Way to Do Sweet Potatoes?
description: Q.

title: Eurogeddon
description: Eurozone bonds hit by mass sell-off.

title: Portugal Advances, Completing Euro 2012 Field
description: Portugal, Croatia, Ireland and the Czech Republic closed out victories in their two-leg playoffs Tuesday to claim the final four places in next summers European Championship.

title: Sexual Harassment in the Workplace
description: To the Editor:

title: New Chief Once Urged City Control of Transit
description: Joseph J. Lhota, who started this week as the new chief of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, has said little about his plans for the troubled agency.

title: Inaction on Goalie Hit Is Criticized
description: TORONTO  Brendan Shanahan, the N.H.L. director for player safety, was handed something of a rebuke by general managers Tuesday at their annual fall meeting. Many agreed that the Boston Bruins Milan Lucic should have been suspended for the hit he delivered on Buffalo Sabres goalie Ryan Miller last Saturday.

title: Generation Do
description: To the Editor:

title: An Explosion in Iran
description: To the Editor:

title: When a Dog Is Hit by a Car
description: To the Editor:

title: When DNA Evidence Suggests Innocent, Some Prosecutors Cling to Maybe
description: CHICAGO  For 17 years, Terrill Swift and three other men convicted in the 1994 rape and strangulation of a prostitute here have insisted on their innocence. And last May, a powerful new piece of evidence emerged that appeared to back their claim: a DNA profile, constructed from semen found in the victims body, matched a man who was convicted of raping and strangling another prostitute a few years later.

title: Will I Kill My Family if I Cook the Stuffing Inside the Turkey?
description: Q.

title: Critique of Health Insurers
description: To the Editor:

title: Dells Profit Improves as Sales Miss Expectations
description: Dell, the maker of personal computers, reported quarterly sales that missed estimates, even as its focus on higher-margin technology helped its profit.

title: On Fire Island, Blaze Destroys Hub of the Gay Social Scene
description: The Pavilion dance club, the locus of the social scene in gay-centric Fire Island Pines, was destroyed Monday night in a spectacular fire that illuminated the eastern horizon opposite Long Island.

title: Austrian Returns, Unrepentant, to Online Jihad
description: VIENNA  Mohamed Mahmoud, a 26-year-old Austrian, wears a traditional white tunic and a light-brown hat and keeps his hair long, as is the tradition in the Pashtun tribal areas of Pakistan and Afghanistan. Only his camouflage vest and dark-blue sneakers place him in the modern world here in Europe, which he re-entered Sept. 12 after serving a four-year prison sentence for joining and actively supporting Al Qaeda and its affiliates.

title: Mohamed Mahmoud
description: Mohamed Mahmoud talks about the U.S. and nuclear weapons.

title: Ronaldo Leads Portugal Into Euro 2012
description: LISBON  The match was only seven minutes old when Cristiano Ronaldos 35-yard free kick dipped and swerved, eluding the grasp of goalkeeper Asmir Begovic.

title: Sandusky Turns to TV to Break Silence
description: Jerry Sanduskys voice was halting, and his affect was oddly flat. He denied charges of pedophilia but didnt flash the indignant anger of a person wrongly accused. Sandusky, the former Penn State defensive coordinator who is charged with sexually abusing young boys, told Bob Costas of NBC over the telephone on Monday night that he had done nothing wrong, but that in retrospect, he regretted the showers and horseplay.

title: In a Wrestling Match Over Space, a Sudden Shove
description: Over the routine din of Union Square, you could hear the drills and their spiraling whines. All around were sights that went with the sounds. Sheets of raw plywood, set on sawhorses, measured twice and cut once to size. A woman on a stepladder, a pan of red paint in reach, the swabs of her brush laying holiday color on the wood. A man atop a counter, clipping light fixtures onto a rack that ran overhead, fed by electrical cables that roped along the back of the stall.

title: Novelist Fights the Tide by Opening a Bookstore
description: NASHVILLE  After a beloved local bookstore closed here last December and another store was lost to the Borders bankruptcy, this city once known as the Athens of the South, rich in cultural tradition and home to Vanderbilt University, became nearly barren of bookstores.

title: Out of Camps in Africa and Into Debt in America
description: Ndayishimiye Gabo sat motionless in a damp Bronx apartment with peeling wallpaper, leaking faucets and dilapidated floors, staring at an eviction notice in one hand and a court order in the other.

title: What Are Some Easy Side Dishes That Will Break Up the Monotony?
description: Q.

title: Presidents Cup Pairings Pit Woods and His Ex-Caddie
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  The first day of the Presidents Cup will feature the matchup golf fans have been craving. The Americans Tiger Woods and his partner Steve Stricker will face the International teammates Adam Scott and K. J. Choi in Thursdays anchor foursomes matchup. Or, as this heavyweight bout will be better known: Tiger Woods versus his former caddie Steve Williams.

title: Arizonans Vie to Claim Cross-Cultural Fried Food
description: PHOENIX  Florida has its key lime pie, Idaho its potatoes and Georgia favors grits as its official state food. Arizona, hungry to lay claim to a state food of its own, is circling the chimichanga.

title: CBS Details Its Broad Overhaul of The Early Show
description: Pain is evident in the voice of the CBS News chairman, Jeff Fager, when he talks about the ratings performance of The Early Show, the networks long-suffering morning news broadcast.

title: For Weight Loss, a Recipe of Teamwork and Trust
description: On Friday I wrote about Saddleback Church, which is using its small groups as an infrastructure to help its members lose weight and live healthier lives. The megachurch has megaplans for this idea  the churchs pastor, the Rev. Rick Warren, hopes to expand it through the worldwide network of thousands of churches that are affiliated with Saddleback and the 150,000 pastors who subscribe to his newsletter.

title: Stop the Great Firewall of America
description: China operates the worlds most elaborate and opaque system of Internet censorship. But Congress, under pressure to take action against the theft of intellectual property, is considering misguided legislation that would strengthen Chinas Great Firewall and even bring major features of it to America.

title: Bell Ringers Go Digital This Season
description: Soon, the holiday sounds of coins clinking into red kettles may disappear, replaced by the silence of a credit card swipe.

title: Swings of Fortune Continue as G.O.P. Candidates Return to the Trail
description: BETTENDORF, Iowa  A Republican presidential race that has been dominated by debate appearances and television interviews took a turn back to the rigors of retail politicking on Tuesday, with candidates making their cases directly to voters who are struggling to find clarity in an unusual boom-to-bust primary campaign.

title: Across U.S., Demonstrators Face Arrests and Evictions
description: ATLANTA Late last month, 52 protesters in Woodruff Park, downtown, were arrested for violating an ordinance that prohibits people in the park from 11 p.m. to 6 a.m. Protesters have taken to rallying in front of banks and foreclosed houses.

title: Lottery Numbers
Success and Advice Cast a Giant as a Villain, Not a Model, in Europe
description: BERLIN  Throughout the crisis in the euro zone, as governments have fallen, debt burdens have mounted and economies have stagnated or shrunk, Germany has floated above the fray. While its economy has hummed along nicely, its leaders have steadfastly insisted that the path to redemption for the debtors lies in austerity and suffering.

title: In Attempt to Force Talks, N.B.A. Players File Antitrust Suit
description: Locked-out players began their legal assault on the N.B.A. on Tuesday, filing an antitrust lawsuit that demands an end to what they contend is an illegal boycott of the work force. They are seeking monetary damages for lost wages, which would be tripled under antitrust law.

title: The Broccoli Test
description: Cambridge, Mass.

title: Jolted, Wall St. Protesters Face Challenge for Future
description: Emergency-service trucks rumbled up Broadway to positions on two sides of Zuccotti Park. Powerful klieg lights blinked on, illuminating about 220 protesters in tents and sleeping bags. The one-square-block plaza was as bright as day. But it was only 1 a.m.

title: Why China Wont Listen
description: Guangzhou, China

title: Whistlers Brother
description: Shortly after the Civil War broke out, Dr. William McNeill Whistler, scion of a storied Anglo-American military family and brother of the artist James McNeill Whistler, arrived in Richmond, Va., to lobby Confederate leaders for a medical officers commission. Described as a genial, refined man with a soft and pleasant voice, the 25-year-old, Massachusetts-born Whistler was firmly determined to put his medical training to use.

title: In Court, Confronting Man With Story of a Rape and a Ruse
description: It was the moment that Seemona Sumasar said she had been waiting for.

title: For Jets, Abbreviated Turnaround May Help
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  It is good to have a short memory in the N.F.L. For the Jets, who play Thursday night against the Denver Broncos, their two-and-a-half-day turnaround is the quickest way to move beyond their sobering 37-16 loss to the New England Patriots on Sunday night.

title: Authentic Filipino Moderno
description: OF every ethnic restaurant it is inevitably asked: Is it authentic? Check Maharlikas bona fides. On the cocktail list is Tang. On the menu is Spam. By the front door is Jesus, in embossed metal, presiding at the Last Supper.

title: After $5.1 Billion Loss, Postal Service Predicts Weaker 2012
description: The United States Postal Service is forecasting a record $14.1 billion loss for the 2012 fiscal year as a drop in mail volumes accelerates.

title: Buffett Makes a Value-Growth Bet
Whos the Decider?
description: Driving to the covered bazaar in the exotic western Indian town of Jodhpur last week, our Indian guide stopped to point out a modern landmark. Do you see that stoplight? he asked, pointing to a standard green-yellow-red stoplight in the busy intersection. Its the only stoplight in Jodhpur. There are 1.2 million people living here.

title: Flubs Are Rubbing Some Republicans the Wrong Way
description: The Republican presidential candidates have served comedians a full platter of laughs this year  a steady diet of gaffes, misstatements, puzzled looks and long, awkward pauses.

title: Basketball in Doubt, TV Tries to Fill a Gap
description: With the full National Basketball Association season in jeopardy now that talks between the players union and the league have collapsed, television stations are scrambling to put together a prime-time schedule without professional basketball.

title: Dining Calendar
description: Cooking School Is In

title: Off the Menu
description: Opening

title: Skimming the Fat Without the Fuss
description: A fat separator helps get turkey drippings in shape for the gravy boat. There are various glass, plastic and metal cups, pitchers and ladles to simplify the job of skimming, but this separator has some clever features. The one-quart plastic container does not have a spout near the base, as many separators do. Instead, it works by releasing the liquid below the layer of fat or oil through a little trapdoor at the bottom opened by squeezing the spring-loaded handle, like a sifter. Its silicone lid is a screen to catch pieces of onion or other solids that might clog the opening at the bottom, and there is a small pouring spout near the containers rim. The device is also dishwasher safe.

title: Witness Says Councilman Led Him to a Contractor
description: To anyone familiar with Bronx politics, it should come as little surprise that Stanley K. Schlein would make an appearance at the criminal trial of City Councilman Larry B. Seabrook.

title: Spared in War, Libyas Oil Flow Is Surging Back
description: ZAWIYAH, Libya  The bullet holes in the oil tanks have been patched, the damaged backup generator is being repaired, and most important, the pipeline that feeds the giant oil refinery here has been reopened.

title: Sanduskys Roots
description: Memories and landmarks of Jerry Sanduskys past are scattered throughout his hometown of Washington, Pa.

title: In Sanduskys Birthplace, the Man They Knew
description: WASHINGTON, Pa.  The Brownson House, the old red-brick recreation center on Jefferson Avenue, was like a hearth the whole community huddled around. Every child played there, one generation after another, bouncing a basketball on an undersize court that had an inconvenient pillar in the middle.

title: Wednesday: Shot Follower
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  Ready to party? Gary Cee is, and hes invited us to toss back a few boilermakers. Thats a beer followed by a shot of harder alcohol as a BEER CHASER (or the shot can be dropped into the mug of beer and consumed together).

title: G.O.P. Is Optimistic but Democrats Are Glum on Deficit Panel
description: WASHINGTON  Congressional leaders began to insert themselves more deeply Tuesday into the work of a joint committee charged with taming the deficit, as Republicans in both chambers embraced a plan devised by Senator Patrick J. Toomey, one of their partys representatives on the panel. Democrats appeared to be less united and struggling to come up with a counteroffer.

title: Celebrating Peace and Unity in Libya, but Feeling Tension Beneath the Surface
description: ZINTAN, Libya  Few towns sacrificed or contributed as much to the Libyan insurrection as this dusty mountain town southwest of Tripoli. On Tuesday there was joy, poetry, exhibitions of masterful horsemanship, parachute jumps, speeches and symbols of national unity. Dozens of war prisoners were even quietly freed.

title: Bloggingheads: Too Dumb To Win?
description: Ann Althouse, left, of the University of Wisconsin Law School and Glenn Loury of Brown University debate Rick Perry's intelligence.

title: A Special Day at the Office as Krzyzewski Sets a Record
description: Mike Krzyzewski solemnly walked down the sideline to shake the hand of Michigan State Coach Tom Izzo, then walked back toward the Duke bench and made a sharp left. He crossed the court at Madison Square Garden and walked purposefully toward an old coach in a green sweater.

title: Mexico: A Familiar Candidate
description: Andrs Manuel Lpez Obrador announced on Tuesday that he would lead Mexicos leftist Party of the Democratic Revolution, or P.R.D., in the 2012 presidential election. Mr. Lpez Obrador beat Marcelo Ebrard, the mayor of Mexico City, in a poll of 6,000 people that the two men had agreed would determine which of them would be the partys candidate. Mr. Ebrard has agreed to throw his support behind Mr. Lpez Obrador, who lost to President Felipe Caldern in 2006 by half a percentage point. Mr. Obrador never accepted that result, and his loss set off mass protests.

title: Colombia: Rebels Pick New Leader
description: The Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, the rebel group known as the FARC, disclosed Tuesday that its secretariat had named Rodrigo Londoo as its new top commander. The FARC said in a statement that the decision was made unanimously by the groups leadership on Nov. 5, a day after Colombian forces killed Alfonso Cano, the previous commander. Mr. Londoo, 52, who uses the aliases Timochenko and Timolen Jimnez, is considered one of the FARCs leading intelligence operatives and a mastermind of its cocaine trafficking activities. The United States Department of State is offering a reward of as much as $5 million for the capture of Mr. Londoo, who American officials say has ordered subordinates to increase production of coca, the plant used to make cocaine, and kidnap American citizens.

title: The Mayor Confronts the Protesters
description: The Occupy Wall Street protesters had achieved a great deal before they were rousted from Zuccotti Park by New York City police on Tuesday morning. This ragged group, living in tents and tarps for two months in the financial district in Lower Manhattan, helped focus everyones attention on the growing income inequality in this country. They made 99 percent into popular language for the have-nots. They spawned protests against further enriching the already rich 1 percent, like those in Chicago, Boston, Oakland, Calif., New Haven, and even London.

title: Hip Procedure Grows Popular Despite Doubt
description: It is one of the most popular operations in sports medicine. It comes in various forms, all with the same name: Hip impingement or bone shaving surgery. World-renowned athletes have had the operation  the Yankees third baseman Alex Rodriguez had it about two years ago and the sprinter Tyson Gay had it last summer.

title: Rangers Top Isles for 7th Straight Win
description: Disparities in victories, statistics and payroll rarely register when the Rangers and the Islanders meet. Although the Rangers entered the latest installment of the rivalry having won their last six games  and the Islanders having lost 9 of 10  the Rangers could not exhale until the final seconds of their 4-2 victory Tuesday night at Nassau Coliseum.

title: Egypts Elections
description: Egyptians are embarked upon the next step in their Arab Spring evolution  electing a democratic civilian government. Tunisias elections went smoothly last month. But the signs in Egypt, a far more influential player, are not good. The army, which is still running the show, appears to be far more interested in protecting its power than promoting real democratic change.

title: Donya Feuer, Modern-Dance Choreographer, Dies at 77
description: Donya Feuer, an American modern-dance choreographer who moved to Sweden in 1963 and became a close collaborator of Ingmar Bergman as well as a theater director and filmmaker in her own right, died on Nov. 6 in Stockholm. She was 77.

title: Another Plan for Tax Cuts
description: Facing an effective deadline at the end of this week for the Congressional supercommittee to come up with a plan for cutting the deficit, Republicans have offered an approach that would raise revenues by $300 billion and cut spending by $1.2 trillion. That is the first time party leaders have acknowledged that any new money should be raised to cut red ink. But the proposal is highly deceptive  the main goal seems to ensure even deeper tax cuts for the wealthy  and demonstrates why the committee seems headed toward a deadlock.

title: Latest Dirty Water Bill
description: Republicans just wont give up on their misguided attempts to subvert the Clean Water Act. Senators John Barrasso of Wyoming and Dean Heller of Nevada plan to offer a rider denying protections to one-fifth of the nations wetlands and as many as two million miles of small streams. The House has approved a similarly destructive measure, so it is crucial that the Senate majority leader, Harry Reid, and his Democratic colleagues block this legislation.

title: After Fall, Silver Talks About His Stitches
description: ALBANY  In Puerto Rico for a legislative conference Thursday, the Assembly speaker, Sheldon Silver, decided to make the most of the pleasant weather. So, he said, he rented a bicycle and set off for a jaunt in San Juan.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 1,819 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans this week:

title: The Second Coming of Gingrich
description: Rick Tyler knew it would come to this. When Newt Gingrich kicked off his presidential campaign in May by criticizing Congressman Paul Ryans Medicare reforms as right-wing social engineering, thus incurring the wrath of the very conservatives that he presumably needed to win over, there was a rush to write the former House speakers political obituary. But Tyler, then Gingrichs spokesman, had an answer for the doubters  a statement so epic that it deserves to be reproduced in its entirety.

title: The Kitchen Rescue Team
description: The cranberries wont gel. The pie crust broke. The turkeys frozen. The mashed potatoes are as lumpy as a sack of olives. Aunt Miriam is bringing her well-known marshmallow tartare. There are 17 guests and only 9 chairs. Meanwhile, the children  Wait, where are the children?

title: Pat Passlof, Abstract Expressionist Painter, Dies at 83
description: Pat Passlof, an Abstract Expressionist painter whose canvases vibrate with unpredictable line and thick, luminous color, died on Sunday at her home in Manhattan. She was 83.

title: Giants Were Present During Killing at Club
description: A gunman opened fire at a crowded Manhattan nightclub early Tuesday morning, killing a 44-year-old man and wounding two other people while many professional athletes and entertainers  including several players on the Giants  were nearby, the police said. No connection has been made between the shooting at the Juliette Supper Club on West 21st Street and any of the athletes.

title: Some Troops to Stay in Iraq as Trainers, Top Officer Says
description: WASHINGTON  Some United States forces will remain as military trainers on 10 bases in Iraq even after an end-of-year deadline for all American troops to be out of the country, Gen. Martin E. Dempsey, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, told a Senate committee on Tuesday.

title: A Surprise Nighttime Raid, Then a Tense Day of Maneuvering in the Streets
description: Almost two months after Occupy Wall Street protesters took over Zuccotti Park, police cleared out the encampment in the early hours of Nov. 15. Shortly after midnight, police trucks moved in and took up positions along the parks perimeter.

title: Ilya Zhitomirskiy Dies at 22; Co-Founded Social Network
description: Ilya Zhitomirskiy, a co-founder of the start-up social network Diaspora*, which has been described as the anti-Facebook for its emphasis on personal privacy and decentralized data collection, died on Saturday at his home in San Francisco. He was 22.

title: Turkish Family Braces for Jolts and Uncertainty
description: VAN, Turkey  The once busy sidewalks of this city in eastern Turkey have morphed into a desolate maze of partly collapsed buildings, broken glass and windows hanging dangerously askew.

title: Village in Iraq Falters With Exit of U.S. Troops
description: SOKUR, Iraq  The name of this dusty little village means falcon in Arabic, a reference to its history as a residential community for workers at a nearby airport. But most people in Iraq call it Traitor Town.

title: Rangers Win 7th Straight Against Floundering but Feisty Isles
description: Disparities in victories, statistics and payroll rarely register when the Rangers and Islanders meet. Although the visiting Rangers entered the latest installment of the rivalry having won their last six games, while the Islanders had lost 9 of their previous 10, the Rangers could not exhale until the final seconds of their 4-2 victory Tuesday night at Nassau Coliseum.

title: Canada: Top Scientists Urge Allowing Assisted Suicide
description: In a study released on Tuesday, Canadas leading scientific and academic body recommended the legalization of voluntary euthanasia and assisted suicide. The six authors from a variety of fields and countries who conducted the study for the Royal Society of Canada said there was no evidence that legalizing those acts poses a threat to vulnerable people, or that decriminalization will lead us down a slippery slope from assisted suicide and voluntary euthanasia to non-voluntary or involuntary euthanasia. But they did conclude that there is a moral right to allow competent and informed people to decide when their lives are no longer worth living. (The group defined voluntary euthanasia as taking the life of someone who has expressed a wish to die but is incapable of performing the act.) Any system to assist suicides, the report said, must be carefully regulated and monitored. The issues have been debated extensively in recent years after several high-profile court cases.

title: Protesters Return to Zuccotti Park
description: New York City on Tuesday reopened the park in Lower Manhattan where the Occupy Wall Street movement was born not long after a judge upheld the citys move to clear the park and bar the protesters from bringing back their tents or staying overnight.

title: Protesters Return to Zuccotti Park
description: New York City on Tuesday reopened the park in Lower Manhattan where the Occupy Wall Street movement was born.

title: Romney Tax Return Offers a Glimpse
description: Ann Romney, the wife of Mitt Romney, increased her donations to a family foundation by $1.5 million last year, raising its total assets to $10 million, according to a tax return filed on Tuesday.

title: Pairings for Day 1 of the Presidents Cup
description: The pairings for the first day of the Presidents Cup were released today, with everyones attention falling on the final pairing that puts Tiger Woods and Steve Stricker against Adam Scott and K.J. Choi. Woodss former caddie Stevie Williams now caddies for Scott, making for a potentially tense round. The rest of the pairings and tee times are as follows:

title: Supporters of Giffords Find Reasons to Cheer
description: PHOENIX  Jeff Rogers, who is chairman of the Democratic Party in southern Arizona where Representative Gabrielle Giffords is the congresswoman, admits he had his doubts about her political future in the opening moments of her first public interview since she was shot in the head in January.

title: For a Change, the Marlins Are Center Stage at the General Managers Meetings
description: MILWAUKEE  Dozens of reporters were mingling with team executives Tuesday afternoon in a seventh-floor ballroom at the Pfister Hotel, the site of baseballs general managers meetings, when Larry Beinfests entrance sent a ripple through the crowd.

title: Corrections: November 16
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Some Giants Were at Club Where Man Was Fatally Shot
description: A gunman opened fire at a crowded Manhattan nightclub early Tuesday morning, killing a 44-year-old man and wounding two people while several entertainers and professional athletes  including up to five Giants players  were nearby, the police said.

title: Toyota and Lexus Are Back on Top in Kelley Blue Book Resale Value Survey
description: Toyota and Lexus are the brands with the best resale value for 2012 models, according to Kelley Blue Book.

title: Ford Unboxes the 2013 Escape
description: Revealed on Wednesday, Nov. 16: 2013 Ford Escape.

title: The Right Reasons to Stretch Before Exercise
description: For an article being published in next months issue of The British Journal of Sports Medicine, researchers at the University of Sydney in Australia reviewed dozens of recent studies of stretching, hoping to determine whether the practice prevents people from getting sore after they exercise. The authors found 12 studies completed in the past 25 years that looked directly at that issue. Most were small and short-term. But each produced essentially the same result, the review authors write, showing that stretching does not produce important reductions in muscle soreness in the days following exercise.

title: EMBARGOED UNTIL 12:01AM on 11/16!!
description: 2013 Ford Escape slide show

title: Word of the Day | demented
description: demented \di-men-td\ adjective

title: Newswallah: In the English-Language Press Wednesday
description: The Uttar Pradesh cabinet led by Chief Minster Mayawati on Tuesday approved the division of the state into four regions: Purvanchal (eastern region), Bundelkhand, Avadh Pradesh (central region) and Paschim Pradesh (western region). Ms. Mayawati announced that a resolution will be tabled in the winter session of the state Assembly, then forwarded to the central government for approval (The Hindu). This decision comes ahead of the state elections scheduled for early next year. An editorial in The Indian Express, Wednesday titled Four State Solution, argues that if the division comes through, four states would mean four capitals, with attention lavished on each. There will, hopefully, be a rejuvenation of the fabled old towns strewn across the current Uttar Pradesh, the author says.

title: NYT Front Page for 11/16/2011
description: NYT Front Page for 11/16/2011

title: New Muppet, New Movie
description: Walter, the latest addition to the Muppets family, stars in The Muppets.

title: #OccupyWallSt Roundup, Day 60
description: After a swift raid emptied Zuccotti Park early Tuesday morning, uncertainty lingered the rest of the day and  into the night, with a late-night march heading toward police headquarters, hundreds of protesters crashing on friends couches and dwindling crowds at the reopened park, now a no-sleeping zone. [The New York Times]

title: A Radical Centrist View on Election Forecasting
description: Ron Klain, the former chief of staff to Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., has a long critique up at Bloomberg about the piece that I published in The New York Times Magazine recently about President Obamas re-election prospects. His article takes the view that campaign strategy and other intangibles are quite important in presidential campaigns and that statistical forecasts do a poor job of accounting for these.

title: Iraq Village Falters With U.S. Exit
description: Andrew E. Kramer reports on the lingering effects of the American presence in Sokur, Iraq, a village many Iraqis have nicknamed Traitor Town.

title: Bollywoods Rockstar Disappoints Tibetans
Of Militants and Boy Bands
description: LONDON  Two videos have gone viral in Pakistan over the past few weeks. Both feature three young Pakistani men. Both flay the establishment. In one, the men wield Kalashnikovs; in the other, they brandish microphones. Such are the tools of change in a country that seems to have lost its way.

title: Test Yourself | Math, Nov. 16, 2011
description: Test your math skills with this question created by Bobson Wong at Math for America from the article U.N. Says 7 Billion Now Share the World.

title: Nov. 16, 1933 | U.S. Establishes Diplomatic Relations With the Soviet Union
description: On Nov. 16, 1933, at 10 minutes before midnight, the United States and the Soviet Union established diplomatic relations. President Franklin D. Roosevelt sent a telegram to the Soviet leader Maxim Litvinov, expressing hope that United States-Soviet relations would forever remain normal and friendly.

title: News Quiz | Nov. 16, 2011
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper.

title: Karzai Details Vision for Long-Term Partnership With U.S.
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  President Hamid Karzai for the first time publicly laid out his vision of a long-lasting agreement that could keep the American military in Afghanistan for years, in a speech to Afghans on Wednesday that seemed both a warning to neighboring Pakistan and Iran and an attempt to win over a skeptical domestic audience.

title: A U.S. Marine Base for Australia Irritates China
description: CANBERRA, Australia  President Obama announced Wednesday that the United States planned to deploy 2,500 Marines in Australia to shore up alliances in Asia, but the move prompted a sharp response from Beijing, which accused Mr. Obama of escalating military tensions in the region.

title: Reaching Toward the Future at Google
description: WHAT is Google X?WHAT are some projects in development there?WHAT do you want in the future?

title: Faces, and Voices, From Zuccotti Park
description: Before he moved to California to become a photographer, August Bradley had what he calls the coolest job I can think of in corporate America, brainstorming on long-term concepts for major clothing brands.

title: Teaching Good Sex
description: First base, second base, third base, home run, Al Vernacchio ticked off the classic baseball terms for sex acts. His goal was to prompt the students in Sexuality and Society  an elective for seniors at the private Friends Central School on Philadelphias affluent Main Line  to examine the assumptions buried in the venerable metaphor. Give me some more, urged the fast-talking 47-year-old, who teaches 9th- and 12th-grade English as well as human sexuality. Arrayed before Vernacchio was a circle of small desks occupied by 22 teenagers, six male and the rest female  a blur of sweatshirts and Ugg boots and form-fitting leggings.

title: Could Every Day Be Black Friday?
description: If an alien with an accounting degree touched down in America, it might conclude that were a weird cult that spends 11 months living frugally and four crazy weeks buying tons of stuff we dont need. It wouldnt be entirely wrong, either. Retailers make around a fifth of their sales during the holiday season  close to half a trillion dollars  when the ratio of frivolous to necessary purchases spikes. Its not unusual for large chains to operate in the red from New Years Day through Thanksgiving and then make it all up in those crazy weeks.

title: Do You Sympathize With the Occupy Wall Street Movement?
description: The New York Times recently asked readers to plot their opinions about the Occupy Wall Street movement on a graph. Do you know what those in the Occupy movement are protesting? Do you sympathize with their complaints? Do you agree with the protesters methods? Why or why not?

title: Comfort Food a Phone Call Away for New Yorks Desis
description: It was the summer of 2002, I was getting married, and my in-laws were coming to New York from Mumbai for our wedding.

title: Peabody Energy Wins Full Control of Macarthur Coal
description: LONDON  Peabody Energy said on Wednesday that it had acquired more than 90 percent of Macarthur Coal of Australia. The announcement allows Peabody, an American coal company, to require Macarthurs remaining shareholders, including the South Korean steel maker Posco, to sell their stakes.

title: Week 10 Film Review: Cutler and Bears Look Sharp
description: A closer look at Week 10 via film review:

title: The Sharp Increase in the Food Stamps Program
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago.

title: Where to Find Holiday Gifts in Romes Markets
description: Looking for a unique gift to bring home from Rome? Dont waste time in souvenir shops. Instead, the citys markets are a great way to get some of that holiday shopping done early.

title: Part 3: Answers to Your Questions on Scholarships and Student Loans
description: To help readers of The Choice navigate the maze of scholarships available to them  as well as to further their understanding of President Obamas recent proposal to ease the repayment of some student loans  Mark Kantrowitz, a financial aid expert and founder of the Web sites finaid.org and fastweb.com, is spending this week in our virtual Guidance Office. Mr. Kantrowitz is the author of Secrets to Winning a Scholarship, published in February.

title: The Early Word: Next!
description: Todays Times

title: Arab League Offers Reprieve for Syria as Toll Rises
description: RABAT, Morocco  In what amounted to a surprise reprieve, the Arab League offered to send civilian and military monitors to Syria on Wednesday to determine whether it was abiding by a league-brokered peace plan to end the crackdown on the countrys eight-month uprising. The move countered the leagues startling decision five days earlier to suspend Syria.

title: What Its Worth to Be Committee Chairman
description: A gavel and a bigger staff are not all that come with the job as chairman of a House committee. As is widely known, it almost certainly translates into a surge in donations to campaign accounts, as corporations and lobbyists whose business affairs are regulated by the committee attempt to make nice with the new bosses.

title: Imagining Housing for Today
description: Bronx Park East opened last year opposite the New York Botanical Garden. It consists of a five-story brick pavilion with triple-height windows facing the street, and a seven-story wing for 68 small studio apartments. A good neighbor, is how its designer, Jonathan Kirschenfeld, described the buildings look.

title: Can a Marketing Contest Increase Sales for This Online Retailer?
description: More than 10 years ago, Don Chernoff introduced SkyRoll.com with the idea that a Web site could better explain his unique carry-on luggage and provide another sales channel for his products. Those sales, however, have been disappointing.

title: Overnight, Zuccotti Largely Unoccupied and Quiet
description: As a steady drizzle fell early Wednesday morning, only a few dozen protesters remained in Zuccotti Park.

title: Prices of Rare Earth Metals Declining Sharply
description: HONG KONG  After nearly three years of soaring prices for rare earth metals, with the cost of some rising nearly thirtyfold, the market is rapidly coming back down.

title: Clinton Reaffirms Military Ties With the Philippines
description: MANILA  During a high-profile visit to the Philippines on Wednesday, Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton stood on the deck of a American warship in Manila Bay and reaffirmed the strong military relationship between the United States and the Philippines.

title: Breakfast Meeting, Nov. 16
description: The day after the nighttime raid that cleared protesters from Zuccotti Park, the New York Police Department was criticized by local politicians and news organizations for its treatment of reporters and the restrictions it placed on how they do their work. The Associated Press reported that at least half a dozen reporters were arrested in and around the park, home of the Occupy Wall Street movement, including a reporter and photographer from the agency. Michael Oreskes, senior managing editor for The A.P., said: Journalists should not be restricted from access to news events or detained for attempting to do their jobs. We were unhappy that two of our staff members were swept up in the police operation, but we appreciate the N.Y.P.D.s decision to release them.

title: Markets Fall on Report of Risk to U.S. Banks
description: Stocks tumbled on Wednesday as Fitch Ratings said further contagion from Europes debt crisis will pose a risk to American banks and concerns rose that higher oil prices would hamper economic growth.

title: 2 Views of Aerosols and Climate Change
description: Aerosols are small particles or droplets suspended in a gas. While consumers tend to think of them as being dispensed from a pressurized container, some are natural and some are produced by pollution generated by humans. Two recent studies suggest that the latter variety plays an important role in the environment, actually changing weather and climate.

title: Larry, Larry, Larry! N.F.L. Drama in Spanish
description: Sports is drama, and when youre lucky enough to witness a memorable moment, its nice to have a voice to match  to have the accompaniment of aGus Johnsonduring March Madness or an Andres Cantor during the World Cup.

title: To Fix Failing Schools, Target Troubled Students?
description: One kid at a time. Thats how Turnaround for Children, a nonprofit organization based in New York, approaches schools in tough neighborhoods, where principals say they can hardly see their teachers work through the fog of students extreme behavior. The organization is involved with 20 schools in New York City and three in Washington, helping teachers identify and work with individual students in trouble, not just for their sakes, but for the sake of the school. These are students, writes Anna M. Phillips, who could shatter a classrooms composure or a school windowpane in an instant.

title: The Bridge to Nowhere
description: ISTANBUL  I suspect that many Istanbul residents, even those caught in the tailgate eternity of the daily commute to work, dont spend much time worrying about the broad-leafed knapweed. Like the small meadow saffron, it is one of the 2,000 species of flora that thrive in the greater metropolitan area  thats 150 varieties more than exist in all of Britain, a landmass 50 times the size. Famous as the juncture between Asia and Europe, Istanbul is also the meeting point of the climate systems of the Black Sea and the Mediterranean, which means that a diverse plant life complements its rich history.

title: Opinion Report: OWS
description: From the editorial page

title: Citi to Shed 3,000 Jobs; BNP Paribas Plans to Cut About 1,400
description: The ax continues to fall on Wall Street.

title: Its Not Just What You Protest, Its Where
description: Many important issues in New York involve real estate, and a well-worn clich is that its all about three things: location, location and location. Why should it be any different with demonstrations? As we see once again, where you protest can be as important as what you protest.

title: Facing Crisis, Technocrats Take Charge in Italy
description: ROME  As dubious European bond markets looked on, a former member of the European Commission and well-respected economist, Mario Monti, was sworn in as prime minister and finance minister on Wednesday, unveiling a cabinet of technocrats charged with repairing Italys ailing economy to help keep the debt crisis at bay.

title: Morning Take-Out
description: The Wisest Entrepreneurs Know How to Preserve Equity | So you want to be an Internet billionaire. Its not just about having a great idea and building a world-class business at light speed, writes Steven M. Davidoff in his Deal Professor column.

title: 11 States Seek No Child Left Behind Waivers
The Early Line on Early Applications for the Class of 2016
description: The window for applying to many colleges and universities under early admission programs closed late Tuesday night. While it will be some time before a definitive statistical portrait emerges of this early admissions season, The Choice has been dutifully requesting application figures from a range of more than 100 institutions. The chart above, which well be updating regularly as other figures trickle in, represents the equivalent of early returns in an election, with results from two dozen precincts.

title: The Life Report: Ray Olson
description: The following Life Report was submitted in response to my column of Oct. 28, in which I asked readers over 70 to write autobiographical essays evaluating their own lives.

title: Unis Heads to Hollywood
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Wednesday Reading: Cooking Ahead to Ease Thanksgiving Stress
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

title: Childrens Books: Days and Nights at the Museum
description: For every third-grade boy who obsessively reads the labels accompanying the dinosaur skeletons at the natural history museum, there seem to be at least eight other school-age children aimlessly roaming the exhibits, bewildered by the towering piles of bones surrounding them.

title: Gingrich on Defensive Over Freddie Mac Fees
description: 9:01 p.m. | Updated For roughly six years, Newt Gingrich worked closely with high-level officials at the government-sponsored mortgage company Freddie Mac. As a highly paid consultant, he coached them on how to win over the conservatives who consider their company an anathema, spoke to their political action committee and offered general advice as they worked to stave off various threats to Freddie Macs survival, several people familiar with his role there said Tuesday.

title: After Bullet Hits White House, a Manhunt and Arrest
description: WASHINGTON  Law enforcement officials on Wednesday arrested a 21-year-old Idaho man suspected of firing a semiautomatic rifle at the White House on Friday night, and the Secret Service reported finding that at least one bullet had struck the presidential residence.

title: Decline And Fall
description: Ed Harrison has a good essay on how the world euro ends if the ECB doesnt step in on a massive scale. I dont agree with everything  I think hes wrong to attribute the commodity spike of 2010-2011 to monetary policy  but hes basically right about how the thing unravels. I might place greater emphasis on the immediate channel through which falling sovereign bond prices force bank deleveraging, but were picking nits here.

title: The Urns Return
description: At the headquarters of Atria Senior Living, a nationwide operator of retirement and assisted-living homes, it must have seemed like a no-brainer. Sixteen big masonry urns, from 1,000 to 1,500 pounds each, had been standing on the parapets of Atria West 86  the former Franklin Towers Apartment Hotel at 333 West 86th Street  since 1927; through freeze and thaw, countless storms and the incessant stiff winds off the nearby Hudson River. Heaven only knew what held them fast to their precarious ledges, but heaven help anyone in the path of a falling half-ton urn.

title: Caravans Between Covers
description: The lengths that collectors will go to, the money and legwork they will sink into exotic antiques completely unrelated to their daily lives, can make for transporting reading. The years five best books in the genre show how owners have traveled, researched and bought obsessively, and pressed dealers for background information on every acquisition. The collections slowly fill homes and storage spaces, survive wars and natural disasters, and occasionally turn up on public view far from their homelands.

title: The Very Brave BoE
description: The new Bank of England inflation report (pdf) is out, and it offers a defense of the Banks decision to pursue expansion, not contraction, despite 5.2% headline inflation. Its basically a core inflation argument. The Bank says that a lot of recent inflation reflects temporary shocks:

title: Employers Step Up Efforts to Curb Health Care Costs
description: Employers remain concerned about the relentless increase in the cost of providing health coverage for their workers, according to a new survey, and many companies are trying to do more about it.

title: Barney Frank, Master Of Disguise
description: Who knew he could manage to look like this?

title: Common Sense and the New Cooking Science
description: The eagerly anticipated debate was titled Traditionalist Versus Modern Cuisine, about the controversy over the new molecular gastronomy. But for a discussion of what is often called a culinary revolution, it turned out to be a surprising celebration of traditionalism.

title: Drake Pushes Rap Toward the Gothic
description: THE new kid is a bit of an oddball. He struggles to be heard and then to find his footing. He is jostled from every side, knocked off balance. He doesnt give in. He holds his ground until suddenly, despite everyones efforts, hes standing tall. He inches closer and closer to the center, until the center starts moving toward him. Before long hes the new normal; everyone has to fit in around him.

title: Accel Raises $155 Million for India Fund
description: Accel Partners, an early backer of Facebook and Groupon, has raised $155 million for a new India fund that will focus on early stage investments, the venture capital firm announced on Wednesday.

title: Equal Parts Heart and Abrasiveness
description: GUELPH, Ontario

title: The Place | Florida, Part Three
description: COLLECTIVE BARGAINING

title: Leading Off: Krzyzewski Milestone Cant Lift College Sports
description: The college sports myth machine definitely needs a new gear. Because even cranked all the way up to max for Duke Coach Mike Krzyzewskis record-breaking 903rd victory Tuesday night at Madison Square Garden  with all proper hype machinery in place to coat him in heroism  it still wasnt strong enough to overcome the feeling that the mountain Krzyzewski just climbed was a pile of dirt that had been heaped for many years on the top of a sinkhole. And that sinkhole is giving way.

title: What Were Reading
description: The Atlantic Cities: A geographic-economic analysis of where the best restaurants in the world are. The urban theorist Richard Florida links great food to the open and tolerant values that go with a creative, knowledge-based economy.  Julia Moskin

title: Have N.F.L. Questions? Judy Battista Has Answers
description: How many games can the Texans win without Matt Schaub at quarterback? Are the Eagles pretty much done? And what happened to the Bills? Judy Battista, the N.F.L. reporter for The Times, will will again answer selected questions from readers this week. Use the comment field below to ask your questions, and the answers will appear on The Fifth Down on Friday.

title: From the Yellow Pages to Ground Zero
description: In the fall of 2001, Gregg Brown had a simple ad in the Yellow Pages advertising his photography business. We Do Photo Video, it said. 24 Hour Rush Jobs Welcome.

title: Superheroes for the Stockings
description: Superheroes are the cornerstones of graphic novels, and this year that genre had some big events. In January the Human Torch met his demise, but that was just one stitch in the compelling tapestry that the writer Jonathan Hickman has been weaving for Marvels Fantastic Four. In September DC Comics reintroduced its heroes with new No. 1s, a decision that resulted in great sales and produced a handful of stellar series.

title: Where Can I Find Lingonberry Preserves?
description: Q.

title: Pose Retirement Questions to a Financial Planner
description: You can pose your retirement questions to a certified financial planner for free on Wednesday, during two hourlong online sessions run by the National Association of Personal Financial Advisors and Kiplinger.

title: Power Surge: 650 Horsepower for the Shelby GT500
description: Shown on Tuesday, Nov. 15: 2013 Ford Shelby GT500.

title: Thirsty Power Plants Threaten Watersheds, Study Finds
description: The first chapter of a new report on the effect of power plants on freshwater systems has the feel of a documentary film. Imagine a camera panning the dessicated Texas landscape as a voice intones statistics from the brutal 2011 drought  a dried-up Brazos River, 80 days of 100-degree-plus temperatures in some locations, and so on.

title: Orioles Look to Past for Inspiration
description: After 14 consecutive losing seasons, the Orioles have clearly decided that it is time to look to the past to regain the teams glory.

title: Wocka, Wocka, Wocka! Muppet Antics Resume
description: LOS ANGELES

title: Honors for Math and Science Teachers Who Make Students Think
Room Service Watches Your Calories and More
description: Room service used to be the stepchild of hotel dining: the menus were an afterthought, and guests often ordered in as a last resort. But recently, many independent and chain hotels have been rethinking room service to make it more desirable.

title: Crazy Sexy Thanksgiving
description: Kris Carr is a self-described wellness warrior, a cancer survivor best known for her upbeat advice about a healing lifestyle that includes a plant-based diet and spiritual sustenance.

title: In Los Angeles, Driving the Dark Horse in the Green Car of the Year Sweepstakes
description: LOS ANGELES  The 2012 Green Car of the Year Award, bestowed by the automotive Web site Green Car Journal, will be presented Thursday at the Los Angeles auto show. The diverse field of finalists includes two all-electric vehicles, a gasoline-electric hybrid, a diesel-powered model and another that runs on compressed natural gas, or CNG.

title: Daily Report: Holiday Donations by Smartphone
description: Square, the mobile payments company, is one of the most closely watched companies in Silicon Valley. Founded by Jack Dorsey, one of the co-founders of Twitter, it could be a challenge to the credit card companies. Indeed, Stephanie Strom and Claire Cain Miller report Wednesday in The Times that the Salvation Army has begun shifting into digital donations through Square, as fewer and fewer shoppers carry much change or bills.

title: DealBook: A Complicated Maneuver for Control of Yahoo
description: Instead of selling the company outright, Yahoo is reportedly contemplating a large sale of stock to one or more private equity firms using a controversial structure known as a PIPE, or private investment in public equity. But does Yahoos latest turn mean battle-scarred shareholders will lose out on a valuable sale opportunity? Read the entire post on DealBook.

title: Fiery Sweet Potatoes for a Virtual Feast
description: Two years ago, Kim Severson and Julia Moskin faced off over the quintessential Thanksgiving question: Is it all about the turkey, or the sides?

title: Manifesti Destiny
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: A Conversation Many Doctors Wont Have
description: At Home and Hospice Care of Rhode Island, where shes a medical director, Dr. Joan Teno has grown accustomed to patients being admitted with no clear understanding of their condition or prognosis. The oncologist has told them, Its time to take a holiday from chemo, she said. Its a way not to have a conversation he or she finds hard to do.

title: World Cup Qualifiers Spanning the Globe
description: No. 146 in the FIFA rankings will have three months to ponder how close it is to advancing to the next round of World Cup qualifying in Asia.

title: Is Verlander the A.L. Most Valuable Player Too?
description: Major League Baseball award voters did not need to think very hard to tab Detroits Justin Verlander as the American League Cy Young winner; his season was so spectacular that his unanimous selection came with zero drama on Tuesday.

title: Regulator Calls for New Steps After Collapse of MF Global
description: A Republican regulator on Wednesday called for new measures to restore public confidence in the futures industry after $600 million went missing from MF Global, the bankrupt brokerage firm.

title: Entrepreneurs Looking For Capital Investment Seek Kindred Spirits
description: On the last day of the fourth quarter in 2008, BC Krishna was trying to clinch a deal with a large, name-brand company. The transaction would have put his small start-up, Memento, a fraud-detection company, on the map. When the deal fell through, Mr. Krishna worried about how his venture capitalist investors would react  especially because it meant that Memento was going to fall short of its performance targets.

title: McCartney Letter Seeking Drummer for Beatles Sells for $55,000
description: If artistic reputations were judged by memorabilia auction prices alone the letter that sold at Christies in London on Tuesday night would place Paul McCartney  at least in the current economy  decidedly below both his former bandmate John Lennon and John Keats but well ahead of the novelist Harper Lee.

title: Americans Waking Up to Light Bulb Changeover
description: The first step in getting people to change the way they consume energy is making them aware that change is afoot. When it comes to lighting technologies, in particular, it seems that consumer awareness is growing.

title: Jasmine, Tuberose and Power
description: The Little Book of Perfumes: The Hundred Classics. By Luca Turin and Tania Sanchez. 128 pages. Viking. $18.

title: Do Former Entrepreneurs Make Better Venture Capitalists?
description: Most small-business owners never seek venture capital, writes Pamela Ryckman in an article weve just published, but for those who do, it can feel like a deal with the devil. Venture-backed companies are expected to grow quickly, and their boards can impose rigorous controls, audits and metrics. A founder who takes venture capital gets the opportunity to grow but also risks losing control of the company. One way entrepreneurs mitigate the tension in the relationship is to work with venture capitalists who may have more patience during the company-building process  because they have been through it themselves.

title: Sandusky Accuser Would Testify of Severe Sexual Assault, Lawyer Says
description: Ben Andreozzi, a Pennsylvania lawyer representing one of eight boys alleged to be victims in the Penn State sexual child abuse case, called Jerry Sandusky a coward on Wednesday and said that Sanduskys recent comments on television had emboldened his client to pursue sexual assault charges against Sandusky.

title: Practicing on Patients
description: My hospital recently decided to ask nurses, rather than the phlebotomy team, to handle blood draws. This wasnt a big deal, except that Id never done it before, and to learn, I would have to practice on patients.

title: Reform Adds More Twists to a Convoluted Derivatives World
description: When the architects of the Dodd-Frank regulatory overhaul flinched from the most effective solution  breaking up the banks so that none would be too big to drag down the financial system  they forced regulators of the derivatives market into a cumbersome and potentially dangerous workaround.
