title: School Bus Drivers Seek to Reopen Contracts
Robin van Persie Is the Best Striker in Britain. Discuss.
description: I support a one-man team. All you need to know about Arsenal, which has won five Premier League matches in a row, and has dragged itself all the way from 19th after three matches up to seventh, level on points with Chelsea and Liverpool above them, is defined by the winning goal Robin van Persie scored in Saturdays match at Norwich. Aaron Ramsey won the ball in midfield and was tripped, ending up on his stomach. Alex Song, who had an otherwise desultory, wasteful match, hurdled the prone Ramsey and advanced rapidly. He had Gervinho, streaking alone on the left, and van Persie, between two defenders on the right. He twitched, almost passing the ball to Gervinho, the lively Ivoirian who had already missed three sitters in the match, then changed his tune, rotated his body to pick out van Persie, who touched once, ran into space, and on his second touch lifted the ball over John Ruddy with his right foot, his weaker one, and just inside the near post.

title: Sovereign Dress Crisis
description: It was the 10th of May when a letter marked On Her Majestys Service dropped through our letter box. I wasnt home, because, in one of lifes rare strokes of serendipity, I was presiding over the selection committee for Londons Newgen at the British Fashion Council, the panel that X-rays young designers for runway-worthiness. My husband thought he ought to call, anyway. Listen to this, he began, and as soon as I heard the words Dear madam, the prime minister has asked me to inform you . . . Jonathan Andersons paisley-print pantsuit melted before me into a psychedelic fudge, . . . that Her Majesty may be graciously pleased to approve that you be appointed a Member of the British Empire (M.B.E.) in the 2011 Birthday Honors List.

title: Major Archaelogical Find: Graffiti by Johnny Rotten
description: An apartment with graffiti by the Sex Pistols front man Johnny Rotten is an important historical and archaeological site and could be of greater significance than the discovery of early Beatles recordings, according to a paper published in the journal Antiquity, the BBC reports.

title: Market-Inspired Pastas
description: By now youve probably got your Thanksgiving menu organized, and like me, you may be getting a bit tired of the holiday recipes that have been dominating food pages and recipe features like this one for weeks now. So this week Im focusing on what Ive been craving: comforting pasta dishes. They have nothing to do with Thanksgiving, but they have a lot to do with whats available at my farmers market, as well as what was lingering in my refrigerator at the beginning of the week. I decided Id use some new pasta shapes, so I went to an Italian market to see what they had on offer. The fun part was figuring out the best vegetable/pasta shape pairings.

title: Groupons I.P.O. Pop, Now Deflated
description: Well, that was fast.

title: Hague Prosecutor Opens Door to Libya Trial of Qaddafi Son and Aide
description: PARIS  The chief prosecutor of the International Criminal Court said Tuesday that the son of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, the former Libyan leader, along with his co-defendant, Colonel Qaddafis onetime military intelligence chief, may be tried in Libya as long as the international court is involved.

title: Teaching and Learning About Gay History and Issues
description: Updated: June, 2016

title: Europes Banks Relying on Money From E.C.B.
description: FRANKFURT  Banks clamored for emergency funds from the European Central Bank on Tuesday, borrowing the most since early 2009 in a clear sign that the euro regions financial institutions are having trouble obtaining credit at reasonable rates on the open market.

title: Pepper Spray at UC Davis
description: There were a few possible reactions to the police repeatedly pepper spraying a seated row of non-violent student protesters at an Occupy Wall Street-inspired event at UC Davis on Saturday. The university Chancellor, Linda Katehi, apologized to her students for the attack. The university put two officers on leave while investigating their behavior. Protesters were outraged.

title: Florida A&M Suspends Band After Drum Major Death
description: The yet-unexplained death of a drum major after the Florida A&Ms band performance on Saturday has prompted the universitys president, Dr. James H. Ammons, to suspend all band activities Tuesday amid reports that a hazing incident might have led to the death of 26-year-old Robert Champion.

title: ABC Dances to Top Rating
description: The final performance hour of Dancing with the Stars carried ABC to a first-place finish in total viewers on Monday night with more than 20 million people tuning in. Although it was the shows largest audience since the season premiere, when compared to same period last year the overall ratings trend points downward. The first hour of last falls finale drew 23.3 million total viewers and Monday nights episode fell more than 27 percent in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic from last year.

title: Congressional Panel Seeks to Question Corzine
description: A Congressional panel has asked Jon S. Corzine to testify about the downfall of MF Global, and the hundreds of millions of dollars in customer money that went missing in the brokerage firms final days.

title: Perciatelli With Cauliflower, Spicy Tomato Sauce, Capers and Pecorino
description: Perciatelli are hollow long noodles that also go by the name bucatini. Their texture is robust, supporting a robust sauce like this one. Because the noodles are hollow, they cook much more quickly than spaghetti, so keep your eye on them so they dont get too soft.

title: Pappardelle With Beets, Beet Greens and Goat Cheese
description: If you dont mind eating pink pasta and you like beets with goat cheese, youll love this. I roasted my beets, blanched the greens and paired them with wide pappardelle noodles and goat cheese, both excellent partners. Make sure that you dont drain the water from the pasta pot when the noodles are done (lift them out with a pasta insert or with a skimmer), as you need some of the cooking water to thin out the goat cheese.

title: Orecchiette With Grated Squash, Walnuts and Ricotta Salata
description: I dont know why it had never occurred to me to grate hard winter squash until I started envisioning this pasta. If you have a food processor with a grater blade, this will be the easiest way youve ever prepared winter squash, short of sticking it in the oven skin and all. The cooked grated squash lodges in the indentations of the ear-shaped orecchiette, a perfect pairing.

title: Giant Shells Filled With Spinach and Ricotta
description: These are comforting and easy to put together. You can make them ahead and heat them in the oven when youre ready for dinner.

title: New Deal Extends Labor Tranquillity
description: Against a backdrop of labor strife in other professional sports, Major League Baseball and its players union unveiled a new collective bargaining agreement on Tuesday that was completed weeks before the old one expired and will introduce significant changes in drug testing, the playoff format, instant replay and the manner in which amateur players can be signed.

title: Grinnells Lentsch (89 Points) Grabs the Single-Game Scoring Record from Clement (77)
description: Not long after Griffin Lentsch of high-scoring Grinnell College in Iowa scored 89 points on Saturday afternoon, setting a Division III record in his teams 145-97 victory at Principia College, Jeff Clements in-box started filling up, too.

title: Another Debate, Another Top Candidate
description: November 22, 2011  The latest poll shows Newt Gingrich to be tied with Mitt Romney ahead of Tuesday nights debate in Washington between Republican presidential candidates.

title: Sports Replay: Nov.22
description: The day in sports, including action from the ATP World Tour Finals in London and Champions League soccer.

title: Caucus Video: Another Debate, Another Top Candidate
description: The latest poll shows Newt Gingrich to be tied with Mitt Romney ahead of Tuesday nights debate in Washington between Republican presidential candidates.

title: Merck to Pay $950 Million Over Vioxx
description: Merck has agreed to pay $950 million and has pleaded guilty to a criminal charge over the marketing and sales of the painkiller Vioxx, the company and the Justice Department said Tuesday.

title: Big Trucks Returned Big Profits for Detroit
description: In 2008 and 2009, as the American automotive industry foundered, critics often cited Detroits fixation with light trucks and S.U.V.s, which had fallen out of favor as gas prices rose, for the industrys agita. A new study authored by Max Warburton of Bernstein Research, a market trends and analysis firm, suggests that automakers fondness for big iron was, and continues to be, driven by the outsize profit margins generated by the machines.

title: What to Look for in Tonights Debate
description: Whom will Professor Gingrich lecture this time?

title: Shootings by Police Continue to Decline
description: New York City police officers shot and killed fewer people last year than at any other time since the Police Department began keeping track in 1971, according to a department report released Tuesday.

title: Iranian Paper Protests Raid by Judiciary
description: Irans main government-run newspaper was published Tuesday without a front-page headline, replaced by photographs of its headquarters during an assault a day earlier by forces working for the judiciary who briefly arrested the newspapers top official  the media adviser to the president  and more than 30 others.

title: Make Your Own Brazilian Cheese Puffs
description: Each week, Brazilian Specialty Foods in North Bergen, N.J., which I write about this week, makes about 24,000 po de queijo, Brazilian cheese puffs that are chewy on the inside and lightly crisp on the outside. Mixing, shaping and baking pounds of the gooey dough would require too much time and labor for the 15 Brazilian restaurants in New York City that buy the companys bread.

title: BPA Lurks in Canned Soups and Drinks
description: A new study by Harvard researchers may provide another reason to skip the canned pumpkin and cranberry sauce this Thanksgiving. People who ate one serving of canned food daily over the course of five days, the study found, had significantly elevated levels  more than a tenfold increase  of bisphenol-A, or BPA, a substance that lines most food and drink cans.

title: A 300-Duck Day and Cabbages by the Thousands
description: THE food cognoscenti like to know the source of their vegetables, fish and meat. Is that lettuce organic? Did that chicken range freely and merrily during its short life?

title: Noose, Our
description: Update: Oh, geez. Pronounce the headline phonetically. Its PBS, tonight at 6.

title: The Big Drag
description: The CBO has released the latest assessment of the American Recovery and Reconstruction Act, aka Obama stimulus. What it tells us is that the US federal government has been practicing destructive fiscal austerity since the middle of 2010 (and thats not even talking about whats happening at the state and local level). Heres the average of CBOs high and low estimates of the impact of the ARRA on the level (not the rate of growth) of GDP by quarter:

title: Way Back Machine: Long Before Cuomo, Slaying the Gerrymander
description: If Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo keeps his vow to veto a partisan redistricting plan, he will be in good company. Governors Alfred E. Smith and Franklin D. Roosevelt both rejected legislative reapportionment plans that they regarded to be gerrymandering.

title: Defendant Says Khmer Rouges Aim Was to Protect Cambodia From Vietnam
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia  The highest-ranking surviving Khmer Rouge leader, accused in the deaths of 1.7 million people, defended himself on Tuesday by casting his actions as part of a patriotic struggle to keep Vietnam from annexing Cambodia and exterminating ethnic Cambodians.

title: Thanksgiving Thrift: The Holiday as a Model for Sustainable Cooking
description: WE have too few holidays, wrote Sarah Hale in her 1827 novel Northwood; or, Life North and South. She wanted Thanksgiving declared a national holiday, and petitioned four presidents for it before Lincoln finally did the stubborn ladys bidding in 1863.

title: Another Treaty Negotiation, Another Batch of Climate Science E-Mail
description: [Nov. 23, 2:43 p.m. | Update |  Theres now a searchable cache for the newly disclosed East Anglia e-mails. Heres the Revkin search result. | 12:30 p.m. |  Ive posted a fresh piece in which I acknowledge the importance of issues raised by the e-mail exchanges, but return to the broader context that quickly gets lost.]

title: Pictures of the Day: Egypt and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Egypt, South Korea, Kazakhstan and Hawaii.

title: Week 11 Film Review: Rise of the Dolphins
description: Analysis of some of the games from Week 11, with the benefit of film review:

title: The Grunge That Stole Christmas
description: Its a mix of raided grandmas closet and classic punk with a little bit of boudoir on the side, explains Lyndsey Butler, the designer for Veda reclaimed leather, which collaborated with Reformation by Yael Aflalo on a holiday collection. The resulting 10 pieces channel Kate Moss and Johnny Depp circa 1994 and all things grunge  downtown motorcycle jackets paired with silk burgundy pajama pants and camisoles; festive red leather vests with indigo blue slip dresses and denim miniskirts. In other words, a very Courtney Love Christmas.

title: The Golden Age of Republican Deficit Hawks
description: Ive written a few pieces in the last several days about the history of deficit reduction packages, and how Republicans used to be on board for tax increases. I suggested that at the very least, Republicans were more willing to compromise on using tax increases to cut deficits, even if they preferred to balance the budget wholly through the spending side.

title: Charting Balam Acab at Le Poisson Rouge
Rome Gets New Respect at European Union
description: BRUSSELS  They may not have been the exact words Jos Manuel Barroso used during a lunch with the new Italian prime minister, Mario Monti, on Tuesday, but the message was clear: Welcome back to Europes top table.

title: Private Markets Offer Valuable Service but Little Disclosure
description: Information is the lifeblood of capital markets. In the movie Wall Street, Gordon Gekko demanded confidential information from a young would-be Master of the Universe, Bud Fox, played by Charlie Sheen. The value of stocks is based on information, which is why securities laws are intended to ensure that all investors have at least minimum amounts of information.

title: Inventing a World, Just Like Clockwork
description: Hugo, an enchantment from Martin Scorsese, is the 3-D childrens movie that you might expect from the director of Raging Bull and Goodfellas. Its serious, beautiful, wise to the absurdity of life and in the embrace of a piercing longing. No one gets clubbed to death, but shadows loom, and a ferocious Doberman nearly lands in your lap. The movie is based on the book The Invention of Hugo Cabret, but is also very much an expression of the filmmakers movie love. Surely the name of its author, Brian Selznick, caught his eye: Mr. Selznick is related to David O. Selznick, the producer of Gone With the Wind  kismet for a cinematic inventor like Mr. Scorsese.

title: Panels Failure Means Education Cuts in 13
description: On Monday, Congressional leaders failed to agree on a plan to balance the countrys budget. As a result, automatic cuts to federal programs are set to take place beginning in 2013. Student financial aid programs  including Pell Grants  will find their current funding levels in jeopardy unless government officials reach consensus on an alternate approach.

title: Would You, Could You, in the Rain?
description: S. Amanda Caudill, a doctoral student at the University of Rhode Island, writes from Costa Rica, where she is assessing mammal diversity on coffee farms.

title: Pictures of the Day: Egypt and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Egypt, South Korea, Nepal and Kazakhstan.

title: Enduring but Confusing at Barneys
description: POP quiz: whos more stylish, Usher or Cuba Gooding Jr.?

title: Can I Tell My Family They Cant Come to Dinner?
description: Q.

title: Common Sense Prevails in New Baseball Agreement
description: Read through the new collective bargaining agreement between the Major League Baseball players and owners, and you will find one overriding theme: common sense. Lots of little rules that seemed silly or archaic have been eliminated or improved.

title: F.C.C. Seeks Review of AT&T Merger With T-Mobile
description: WASHINGTON  The chairman of the Federal Communications Commission took steps Tuesday to block the proposed $39 billion merger of the mobile phone companies AT&T and T-Mobile USA.

title: Covering a Penn State Game, and Dancing Around the Facts
description: Call it a cocoon. Call it a cone of willful ignorance. But watching the Penn State-Ohio State game on ABC last Saturday should have made a viewer wonder why the announcers Brad Nessler and Todd Blackledge tiptoed so carefully, but not deftly, around the sexual abuse scandal that led to the firing of Nittany Lions Coach Joe Paterno and the university president Graham B. Spanier and the indictments of two Penn State officials.

title: The Allure of the Odd
description: LETS just say it straight out: Isa is one peculiar restaurant. Its warm, its welcoming, the dining room smells great, and, despite the hard chairs and benches, its fairly comfortable. The foods pretty good, too.

title: Reviewing Isa
description: What is it about small plates? When I stopped reviewing restaurants regularly, eight years or so ago, I dont remember so many places that, in addition to the conventional appetizers and main courses, offered all manner of snacks, shellfish and other sorts of pre-appetizer tidbits that one might cynically believe are aimed principally at getting consumers to spend more money.

title: Oregon Governor Says He Will Block Executions
description: Gov. John Kitzhaber of Oregon on Tuesday said he would halt the execution of a death row inmate scheduled for next month and that he would allow no more executions in the state during his time in office.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Personal Finance Tips and a Look Inside Twitter
description: Heres what the technology reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web:

title: On Thanksgiving, Stepping Up to the Plate
Mitt Romneys First TV Ad
description: Mitt Romney released his first television ad on Tuesday. He could have made a pretty powerful ad criticizing President Obamas handling of the economy and pointing out how high the unemployment rate is. Unfortunately, Mr. Romney wasnt satisfied with just the facts.

title: Torre Draws Inquiries From Suitors for Dodgers
description: Is Joe Torre interested in joining a group that would buy the Los Angeles Dodgers?

title: Lens: Turkey
description: Lens: Turkey

title: Freshly Minted
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Turkey Tips: Stuffing
description: To stuff or not to stuff? Melissa Clark demonstrates how to stuff a turkey, and how to add extra flavor to your stuffing if you cook it separately.

title: Federer, Quite Quickly, Defeats Nadal
description: Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal may have never played one another with less on the line.

title: Museum Finds a Home for the Enterprise
description: The Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum now owns a space shuttle, and museum officials say they have figured out where to put it  at least for a while.

title: To Stuff or Not to Stuff?
description: Q.

title: Power Struggles Over Pep and High School Popularity
description: LOS ANGELES  The jubilant young dancers in the new musical Bring It On, at the Ahmanson Theater here, should probably be racking up frequent-flier miles, so often are they airborne in this featherweight show about competing high school cheerleading squads.

title: For Sanchez, Ryan Tries Another Round of Motivation
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Innovative as he is as a defensive coach, Rex Ryan tends to stick with tactics that work in other areas  like motivation. For the second consecutive year, Ryan responded to two poor games for Mark Sanchez by giving the backup, Mark Brunell, a few snaps with the first-team offense this week. Brunell said he ran four plays.

title: How to Become a Big Fish in an Indie-Rock Aquarium
description: Jeffrey Lewis was crouched on the floor of his East Village apartment one recent evening, stuffing his self-made CDs and comic books into a backpack while his brother, Jack, prodded him to hurry. They had a gig to get to, and not a moment to spare.

title: Live Blogging the National Security Debate
description: The eight Republican candidates for president will take the stage in Washington at 8 tonight, but all eyes will be on Newt Gingrich, the former speaker of the House.

title: Lens: LUCEO
description: Lens: LUCEO

title: Chestnuts Roasted, and Sometimes Burned
description: Too often holiday music is about comfort: familiar melodies, familiar sentiments, familiar styles. And for some that may well be enough: never underestimate the power of the reliable. But so much great music comes from artists who understand that the holiday season is just another topic  it can inspire reverence and jubilation, of course, but also self-doubt, skepticism, comedy, fear, resentment and so much more. Here, the pop and jazz critics of The New York Times highlight the best of the traditional, the best of the progressive and some others with room to grow. (Prices may vary from those listed here, depending on where you shop.) JON CARAMANICA

title: 3 American Students Held in Protests, Egyptians Say
description: Three students at the American University in Cairo were arrested and accused of participating in violent protests in the Egyptian capital, the university said Tuesday, after images of the men were broadcast on satellite and cable television channels around the world.

title: Evoking Edelweiss and Stirring Hope in India
description: There are incongruities atop incongruities in The Sound of Mumbai: A Musical, a documentary by Sarah McCarthy that has its debut Wednesday night on HBO2.

title: Plaza Food Hall Is Growing
description: CALL it the food hall that ate the concourse.

title: World Bank Issues Alert on Afghanistan Economy
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Afghanistan will suffer a recession in 2014 and beyond after foreign troops leave and aid dwindles, and if the security situation gets worse, the country could face complete economic collapse, according to an ominous report released in Kabul on Tuesday by the World Bank.

title: Occupy at Berkeley
description: To the Editor:

title: Prepare to Indulge
description: ASK Crazy Legs Conti, a professional eater, what he thinks of your average Thanksgiving feaster, and you can almost hear him choke.

title: Bloggingheads: Avoiding War With Iran
description: Robert Wright, left, of Bloggingheads.tv and Heather Hurlburt of the National Security Network debate about preventing a war with Iran.

title: Nokias Microsoft Phones May Not Get Traction, Analyst Says
description: Microsoft and Nokia have yet to prove whether their marriage will give birth to healthy handset sales. One analyst is not expecting much.

title: Inviting a Turkey to Dinner
description: Thanksgiving already came and went safely for Skip, Payton and Amelinda as well as the dozens of rescue turkeys housed by Farm Sanctuary, an animal welfare organization with shelters in upstate New York and California. In anticipation of the holiday, the shelters hosted their annual Feeding of the Turkeys celebration last weekend, where turkeys eat stuffed squash, cranberries and pumpkin pie as the guests of honor  but are never the main course.

title: Libyan Leader Seeks to Unite Factions With Cabinet
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  Bowing to pressure from a local militia holding one of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis sons as a prisoner, Prime Minister Abdel Rahim el-Keeb on Tuesday appointed the militias commander to be the new defense minister.

title: Post-Mortems on the Supercommittee
description: To the Editor:

title: Ocarina Stairway
description: The founders of Smule play Stairway to Heaven on the Ocarina app.

title: Voting, the Oregon Way
description: To the Editor:

title: Off the Menu
description: Coming Soon

title: Dining Calendar
description: Rink Cuisine

title: My Three Favorite Philip Roth Books, or Rereading Herzog
description: Since the only questions anyone asks me in the three favorite category are about restaurants, Im not going there. I thought I might do my three favorite Philip Roth books, which Im qualified to do only  maybe  because a) I write for The Times and b) Ive read them all.

title: On a Final Tour, a Dancer Translates Poetry and Prose Into Sinew and Snap
description: Since Dwight Rhoden and Desmond Richardson founded Complexions Contemporary Ballet in 1994, the company has had one clear reason for existing: as a showcase for the virtuoso dancing of Mr. Richardson. Because this will be his last year touring with the group, a new justification will soon be required.

title: Alfama
description: 214 East 52nd Street, (212) 759-5552, alfamanyc.com.

title: The Old Order Stifles the Birth of a New Egypt
description: CAIRO  If the demonstrations that culminated in February were an uprising against President Hosni Mubarak, the revolt today is against his legacy.

title: A Foray to Finland, Where Sibelius Isnt the Only Star Composer
description: The turn of the 20th century was a difficult time to be a lesser Finnish composer: Sibelius pretty much sucked the air out of the room. But other composers did exist, even if they have faded to posterity, and they creep into concerts now and then.

title: Baristas Lock Restrooms, but the Revolt Doesnt Last
description: For many workers at Starbucks in New York City, the worst part of their jobs may not be the hordes of demanding tourists. Or the irritation of making ever-more-complex skim Frappuccinos and green tea lattes. Or the unflattering elf hats that some baristas have been asked to wear even before Thanksgiving.

title: Despite a Rough Year, Hedge Funds Maintain Their Mystique
description: Hedge funds, the golden children of finance, are having a very rough year.

title: Agua Fresca
description: 207 East 117th Street (Third Avenue), East Harlem, (212) 996-2500, AguaFrescaRestaurant.com.

title: The Mysterious Mind of a Cop Who Goes Bad
description: A sun-scorched noir, Rampart tells a familiar story with such visual punch and hustling energy that it comes close to feeling like a new kind of movie, though its more just a tough gloss on American crime stories past. Directed by Oren Moverman from a fast, nasty, at times queasily funny screenplay by him and James Ellroy, it stars Woody Harrelson as Dave Brown, one of those dirty cops who ooze out of the smog-kissed Los Angeles sprawl to keep the peace in paradise, usually by breaking heads and gunning for trouble.

title: Americas Cold War Sage and His Discontents
description: This may be the most long-awaited single-volume biography ever. In 1981, the renowned cold war historian John Lewis Gaddis approached the pre-eminent cold war diplomat George F. Kennan about writing his life story. Kennan, who was 78 at the time, turned over mountains of papers, diaries, letters, even dream notebooks, on the condition that the book not be published until after he died. Who knew that hed live to be 101, or that Mr. Gaddis would take more than a half-decade after his subjects death to finish writing?

title: Protesters Give Education Department an F for Failure
Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 1,824 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans recently:

title: Pop and Classical in the Same Voice
description: Gabriel Kahane has been living a double musical life, spending some of his time as a pop singer-songwriter and some as a composer with an ambitious style suited to the classical concert hall. As composer in residence with the Orpheus Chamber Orchestra, he has been living both lives at once, which is probably as it should be.

title: Theres Always Room for Mousse
description: A classic mousse au chocolat is always a delectable crowd-pleaser, elegant in its simplicity yet demanding to prepare. So leave the melting, whisking and chilling to La Maison du Chocolat, which has added a bittersweet chocolate mousse to its line of high-quality chocolates and pastries.

title: Israel and Pinkwashing
description: IN dreams begin responsibilities, wrote Yeats in 1914. These words resonate with lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people who have witnessed dramatic shifts in our relationship to power. After generations of sacrifice and organization, gay people in parts of the world have won protection from discrimination and relationship recognition. But these changes have given rise to a nefarious phenomenon: the co-opting of white gay people by anti-immigrant and anti-Muslim political forces in Western Europe and Israel.

title: A New Mushroom-Cultivating Kit
description: That impulse to grow your own, recycle and even give a worthwhile holiday gift? Satisfy it with mushrooms.

title: Iran: Sanctions Likely to Grow
description: Irans economic isolation over suspicions that it may be working on a nuclear weapon deepened as the European Union agreed in principle to expand its sanctions, adding to measures announced by the United States, Britain and Canada. The added steps would bar Europeans from commercial transactions with 200 Iranian individuals, companies and groups, but would not stop European purchases of oil from Iran. Tehran, which has insisted its nuclear program is peaceful, denounced the new sanctions.

title: Strauss-Kahn Sues in Latest Sex Scandal
description: PARIS  Dominique Strauss-Kahn, the former head of the International Monetary Fund, struck back Tuesday against a political foe and several newspapers and magazines over their coverage of the latest sex scandal to which he has been linked.

title: Federer Routs Nadal
description: Roger Federer obliterated Rafael Nadal, 6-3, 6-0, in only 61 minutes at the ATP World Tour Finals in London. The three games Nadal managed to win were the fewest either has won against the other in their 26 meetings (Federer won four in the 2008 French Open final, a best-of-five-set match). Federer did not face a break point on his serve, and gobbled up Nadals serves, winning a stunning 53 percent of points off Nadals first serve. Federer had 28 winners to Nadals 4. It was the first time in their meetings that neither was ranked No. 1.

title: Mexico: Candidate Drops Out
description: Manlio Fabio Beltrones, the Senate leader for the Institutional Revolutionary Party, has announced that he will not seek the presidency in 2012. Mr. Beltrones said he chose to step down for the sake of party unity during the difficult political battle that is coming. His move leaves Enrique Pea Nieto uncontested for the nomination.

title: Tajikistan: Moscow Tensions Ease
description: A court in Tajikistan on Tuesday released two men  a Russian and an Estonian  whose prosecution had led to a confrontation with Moscow. The men, Vladimir Sadovnichy and Aleksei Rudenko, are pilots who landed at an airport in Tajikistan for emergency refueling in mid-March, although air traffic controllers had denied them permission to land. On Nov. 8, a court sentenced them to eight and a half years in prison. The case infuriated Russian officials, and last week Russias Federal Migration Service began rounding up ethnic Tajik migrant workers in Moscow. On Tuesday, the Russian Foreign Ministry said it was satisfied by the mens release.

title: U.S. Attorney in Manhattan Is Said to Name New Criminal Chief
description: Lorin L. Reisner, deputy director of enforcement for the Securities and Exchange Commission, will become the new chief of the criminal division of the United States attorneys office in Manhattan, according to two people familiar with the decision.

title: Guatemala: War Victims Found
description: The bodies of two Guatemalan men who disappeared in 1984 have been found at a former military base and identified through DNA testing, validating an exhumation process tied to the roughly 40,000 people who disappeared during Guatemalas civil war. The two men, Amancio Samuel Villatoro, a union leader, and Sergio Sal Linares Morales, an engineering professor, were captured by security forces. Experts said the discovery of the two bodies could lead to new investigations.

title: Forstmann Equity Firm to Name New Leader
description: Julian H. Robertson Jr., the hedge fund manager, is expected to be named chairman of Forstmann Little, succeeding Theodore J. Forstmann, the co-founder of the private equity firm and prominent financier who died on Sunday.

title: Braun Most Valuable in the Clutch
description: With the score tied in the bottom of the eighth inning, on a frenzied Friday night at Miller Park in late September, Ryan Braun stepped to the plate and destroyed a pitch to straightaway center field. Braun, the Milwaukee Brewers left fielder, knew it was a home run and pointed his bat to the roof, like the Statue of Liberty holding up her torch, before gliding around the bases.

title: Egypts Doomed Election
description: Chapel Hill, N.C.

title: Public Opinion and Executive Pay
Passing Out Turkeys While Awaiting a Settlement
description: Under a broad tarp, on a sidewalk along Harlems Lenox Avenue, two rows of people found momentary shelter from the rain and cold. On one side were some of the neighborhoods neediest residents, receiving free Thanksgiving turkeys. On the other side, distributing the turkeys, were locked-out N.B.A. players.

title: Brews as Complex as Wine
description: NOT so long ago I visited an American craft brewery whose beers I greatly admired. The brewery is best known for its excellent versions of traditional English styles: pale ale and porter, stout and India pale ale. But did the brewers want to talk about these beers? No way.

title: How the Future Looks From High School
A Giver to the Community Learns to Accept Its Help
description: In the hallways and classrooms of Public School 225 in Brighton Beach, Brooklyn, Carolina Martinez is something of a celebrity. Students can be heard vying for her attention  Ms. Carolina! Ms. Carolina!  and often greet her with hugs.

title: Boeheim Holds His Ground With All His Heart, if Few Facts
description: Surrounded by reporters at a small round table, Jim Boeheim folded his arms and pronounced himself done talking about that situation, the one that he had already weighed in on quite contentiously over the weekend.

title: Voice Recognition Software
description: Still leaves a lot to be desired. Two recent messages:

title: Visions of a Development Rising From the Sea
description: New Yorkers are fond, perhaps overly so, of assembling ever-creative names for newly hot neighborhoods, from NoMad (north of Madison Square Park) to SoBro (the South Bronx) to BoCoCa (Boerum Hill, Cobble Hill and Carroll Gardens).

title: The Tricky Task of Renovating a Building Without Altering Its Landmark Insides
description: Soon after buying 510 Fifth Avenue, a 1954 Gordon Bunshaft design praised as a paradigm of the International Style, Vornado Realty Trust began an interior renovation that it hoped would attract new street-level retail tenants. The work was to include new doorways on Fifth Avenue and to move escalators, among other things.

title: At Rikers, Roasting Turkeys for a New Start
description: For the last few years, Richard Powell, a young man who saw himself as alone in the world, has marked Thanksgiving with a slice of pizza. The day after, he would go back to work at one of his jobs, at Burger King, the American Museum of Natural History or the Frick Collection.

title: New Momentum for Hamas Entering Talks With Fatah
description: Hamass leader, Khalid Meshal, arrives at talks in Cairo this week with Mahmoud Abbas, president of the Palestinian Authority, with a sense of regional winds at his back, as Islamic-inspired movements replace dictators.

title: New Winds in Mideast Favor Hamas
description: GAZA  For years, the imposing black gate that sealed the border between Egypt and Gaza symbolized the pain and isolation that decades of conflict have wrought on this tiny coastal strip, especially under Hamas in recent years.

title: Baseball Strides Forth on H.G.H., but Carefully
description: When testing for human growth hormone begins in Major League Baseball next spring, the sport will be moving cautiously into uncharted territory.

title: Despite Threat of Cuts, Pentagon Officials Made No Contingency Plans
description: WASHINGTON  Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta has painted such an apocalyptic vision of Americas national security under $500 billion in automatic defense budget cuts that Pentagon officials said Tuesday they were pushing back at Congress  and not even planning for the spending reductions, which are to take effect in January 2013. But independent military budget analysts described the cuts, which would bring the Pentagon base budget back to 2007 levels, as agonizing but manageable.

title: Go Big, Mr. Obama
description: President Obama has a clear choice on how to approach the 2012 election: He can spend all his energy defining Mitt Romney, Newt Gingrich or whoever ends up as the Republican nominee in as ugly a way as possible, or he can spend all his energy defining the future in as credible a way as possible. If he spends his energy defining his Republican opponent, there is a chance the president will win with 50.00001 percent of the vote and no mandate to do what needs doing. If he spends his time defining the future in a credible way and offering a hard, tough, realistic pathway to get there, he will not only win, but he will have a mandate to take the country where we need to go.

title: Obama Aide Says Irans Leaders Are Feeling the Strain of Sanctions
description: WASHINGTON  A day after the United States imposed fresh sanctions on Iran over its nuclear program, President Obamas national security adviser argued Tuesday that the administrations pressure campaign had left Irans leaders economically strained, diplomatically isolated and rent by internal divisions.

title: Fate of Euro May Hinge on Italian Savers
description: LONDON  Even though Europes debt crisis has turned Rome into financial ground zero, Italy has been able to lean on at least one solid support: the relatively large amount of government debt held by Italians themselves.

title: Lottery Numbers
20 Students Now Accused in L.I. Case on Cheating
description: MINEOLA, N.Y.  Schools do not write the SAT or administer it. But when school officials at Great Neck North High School suspected that students were cheating on the exam, their investigation led prosecutors down a trail that has resulted in criminal charges against 20 students and calls for widespread test reform.

title: Fight Ends as Actress Gives Up Apartment
description: With little fanfare, the actress Faye Dunaway agreed this week to give up the rent-stabilized apartment on the Upper East Side that her landlord had sued to evict her from.

title: In Terror Case, Legal Aid Society Exits Because Informer Was Client
description: The Muslim convert accused of building pipe bombs for use in a terrorist plot was given a new court-appointed lawyer on Tuesday after it was determined that the Legal Aid Society, which initially represented him, has also served as counsel in a separate case for a confidential informer involved in the terrorism inquiry.

title: City Says Dont Fault It for $3 Cheese at Sardis
description: Attention, bar-hoppers: The cheddar cheese in the communal pot is still gone at Sardis. But New York Citys health department says it is not to blame.

title: New Trove of Stolen E-Mails From Climate Scientists Is Released
description: The anonymous hacker who shook the world of climate science two years ago by posting a trove of stolen e-mails delivered a new batch on Tuesday, stirring up climate-change contrarians a little more than a week before global negotiations on greenhouse gases are to begin in Durban, South Africa.

title: For Some Marketers, Brand Investment Beats Black Friday
description: THE holiday shopping season this year is playing out like a tale of two Christmases, giving marketers a, well, dickens of a time figuring out how best to reach consumers: hype the sale or bolster the brand.

title: How Many Primaries in New York?
description: New York State, which will struggle with a deficit projected to be more than $3 billion in 2012, is facing the ridiculous and costly possibility of holding three primaries next year instead of the usual two in presidential election years.

title: Health Care and the States
description: In reviewing the constitutionality of health care reform, the Supreme Court said it would consider the legality of the Medicaid expansion included in the reform law. The question seems narrow, but it could have significant implications for redefining Congresss spending power.

title: In the Land of the Salamanders, the Newt is King
description: Presidential primary fields of dubious quality often receive derisive nicknames. The seven Democratic candidates of 1988, for instance, in part because some of them were of short stature and in part because none of them seemed like formidable challengers to George H.W. Bush, were often referred to as the Seven Dwarfs.

title: Richmonds Medical Miracle
description: During the opening months of the Civil War, the streets of Richmond, Va., filled with bloodied bodies. The thousands of Confederate wounded were treated in a range of makeshift hospitals hastily established in hotels, factories and private homes. But by autumn, as hopes the conflict would be brief faded, it became clear a war of this magnitude required a modernized medical response.

title: Lessons in Transit Innovation
description: Reader responses to  last weeks column about transit innovation revealed a lot of love for transit: Readers reported their appreciation for light rail in Trenton, N.J.; buses in Austin, Tex.; the pedicabs of the Philippines; the transit planners of Portland, Ore.; dollar vans in Ghana and Guatemala; the SLUGS of Washington D.C. (an informal car pool system); and the Skytrain and songthaews  pickups with benches in the back  of Bangkok.

title: Guitar Heroes
description: Gibsons guitars and their players through the decades

title: For a Reported Penn State Victim, a Search for Trust
description: STATE COLLEGE, Pa.  Two years ago, Thom Hunter, a volunteer coach at Central Mountain High School in Mill Hall, Pa., saw something special in a 15-year-old boy at the school: a remarkable natural running ability.

title: New Mexico Black Groups Claim Bias at University
description: DENVER  A group of African-American pastors in New Mexico, along with the Albuquerque chapter of the N.A.A.C.P., said Tuesday that they have filed a complaint with the Justice Department alleging that black faculty and staff members at the University of New Mexico and its hospital are subject to discrimination.

title: Former Obama Fund-Raiser Gets Over 10 Years in Fraud and Bribery Case
description: CHICAGO  More than three years after his conviction on fraud and bribery charges, Antoin Rezko, a former real estate mogul and a once-powerful fund-raiser with ties to President Obamas early political career, was sentenced on Tuesday to 10 and a half years in prison.

title: Democrats Cry Foul Over New Romney Ad
description: WASHINGTON  Democrats reacted ferociously on Tuesday to Mitt Romneys first campaign commercial, which they said distorted comments by Barack Obama to make it look as if he was running away from his record on the economy.

title: Penn States Inquiry
description: The Pennsylvania State University Board of Trustees announced Monday that Louis Freeh, a former F.B.I. director, had been asked to lead an independent investigation into the sexual abuse scandal surrounding Jerry Sandusky, a former assistant football coach charged with sexually assaulting eight boys over a span of 15 years.

title: At Dalton, a Student Survey Reveals Dual Identities
description: The qualities that students at the Dalton School strive to embody are confidence, friendliness and intelligence. But the ones they associate with their classmates, and with the high-priced education they are receiving, are competitiveness and ambition.

title: A Discussion of Russias Future Is Long on Pessimism
description: KALUGA, Russia

title: Financial Finger-Pointing Turns to Regulators
description: In the whodunit of the financial crisis, Wall Street executives have pointed the blame at all kinds of parties  consumers who lied on their mortgage applications, investors who demanded access to risky mortgage bonds, and policy makers who kept interest rates low and failed to predict a housing market collapse.

title: M.T.A. Halts Blasting for 2nd Ave. Subway Around 72nd St.
description: Transportation officials have temporarily halted blasting on the Second Avenue subway project around 72nd Street, after receiving complaints from Upper East Side residents about smoke and dust, officials said Tuesday.

title: Whos on the Line? Increasingly, Caller ID Is Duped
description: Caller ID has been celebrated as a defense against unwelcome phone pitches. But it is backfiring.

title: Old, Bald and Still Kicking
description: ALLEN PARK, Mich.  The biggest shock for Jason Hanson during his first N.F.L. training camp was not the size or the speed of his new teammates. It was their age.

title: Wednesday: Record Producer Brian
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  Ian I Only Look Innocent Livengood, he of the friendly face and gentle demeanor, is the kind of constructor who always makes me forget that there will usually be some sort of twist in his puzzles. Today is no different, as I had to make my way down to the payoff at 55 Across before I truly understood what was going on.

title: Council Speaker Hears Sharp Debate on Wage Proposal
description: The City Council speaker, Christine C. Quinn, under pressure from both sides, carefully questioned supporters and opponents at a hearing on Tuesday about a proposed law that would raise wages for workers in city-subsidized developments.

title: Spirited Foreign Policy Debate Includes a Test of Gingrichs Rise
description: WASHINGTON  The Republican presidential candidates highlighted their partys lack of a single national security vision a decade after the Sept. 11 attacks, differing on Tuesday night over the pace of withdrawal from Afghanistan, aid to Pakistan and, in an exchange that could resonate dangerously for Newt Gingrich, what to do with illegal immigrants in the United States.

title: UConn, Seeking a Lift, Goes to Its New No. 23
description: HARTFORD  It would become, in the words of Stanford Coach Tara VanDerveer, a heavyweight basketball fight. But in the first five minutes hardly anyone had scored a point, much less landed a threatening punch.

title: Republican Might Quit Labor Board
description: The National Labor Relations Board, the subject of particularly intense partisan sniping this year, could soon be completely paralyzed.

title: Hezbollah Holds Lebanese C.I.A. Informants, Officials Say
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Hezbollah, the Lebanese Shiite militant group, has identified and captured several people it accuses of being informants and spies for the Central Intelligence Agency, according to a Lebanese security official and news agency reports quoting Hezbollah officials and current and former American officials.

title: Former Stars Cheer New Rules on Hits to the Head
description: Two former N.H.L. scoring stars whose careers were curtailed by multiple concussions said Tuesday that the leagues campaign to curtail hits to the head with suspensions and stiff fines will only benefit Sidney Crosby.

title: College Live Blog Bar-Hopping
description: This weeks schedule features many of the top rivalries in the country: Ohio State-Michigan, Alabama-Auburn, Georgia-Georgia Tech and Ole Miss-Mississippi State, to name a few. Teams will be playing for assorted bells, cups, trophies, jugs and an old oaken bucket. And while the fans in the stands figure to be more rabid than usual when their teams rival comes to town, were expecting college watch parties across the land to kick it up a notch as well.

title: Billboard Called Anti-Semitic Is Quickly Pulled
description: A billboard promoting a budget brand of vodka was taken down Tuesday amid a firestorm of criticism that its advertising slogan was anti-Semitic.

title: Eli Hurvitz, Founder of Pharmaceutical Giant Teva, Dies at 79
description: JERUSALEM  Eli Hurvitz, who began his career washing lab equipment at a drug company and went on to build Teva Pharmaceutical Industries into the largest generic drug maker in the world, died on Monday night. He was 79.

title: One of My Guests Does Not Drink. What Can I Substitute for Alcohol in Recipes?
description: Q.

title: George Gallup Jr., of Polling Family, Dies at 81
description: George Gallup Jr., who led the firm that his father made all but synonymous with polling and expanded it to become a barometer of Americans views on religion as well as their political attitudes, died on Monday in Princeton, N.J. He was 81 and lived in Princeton.

title: Automatic Military Cuts May Stand in Congress
description: WASHINGTONMere seconds after the leaders of a joint Congressional committee announced their failure to reach a deficit deal, the chairman of the House Armed Services Committee announced he would try to undo the consequences.

title: A Corner of American Outreach Has Few Visitors, and Plenty of Dust
description: BAGHDAD  In a nook of the library at Baghdad University, sturdy histories of the American Revolution and the Vietnam War line up next to Alexis de Tocqueville and John Updike. Paperbacks from Tom Clancy and Michael Connelly, even Judy Blume, dangle guilty pleasures. And, as if to close the loop on Americana, baseball makes a token appearance with a copy of Farm Team, a novel about a boy who builds a ball field in a cow pasture.

title: Corrections: November 23
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Dot Shot: Hong Kong Haul of Smuggled Rhino Horn and Ivory
description: From the Green blog, a photograph of an estimated $2 million in rhinoceros horn and ivory goods seized by customs inspectors in Hong Kong:

title: Pepper Sprays Fallout, From Crowd Control to Mocking Images
description: Some women carry it in their purses in a pink, lipstick-shaped container. Hikers use it to deter bears. People in most states can buy a small canister of it on a quick-release key ring on Amazon.com for $7.07.

title: Danielle Mitterrand, Former First Lady of France, Is Dead at 87
description: Danielle Mitterrand, the widow of former President Franois Mitterrand of France, who pushed beyond stereotypical notions of a first lady to champion leftist causes, once kissing Fidel Castro on the steps of the lyse Palace, died on Tuesday in Paris. She was 87.

title: Occupy Los Angeles Camp Is Allowed to Stay, for Now
description: LOS ANGELES  While Occupy protesters in other cities have been rousted from their tents in early-morning police raids or doused with pepper spray, the tent encampment encircling City Hall in Los Angeles has so far been allowed to stay.

title: Can You Safely Defrost a Turkey at Room Temperature?
description: Q.

title: Commercial Colleges Broke Rules in U.S. Inquiry
description: Most of the commercial colleges tested by undercover investigators posing as students allowed them to enroll with fake high school graduation credentials, according to a report released Tuesday by the Government Accountability Office, an auditing arm of Congress.

title: NYT Front Page for 11/23/2011
description: NYT Front Page for 11/23/2011

title: German Debt Auction Weighs on Markets
description: Stocks in the United States and Europe declined and the dollar rose sharply on Wednesday after a German bond auction disappointed investors and new data pointed to continued uncertainty in the global economy.

title: Discussing Israel, Detainees Rights, Terrorism and a Different Birth Certificate
description: During Tuesday nights debate, Mitt Romney implied that the Obama administration has not shown that it cares about Israel.

title: Turkey Tips: Trussing
description: Melissa Clark demonstrates an easy way to truss a turkey.

title: Arizona: Details Emerge in Abuse Case
description: The older sister of a missing 5-year-old girl from Glendale told the police that her mother kept the girl, Jhessye Shockley, locked in a bedroom closet and that she had cuts and bruises on her face and body. According to a court document filed Tuesday in connection with the arrest of Jerice Hunter, the missing girls mother, on child abuse charges, the older sister, who is 13, also told investigators that Jhessye had looked like a zombie, had not been seen in the apartment well before she was reported missing on Oct. 11 and that the closet smelled, prompting the mother to clean it. The police said Monday that they suspected that Jhessye was dead and that Ms. Hunter, who has denied any involvement in her daughters disappearance, had played a role in it.

title: Montana: Grizzlies Remain Protected
description: The government cannot go ahead with its plan to remove grizzly bears in the Greater Yellowstone region from the Endangered Species Act, an appellate court said Tuesday. The United States Fish and Wildlife Service has argued since 2007 that grizzly bears and their habitat in the greater Yellowstone ecosystem have recovered enough that bears could be placed under state management, which is generally less restrictive. But the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals found for conservationists who argued that the government had not adequately considered the impact of the decline of Whitebark Pines, a major food source for the bears.

title: Turkey Tips: Roasting
description: Melissa Clark offers tips for roasting the bird. Correction: This video gives an incorrect roasting time for the turkey. It should be 12 to 15 minutes per pound, not 20 minutes per pound.

title: Turkey Tips: Taking It Out of the Oven
description: Melissa Clark checks the temperature of her turkey and pulls it out of the oven.

title: Staying Trim When Fat Runs in the Family
description: Just in time for Thanksgiving, a major new study offers some hopeful news about fat and fate, as well as about the consequences of the choices we make.

title: Word of the Day | giddy
description: giddy \gi-de\ adjective

title: Economic Dislocation
description: Just over a week ago, Glenn Hubbard, the dean of Columbia Universitys business school and an economic adviser to Mitt Romneys presidential campaign, gave a pair of interviews on economic policy  one to a liberal writer, Ezra Klein of the Washington Post; the other to a conservative, Jim Pethokoukis of the American Enterprise Institute.

title: Poll Finds Religion Is Early Drag on Romney
description: Mitt Romneys Mormon faith will most likely cost him support in the primaries, but even Republicans with reservations about his religion would rally to his side in a general election against President Obama, according to a poll released Wednesday.

title: Republicans Debate National Security
description: The candidates differed over the pace of withdrawal from Afghanistan, aid to Pakistan and what to do with illegal immigrants in the United States.

title: Gingrich, Immigration and What Would Reagan Do?
description: Newt Gingrich was having what seemed to be a pretty strong debate on Tuesday night before being asked a question about immigration policy. He suggested that illegal immigrants should be evaluated on a case-by-case basis and that some who have been in the United States for a long time should be allowed to stay, while others should be deported.

title: Champions League Wednesday Preview: Apoel on Brink of Advancing
description: When it comes to minnows, Apoel of Cyprus is about as far down the food chain as possible in European soccer. The Nicosia-based club is unbeaten in Group G and needs only a draw at Zenit St. Petersburg on Wednesday to advance to the knockout stage, which begins early next year. In Group H, Barcelona and A.C. Milan will battle for the top spot at Stadio Giuseppe Meazza in Italy. In Group F, Arsenal faces a tricky match against visiting Borussia Dortmund, which knocked off Bayern Munich last weekend in the German Bundesliga. And in Group E, Chelsea is unbeaten in the group stage but is coming off a difficult Premier League loss to Liverpool last weekend ahead of its game at Bayer Leverkusen.

title: The Caucus | Debate Wrap-Up
description: Nov. 22, 2011 - Michael D. Shear on some of the highlights from the Republican foreign policy debate, including an exchange on immigration that might hinder the rising candidacy of Newt Gingrich.

title: Newswallah: In the English-Language Press Wednesday
description: Seven passengers died and another 12 were injured after two train cars belonging to the Howrah-Dehradun Express caught fire in the early hours of Tuesday when it was passing through the Giridih district in the state of Jharkhand. Two 5-year old girls and an Australian national were among the dead, The Indian Express reports. Authorities are still investigating the cause of the fire.Already facing stiff criticism from the opposition, Congress party leader and federal Finance Minister Pranab Mukherjee on Tuesday turned to Left party leaders to prevent the looming standoff in Parliament over rising prices. Left leaders had issued a notice for an adjournment motion on high prices in the Parliament yesterday, which had stalled parliamentary proceedings. During the meeting, Mr. Mukherjee is believed to have warned the leaders about the consequences for the government in the event of a vote following the adjournment motion, The Hindu reports. A discussion on prices is likely to be held on Wednesday, the federal parliamentary affairs minister said yesterday.

title: Thune Endorses Romney
description: UPDATED 12:02 DES MOINES  Senator John Thune of South Dakota endorsed Mitt Romneys bid for the Republican presidential nomination on Wednesday, making him the second conservative United States senator to declare support for Mr. Romneys candidacy this week.

title: News Quiz | Nov. 23, 2011
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper.

title: Nov. 23, 1943 | United States Captures Tarawa and Makin Atolls From Japan
description: On Nov. 23, 1943, as World War II raged, United States forces seized control of the Tarawa atoll from the Japanese; a day later it secured the nearby atoll of Makin.

title: Chaos Builds in the Streets of Cairo as a Truce Fails
description: CAIRO  The outskirts of Tahrir Square, the iconic landmark of Egypts revolution, plunged into chaos on Wednesday, after attempts by the Egyptian military, religious clerics and doctors failed to stanch a fifth day of fighting that has posed the greatest crisis to the country since the fall of President Hosni Mubarak in February.

title: Failure on Deficit Reduction Plan
description: WHO are the leaders of a Congressional committee charged with cutting the deficit?

title: The Murdochs Hug It Out
description: The writer of Tropic Thunder imagines a succession squabble, Rupert-style.

title: The Dwindling Power of a College Degree
description: The 2012 presidential election can be seen as offering a choice between two visions of how to return us to this countrys golden age  from roughly 1945 to around 1973  when working life was most secure for many Americans, particularly white, middle-class men. President Obama said his jobs plan was for people who believed if you worked hard and played by the rules, you would be rewarded. Mitt Romney explained his goal was to restore hope for folks who grew up believing that if they played by the rules . . . they would have the chance to build a good life. But these days, many workers have lost a near guarantee on a decent wage and benefits  and their careers are likely to have much more volatility (great years; bad years; confusing, mediocre years) than their parents ever did. So when did the rules change?

title: The Machine That Makes You Musical
description: In a dimly lighted conference room in the Palo Alto, Calif., offices of Smule, a maker of music apps, Ge Wang was sitting in a meeting with his colleagues, humming, singing and making odd whooshing noises into the microphone of an iPad, checking the screen, and then pounding fugues of code into an attached laptop. Poking at his devices, he reminded me of a child obliviously amusing himself while the grown-ups natter on around him. Nobody else in the meeting seemed to notice Wangs behavior as they listened to a debriefing about recent updates to Smules Mini Magic Piano app.

title: A Whirling Document of Turkish Culture
description: Before the Bursa Photo Fest in October,  Lens called the event a bold attempt to make Turkey a center for international photography. Last week, a project spearheaded by IstanbulsZaman Daily Newspaperturned the country into the focus for international photographers.

title: Overlooked and Unheard, Ahead of the Mumbai Attacks
description: The United States government had several chances to nab David Coleman Headley, the American who helped plan the Mumbai attacks, Indian officials did not react to several alerts and a French investigative judges long-running warnings about Lashkar-e-Taiba were ignored, according to new reports.

title: Test Yourself | Math, Nov. 23, 2011
description: Test your math skills with this question created by Pete Diamantis at Math for America from the article Kickers Are Becoming Cant-Miss Performers.

title: Pakistan Quickly Names New Envoy to U.S.
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Pakistan quickly appointed a new ambassador to the United States on Wednesday, a day after the previous envoy was forced out over allegations that he sought American help in reining in the countrys powerful military, which now appears to be solidifying its role in managing Pakistans foreign affairs and national security policy.

title: What Are You Grateful For?
description: Psychologists say that being conscious of who and what you are grateful for has real benefits, from sleeping better to being kinder and less aggressive. What are you grateful for? If your gratitude involves people in your life, have you shared your thanks with them?

title: Yemens Leader Agrees to End 3-Decade Rule
description: SANA, Yemen  After more than three decades of autocratic rule, President Ali Abdullah Saleh signed an agreement on Wednesday that immediately transferred power to his vice president, bowing to unrelenting street protests and raising hopes for an end to a political crisis that brought this impoverished nation to the brink of collapse.

title: Stone Links
description: A gathering of recent philosophy-related links.

title: The Early Word: Consequences
description: Todays Times

title: In Philadelphia, Zaha Hadids Z-Car I Gets an Encore
description: PHILADELPHIA  Zaha Hadid, the Pritzker Prize-winning, Iraqi-born British architect and designer, is the subject of a retrospective at the Philadelphia Museum of Art, Zaha Hadid: Form in Motion, on view through March 25. The surprise star of the show may be the Z-Car I automobile, a nonfunctioning three-wheeler commissioned by a gallery owner, Kenny Schachter.

title: Millions Caught by the Social Safety Net
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago.

description: An unofficial Design Week in Hong Kong  three events that all revolve around various aspects of design  offers a welcome creative respite from the typically high-strung lifestyle in this city.

description: BEIRUT  What a joke, I heard someone snort at a nearby table. As if Lebanon were truly independent

title: PCCW Spinoff to Raise $1.2 Billion in Hong Kong I.P.O.
description: The Asian telecommunications company PCCW said on Wednesday that it planned to raise $1.2 billion in an initial public offering of the HKT Trust, the companys telecom spinoff.

title: Young Adults Coverage May Cost Parents Even More
description: A popular part of the federal health care legislation that allows young people to stay on their parents insurance coverage until they are 26 is prompting some creative pricing by employers who are turning to new strategies to charge their workers extra for children on their benefit plans.

title: So You Want to Start a Business
description: People start businesses for all kinds of reasons. Some expect to get rich, some want to be their own boss, some want to follow their passion and some want to control their own destiny (or at least try). Many have one thing in common; they fail. More than half, depending on whose number you use and how much time you give it.

title: Time for a Pop Pop Quiz!
description: One of the new features weve added to the rotation in our Bonus Feature section (formerly known as the Tiny New Culture Section With No Name) is the Cultural Osmosis Pop Quiz. The questionnaires are usually conducted expertly by Gaby Dunn, who is also involved in her own very excellent interview project called 100 Interviews.

title: Naked Truth: New Sitcoms Are Reruns
description: THE other night while I was watching television, Zooey Deschanel said penis, and I didnt laugh. I didnt even chuckle.

description: HONG KONG  Asias ability to stay resilient amid the Wests economic troubles is slowly waning.

description: Did Newt Gingrich have a heartless moment on Tuesday night?

title: New Delhis Air, Still Worse Than Beijings
description: Levels of some air pollutants remained significantly higher in New Delhi than in Beijing on Wednesday afternoon, according to real-time monitors run by the Indian and United States governments.

title: Morning Take-Out
description: Despite a Rough Year, Hedge Funds Maintain Their Mystique | Hedge funds, the golden children of finance, are not making money the way they used to. Returns for a number of funds, including those of star managers like John A. Paulson, have fallen by as much as half this year.

title: Toy Guns Upset Bronx Parents
description: For more local news, including the lockdown on Starbucks restrooms, a switch in legal representation for the man accused of building pipe bombs in a terrorist plot, an update to the Long Island SAT cheating case, and the debate over city wage increases, see the N.Y./Region section.
