title: Cool, Clear Water
description: Q. Is it really necessary to prevent patients from drinking water for many hours before surgery?

title: Widening Hunt for Details of MF Globals Collapse
description: Jon S. Corzine, MF Globals former chief executive, is expected to testify in Congress next month about the firms collapse, having received requests to appear before the Senate Agriculture Committee on Dec. 13 and a House Financial Services subcommittee two days later. Questions continue to swirl around missing customer money totaling $1 billion or more that might have been used to shore up the firms own trading position, and there are multiple investigations of its operations.

title: Patterns: Less Salt Isnt Always Better for the Heart
description: For years, experts have believed that lowering sodium consumption reduces the risk of heart disease. Now a large new study suggests that it may not be so simple.

title: TimesCast | Millions Vote in Congo
description: In Congo, millions vote for presidential and parliamentary elections, despite fears of fraud and violence.

title: Doubling Down, Debating Regulation and Other Thoughts From Readers
description: Highlights of recent comments and questions from some very smart small-business readers:

title: Memories of VSPs Past
description: For a longer-term project, Ive been doing a bit of research into what Very Serious People believed and preached just before it all went blooey. And  drumroll  heres Alan Greenspan:

title: Pictures of the Day: Egypt and Elsewhere
description: Pictures of the Day: Egypt and Elsewhere

title: In the Context of No Context
description: During my recent blogging hiatus, Will Wilkinson penned a withering post criticizing a recent convert to Christianity who had suggested that atheism cant supply meaning in human life. Arguing that questions of meaning are logically independent of questions about metaphysics, he wrote:

title: Hope Glimmers in Long Lines at Polls in Cairo
description: CAIRO  Tethering Cairos toiling and privileged, its Islamists and less pious, its worldly and street-smart, July 26th Street was named for the era of a long-ago revolution. Another one played out Monday along this rollicking thoroughfare, where Egypts divides were bridged, for a moment, by the simplest of ideas: a chance at self-determination.

title: Beauty Product Picks for 2011
description: Among the years many samples, several beauty products rise above the rest.

title: Ask Peg Tyre: The Tricky Matter of Turnover
For Gifts, a Crop of the Creams
description: AS the Beauty Spots columnist, I receive an overwhelming number of samples. Although many items end up in shopping bags under my desk or donated to charity, I make an earnest attempt to try as many eye creams, lip glosses and nail polishes as possible. Life is tough, I know.

title: Are Fairy Tales Really for Children?
description: Would you buy your children a beautiful new volume of classic fairy tales this season? And having bought it, would you read it to them?

title: As Kicker Goes, So Go the Chargers
description: Nick Novak had to relieve himself. So Novak, the San Diego Chargers kicker, took a knee in Sundays game against the Denver Broncos and did his business  with TV viewers watching from behind.

title: A Bacterial Platoon With Fungi Engineers
description: Bacteria and fungi  microbiologys classic enemies  constantly fight over the rhizosphere, the enriched underground environment created by nutrients leaching from the roots of plants into the surrounding soil.

title: Hard Reality of Nostalgia, Laid Bare
description: Baby Jane Dexters message is loud and clear: This is how it is. And for all the pain and misery involved, its not unbearable. In her new cabaret show, Still Bad, Still Blue, at the Metropolitan Room, Ms. Dexter, a gentle mama lion, accompanied on piano by her longtime musical director, Ross Patterson, resurrects, with additions and subtractions, her successful 1996 act, Big, Bad and Blue.

title: The AT&T and T-Mobile Pullback: The Web Reacts
description: Over Thanksgiving, AT&T and T-Mobile USA said they would withdraw their application with the Federal Communications Commission to join their cellphone operations. How did tech-watchers react? Well, the companies may be saying they still plan to deal with the Justice Department and pursue a merger, but many observers are saying that a deal is unlikely.

title: Israeli Leader Visits Jordan to Discuss Palestinian Issue
description: JERUSALEM  King Abdullah II of Jordan played host on Monday to Shimon Peres, the president of Israel, in an effort to make progress on the stubborn Palestinian question at a time of regional diplomatic uncertainty and fragmentation.

title: Steamed Cod or Sea Bass Salad With Red Peppers, Cilantro and Mint
description: This refreshing combination has Middle Eastern overtones, though in the Middle East the fish would probably be fried or poached. Serve it as a first course or as a light main dish. Pacific sea bass or Pacific cod are the most environmentally friendly types of fish to use here.

title: Albacore Steaks With Simmered Fennel
description: Sea bass is the fish I always associate with fennel, as the combination is a classic in Provence. But cross the border into Italy and youll find tuna cooked with this anise-flavored vegetable.

title: Kansas Governor Apologizes to Tweeting Teenager
description: Gov. Sam Brownback of Kansas issued a public apology today to a high school student who was disciplined for posting a disparaging Twitter message about him while she was attending a youth program at the state Capitol.

title: The Giving Spree | Sally Singer
description: Who: T Magazines editor in chief, Sally Singer.

title: A Few Stops on the Way to the Gotham Awards
description: The statuette season begins in earnest tonight, at the Gotham Awards, which honors independent cinema in its own kooky way: Its where all these weird New Yorkers are just handing out these weird awards, and crack semi-lame jokes and have fun, as our pal James Schamus, head of Focus Features, put it last year.

title: Pictures of the Day: Egypt and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Egypt, Syria, Congo and Cambodia.

title: Tony Kushner Wins $100,000 Award for Creative Citizenship
description: The playwright Tony Kushner has been named the recipient of a $100,000 award honoring artists and others for socially responsible work and challenges to authority, like Mr. Kushners fight with City University of New York trustees last spring over an honorary degree that they temporarily withheld from him.

title: Woman Claims an Affair With Herman Cain
description: An Atlanta businesswoman came forward in an interview broadcast Monday to say she had a 13-year affair with Herman Cain, the latest in a string of women to make allegations of improper conduct by the presidential candidate.

title: Leading One of New Yorks Smallest High Schools
description: What is it like to run one of the citys smallest public high schools? SchoolBook profiles Julie Conason, principal of Humanities Preparatory Academy in Chelsea, home to 192 students, a high graduation rate and an unusual discipline policy that entails sending misbehaving students before a fairness committee that metes out alternatives to suspension, like writing letters of apology or community service. Read more on SchoolBook

title: Saluting a Serial Seducer and His Steamy Tell-All
description: PARIS  Giacomo Girolamo Casanova was a gambler, swindler, diplomat, lawyer, soldier, alchemist, violinist, traveler, pleasure seeker and serial seducer.

title: The Life Report: B. Clewly Johnson
description: The following Life Report was submitted in response to my column of Oct. 28, in which I asked readers over 70 to write autobiographical essays evaluating their own lives.

title: Different Strokes With a Baby on Board
description: When bottlenose dolphins swim  at a cruising speed around six miles an hour or a sprinting speed about twice that fast  they are constantly fighting against the waters drag, which only gets worse as they swim harder.

title: On Subway Walls, the Saga of Phillip and Erin
description: For the right subject matter, even harried commuters will take the time to peruse a strangers old photos. Or something that purports to be them.

title: Thanksgiving Week Broadway Box Office Stuffed with Good News
description: Broadway box offices enjoyed a hearty Thanksgiving last week, with 34 musicals and plays grossing a total of $28.1 million, an increase of 6 percent from the comparable holiday week last November when 39 shows were running. Earning more money from fewer shows is in part the result of a so-called dynamic pricing strategy among Broadway theater owners and producers to sell more premium price tickets for high-demand performances, including during holiday season.

title: Skills in Advanced Angling, From Another Age
description: Hidden in the coral terraces that line the eastern shores of East Timor are troves of artifacts and skeletal remains that tell a story of coastal activity going back tens of thousands of years  to the time when humans first settled nearby Australia.

title: Exploring New Frontiers in Salad
description: IT all started with a raw kale salad I sampled at a restaurant several years ago, showered in bread crumbs and anchovy-garlic dressing. A salad of raw Brussels sprouts with pecorino and walnuts came next, followed by a raw beet slaw with orange.

title: The Certainty of Memory Has Its Day in Court
description: Witness testimony has been the gold standard of the criminal justice system, revered in courtrooms and crime dramas as the evidence that clinches a case.

title: The Life Report: Neil Richard Parnes
description: The following Life Report was submitted in response to my column of Oct. 28, in which I asked readers over 70 to write autobiographical essays evaluating their own lives.

title: Last Notes From a Man of Letters
description: In accepting the National Book Critics Circle Award in Criticism for his 1983 collection, Hugging the Shore, John Updike modestly described himself as a freelance writer who writes on occasion about books, bringing to the task a rusty liberal-arts education, an average citizens spotty knowledge of contemporary issues and a fiction writers childish willingness to immerse himself in make-believe. His decision to begin writing book reviews, he said, was probably prompted by a dim sense that the humanities and arts need repeated injections of amateurism.

title: Police Release Quarterly Report on School Arrests
Why I Signed: Principals' Objections to the New Evaluation System

description: Here is Part 2 of the Baggers new and possibly continuing series of films that may not get enough awards attention this season. (Suggestions welcome, commenters!)

title: Italian Bond Dispute Illustrates Obstacles to  Triggering C.D.S.
description: The publisher of the Italian yellow pages directories, Seat Pagine Gialle, has missed a payment on its bonds and announced a tentative agreement to cancel the bonds and issue shares in the company instead. But that agreement may collapse because of a disagreement over how much stock will be issued.

title: Will the Lights Stay On in Texas and New England?
description: Texas and New England may soon run short of the generating capacity they need to reliably meet peak loads, largely because old plants will be retired rather than retrofitted to meet new pollution rules, the North American Electric Reliability Corporation reported on Monday.

title: A Venerable Birding Club, at an Epicenter of All Things Feathered
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  The Nuttall Ornithological Club, the nations oldest birding group, was having a meeting, and Ron Lockwood, its president, was calling things to order.

title: Behind Rakoffs Rejection of Citigroup Settlement
description: As President Ronald Reagan famously said, There you go again. Judge Jed S. Rakoff of Federal District Court in Manhattan followed through on Monday with his threats by rejecting another settlement by the Securities and Exchange Commission. This time, he turned down the S.E.C.s accord with Citigroup over the banks sale of mortgage-backed securities that cost investors almost $700 million in losses while the bank garnered profit of about $160 million.

title: Unfurling Hallelujahs at Full Throttle
description: The Christmas shopping season began as soon as the Thanksgiving dishes were cleared away, so it seems fitting that the parade of Messiah performances that fill New York concert halls and churches during the holiday season began early too. And even in a city where that vividly pictorial Handel classic is interpreted in a rich variety of styles, this years first major entry was a daring challenge to the current orthodoxy, which places the highest value on readings by period-instrument ensembles and chamber choirs.

title: Design Space Becomes Installation Setting for Merce Cunningham Dancers
description: The design firm Harrison Atelier is making a habit of dabbling in dance. Last year it was credited as a co-creator of Anchises, a sophisticated work about aging choreographed by the former Merce Cunningham dancer Jonah Bokaer. Now the firm has brought in the current Cunningham dancer Silas Riener to choreograph Pharmacophore: Architectural Placebo, an installation at Storefront for Art and Architecture in Little Italy.

title: A Guide to Balanchine, Ardent Yet Unflinching
description: Three years ago the dance critic Nancy Goldner brought out her Balanchine Variations, a paperback guide to 20 ballets by the choreographer George Balanchine (22 if you count the three parts of Jewels as individual ballets). Pocket-friendly, modest, undictatorial, with a bright but quiet voice, it touches on multiple aspects of ballet (music, drama, ballet classicism, spatial architecture and more), engaging readers in a manner so unassuming that they are effortlessly involved in critical thought by way of friendly conversation.

title: How Do Eminent Physicists Tackle the Higgs Boson? With Chocolate
description: In 2005, at a festive midsummer nights banquet at Uppsala Castle in Sweden, I chose a seat across the table from two of the worlds leading experts on particle physics: the theorist Frank Wilczek, the previous years winner of the Nobel Prize in Physics, and Janet Conrad, a leading experimentalist.

description: 8:28 p.m. | Updated

title: Democrats Take Aim at Romney in New Ad
description: The Democratic National Committee on Monday escalated its effort to define Mitt Romney, seeking the Republican nomination for president in 2012, as a flip-flopper with a new ad in five battleground states. Called Trapped, it is styled as a parody of a sci-fi movie trailer for the story of two men trapped in one body.

description: Images from the exhibition Casanova  The Passion for Freedom.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 1,827 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the death of the following American on Monday:

title: Metro-North Reopens Port Jervis Line
description: Three months after Tropical Storm Irene dismantled 14 miles of the Port Jervis train line, turning parts of the tracks traversing Orange and Rockland Counties into mangled piles of debris, Metro-North Railroad officials restored service on Monday, one month ahead of schedule.

title: Searching for Virtue, After a Weighty Feast
description: AFTER so many days of feasting, it was time for something light, fat-free and, dare I say, cleansing. But something flavorful, too, it goes without saying. A good day for fish, I thought, planning a meal in my head.

title: 3 Asset Managers Win $254 Million Powerball Lottery
description: 8:46 p.m. | Updated

title: Living in a 76-Story Work of Art, and a Symbol of Rebirth
description: Frederico Farina, a creative director for fashion brands, recalls waking up every morning last summer in his 21st-floor apartment in Brooklyn Heights and gazing across the river at the new Frank Gehry-designed apartment tower in Lower Manhattan. Its rippled stainless-steel facade reflected the sun, making it shine like a beacon.

title: Its Called Airplane Mode for a Reason
China: Ads Banned in Middle of TV Dramas
description: Officials announced Monday that the government would impose a ban on advertisements in the middle of television dramas starting Jan. 1. The agency imposing the ban, the State Administration of Radio, Film and Television, said on its Web site that ads would only be able to appear at the start and end of an episode, which generally run 45 minutes. Analysts say the new regulation would result in lower ad revenues for television networks since many companies want to place their ads in the middle of a program. The new policy is the latest in a series of moves by the agency to tighten restrictions on television. In October, it announced limits on entertainment shows broadcast nationwide during primetime hours.

title: France Will Withdraw 200 Soldiers from Afghanistan
description: France announced Monday that it would withdraw another 200 soldiers from Afghanistan by the end of the year, after transferring command of two districts to the Afghan Army. The reduction is part of the Afghanization of the war, which is supposed to be complete by the end of 2014. Another 200 soldiers returned to France in October. France now has about 3,800 troops in Afghanistan. That number will fall to 3,600 by the end of the year, according to Col. Thierry Burkhard, the French military spokesman. To date, 76 French soldiers have died in Afghanistan. The Socialist presidential candidate, Franois Hollande, has promised to pull all French troops out of Afghanistan by early 2013, not by the end of 2014, the date agreed on by all NATO allies.

title: N.B.A. Teams to Be Paired for Two Exhibition Games
description: It could be another week before the N.B.A. ratifies its new labor deal and releases a 66-game schedule for the revived 2011-12 season. In the meantime, the league is constructing a hurried preseason schedule.

title: City Abandons Rezoning Plans for Village and Chelsea
Turkey: Premier in Good Health After Surgery
description: Prime Minister Tayyip Erdogan was in good health after laparoscopic surgery on his digestive system, his office said Monday. Mr. Erdogan, 57, had the operation on Saturday and was recovering at Marmara University Hospital in Istanbul, a government official said, adding that he expected the prime minister to be discharged Tuesday. Mr. Erdogan was elected prime minister in June for a third consecutive term.

title: Britain Braces for Large Strike
description: Britain is gearing up for its largest strike in more than 30 years, with as many as two million teachers, health-care workers, local government employees and border agents expected to walk off the job on Wednesday to protest a government plan that would require them to work longer and contribute more to their pensions. Some 90 percent of the countrys schools are expected to close, local services will be severely curtailed, non-essential medical procedures face possible cancellation, and international passengers arriving at Heathrow Airport have been warned to expect delays of up to 12 hours in immigration halls. At least one airline, Etihad Airways, has already canceled flights; others are urging passengers not arrive on Wednesday and offering to let them change their reservations free of charge.

title: Violet the Hawk Has Worsening Leg Problems
description: We write with bad news about Violet, the red-tailed hawk whose child-rearing and leg problems were chronicled on City Room in the spring.

title: For Giants Defense, Getting to Brees Is Imperative
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The Giants defensive game plan rarely wavers from week to week. It starts with rushing the passer. The rest trickles down from there.

title: At Top Colleges, Anti-Wall St. Fervor Complicates Recruiting
description: 9:40 a.m. | Updated NEW HAVEN  College students seeking jobs on Wall Street have always had hurdles to overcome  grueling applications, endless rounds of interviews and fierce competition for the relatively few available spots at top firms.

title: Times Photographer Complains of Israeli Soldiers Cruelty at Border Crossing
description: Updated | 10:39 p.m. Israels Defense Ministry apologized on Monday for forcing a pregnant New York Times photographer to remove her clothes and submit to a physical search after she had already passed through an X-ray machine three times at a checkpoint in Gaza last month.

title: In Bleak Cairo, a Call for Optimism
description: Cairo

title: Capitals Hire Hunter to Replace Boudreau
description: Dale Hunter, one of four Capitals players whose jersey (No. 32) hangs from the rafters of Verizon Center, was named to coach the team Monday, replacing the fired Bruce Boudreau. Hunter has spent the past 11 seasons as the coach of the London Knights in the Ontario Hockey League, reaching 400 victories faster than any coach in league history. Since starting the season 7-0, Washington has lost six of its last eight games.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Drones for Everyone, and Bitcoins Decline
description: Interesting things that Bits reporters and editors found on the Web. More here.

title: App Smart Extra: Guide to Roadside Amenities
description: In an earlier App Smart column, I tested out a few apps that help you track your cars performance, and maybe remove some of the pain of driving in the meantime.

title: Iran: 50 Suspects Indicted in Bank Fraud Case
description: The chief prosecutor investigating a $2.6 billion bank embezzlement scandal said that more than 50 suspects had been indicted and that 40 companies had been found to harbor unreported debts and irregularities in connection with the fraud, the biggest in the history of the Islamic republic. The prosecutor, Gholam Hossein Mohseni Ejei, also said 106 potential suspects had been interrogated since he was assigned to the case more than two months ago, the semiofficial Mehr News Agency reported.

title: Should Legislation Protect  the Obese?
Motorolas Droid Razr Still Has It
description: The new Droid Razr has a lot to live up to. The original Razr was a flip-phone marvel of sleek design. It became the best-selling phone in the United States until the iPhone knocked it from its perch. The new Razr, while lacking the wow factor of the original, is still a credible heir to the name.

title: U.S. Opposes New Trial in Arms-Dealing Case
description: A jurors post-trial statements in which she said she had seen a movie inspired by the life of the man she voted to convict, Viktor Bout, should not be enough to warrant a new trial, federal prosecutors say.

title: Q&A: Pinning Photos on a Map
description: Q. A friend sent a photo he says he shot with his phone. I see from the JPGs properties latitude and longitude are listed. Is there an easy way to determine the physical location from these data?

title: Woman Claims Affair With Cain, and He Denies It
description: An Atlanta woman came forward in an interview broadcast Monday night with details about what she called a 13-year affair with Herman Cain, the Republican presidential contender whose campaign was already struggling to overcome damage from accusations of sexual harassment.

title: Trainers Success Is Built on Patience
description: Bill Mott has had a very good month  the kind that he patiently spent a year working toward. It is a month that should earn him his third Eclipse Award as the nations outstanding horse trainer.

title: Disaster Go-Bags of the Famous
description: Go-bags became a popular topic after 9/11. Heres what a few have inside them.

title: Time to Run. What Is in Their Bag?
description: IN a year that delivered Hurricane Irene and one of the most powerful earthquakes to hit the East Coast, the term go-bag  which grew common after 9/11 and is defined by the New York City Office of Emergency Management as a collection of items you can use in the event of an evacuation  has become as much a part of the citys parlance as MetroCard and Grays Papaya.

title: Dodgers Owners Feud Is Now With Fox
description: The animosity that once enlivened Frank McCourts desperate battle against Major League Baseball to hold on to his ownership of the Los Angeles Dodgers is now fueling his feud with Fox Sports.

description: Nearly everything about the investigation into child sexual abuse allegations against Bernie Fine, a former assistant mens basketball coach at Syracuse, took a more serious turn over the weekend. Fine was fired by the university after another accuser came forward and Coach Jim Boeheim quickly retracted his previous unconditional support of Fine.

title: Gary Speed, Welsh National Soccer Coach, Dies at 42
description: Gary Speed, the coach of the national soccer team of Wales and a steady and skilled player in the top divisions of English soccer for more than 20 years, was found dead in his home early Sunday in the village of Huntington, England. He was 42.

description: To the Editor:

title: Urban Meyers Ohio State Football Contract
description: The six-year contract agreed to by Coach Meyer and the university includes $4 million in annual compensation.

title: The Jets Secondary Leaves Itself Open to Criticism
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  The Jets could have arrived at team headquarters Monday mourning an opportunity missed. They could have deconstructed how Stevie Johnson managed to find such a wide seam in their coverage, catching the game-winning touchdown pass that resuscitated Buffalos playoff hopes and stomped all over the Jets.

title: Militants Turn to Death Squads in Afghanistan
description: SABARI, Afghanistan  As targeted killings have risen sharply across Afghanistan, American and Afghan officials believe that many are the work of counterintelligence units of the Haqqani militant network and Al Qaeda, charged with killing suspected informants and terrorizing the populace on both sides of the Afghanistan-Pakistan border.

title: Week 12 Live: Giants-Saints Win Probability
description: The Fifth Down provided live updates and analysis during the Giants-Saints game in New Orleans on Monday night, while tracking the probability of a win throughout the game. A quick review for those unfamiliar with the metric from Advanced NFL Stats: Win probability measures just that  the probability that each team will win the game at any moment.

title: Pepper Spray in Santas Bag?
description: BLACK FRIDAY. Im not shopping but I am in a mall  the Atlantic Center in Brooklyn, home of the Department of Motor Vehicles, a pedestrian bridge away from the second floor of Target. Having surfaced from the underworld of the Atlantic-Pacific subway station, my 19-year-old son, Walker, and I have taken two flights of stairs and an escalator to emerge on the wrong side of the mall. By the time we arrive at the D.M.V.s doors and survey the tangled queues of wild-eyed applicants, weve struggled through a tide of consumers washing frantically in and out of stores, dragged down by purchases but still moving briskly. What would be worse, I find myself wondering, to join the frenzy of holiday shopping, or to at last confront the appointment with destiny Walker and I have conspired to avoid for years?

title: Justices to Decide on Fairness in Drug Sentences
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to resolve a question that has vexed the lower federal courts since Congress enacted a law to narrow the gap between sentences meted out for offenses involving two kinds of cocaine.

title: Shooting Suspect Is Called Fit for Trial
description: An Idaho man charged with trying to assassinate President Obama by firing a semiautomatic rifle at the White House on Nov. 11 was found competent to stand trial by a psychologist who evaluated him, according to court papers filed on Monday by prosecutors in Washington.

title: For New Coach at Ohio State, Its First Down and $4 Million
description: Ohio State University hired Urban Meyer as its football coach Monday, giving him one of the richest contracts ever in college sports  the latest indication that the big business of college football is undeterred by the nations broader economic woes or by concern about the prominence of sports on campus.

title: Keep the Clean Water Act Strong
description: San Francisco

title: Western Unions Singing Telegram Makes a Modern Comeback
description: THE singing telegram, once a popular way to share birthday greetings and other congratulatory messages, is returning with a twist that reflects how such sharing now often takes place digitally.

title: Looking at Dogs and Cars
description: Often when Im out and about Im looking at cars, and when Im not looking at cars, Im looking at dogs. Recently I realized that these apparently different activities are linked by the emotions provoked by the two objects of my gaze.

title: BRIC Power
description: Chinas Gain

title: Horse Racing Draws a Line at Licensing Chechen Leader
description: Thoroughbred racing has always attracted a mix of royalty and rogues. Blue bloods like the Whitneys and the Vanderbilts have long been owners. So, too, have mischief-makers like the mobster Arnold Rothstein, who won the 1921 Travers at Saratoga with a racehorse named Sporting Blood.

title: AT&Ts 11th-Hour Plan to Save Its Deal With T-Mobile
description: About an hour after AT&T announced its $39 billion acquisition of T-Mobile in March on a Sunday afternoon, I got a call at home. It was Randall L. Stephenson, AT&Ts chairman and chief executive. Mr. Stephenson, an affable man with a wry sense of humor, knew he would face a battle persuading regulators  and maybe even me  that the deal should be approved.

title: Photoshopped or Not? A Tool to Tell
description: The photographs of celebrities and models in fashion advertisements and magazines are routinely buffed with a helping of digital polish. The retouching can be slight  colors brightened, a stray hair put in place, a pimple healed. Or it can be drastic  shedding 10 or 20 pounds, adding a few inches in height and erasing all wrinkles and blemishes, done using Adobes Photoshop software, the photo retouchers magic wand.

title: Mourning a Cultural Hub Disguised as a Used Bookstore
description: METUCHEN, N.J.  Even admirers concede it was always a stretch to imagine a combination literary bookstore, avant garde cultural center and family-friendly guerrilla street theater emporium here on Main Street. So Alex Dawsons seven-year run at the Raconteur, which will come to an end on Jan. 31, was about seven years longer than anyone should have expected.

title: A Fixture on the Bench, and in the Community
description: Jim Boeheim will forever be the defining face of basketball at Syracuse University. He shepherded the mens program from a regional power to a national one, winning an N.C.A.A. title in 2003 and earning a spot in the Basketball Hall of Fame.

title: Crisis in Europe Tightens Credit Across the Globe
description: Europes worsening sovereign debt crisis has spread beyond its banks and the spillover now threatens businesses on the Continent and around the world.

title: The Accented Activist, the Blue Woman and One Curious Year in Court
description: Some things that are perhaps worth knowing about Vesselin Dittrich are that he is 64, a freelance translator of Bulgarian, divorced and a resident of Hoboken, N.J. He is also deeply concerned about injustice. And he was sitting on a PATH train in the Hoboken station on Aug. 9, 2010, at 5 in the evening, staring at a young woman because she seemed to be all blue.

title: A Court, Not Votes, Sustains a Political Machine in Queens
description: Pity the poor Queens Democratic machine; so many of its loyal sons have taken head-first tumbles of late.

title: Obama Meets Leaders of the European Union
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama met with top European Union leaders as the euro zone sovereign debt crisis entered a perilous new phase, with increasing worries about the sustainability of the 17-country monetary union and borrowing costs climbing to new peaks.

title: At Airports, a Bigger Push to Sell Electronics
description: Sales of electronics and their gear in airports have gone from little more than an afterthought a few years ago to a rapidly growing presence.

title: The Life Reports II
description: A few weeks ago, I asked people over 70 to send me Life Reports  essays about their own lives and what theyd done poorly and well. They make for fascinating and addictive reading, and Ive tried to extract a few general life lessons:

title: Carry On a Christmas Pie, Not a Merry Snow Globe
description: MY daughter, who was always a resourceful child, showed up for the Thanksgiving visit with her husband, our three small grandchildren and a homemade apple pie.

title: Barney Frank, a Top Liberal, Wont Seek Re-election
description: NEWTON, Mass.  Simply put, Barney Frank has had enough.

title: Nicaraguas President Rules Airwaves to Control Image
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua  The election this month in which President Daniel Ortega won a third term and a supermajority in Congress may have been marred by irregularities  the European Unions electoral mission called the vote tally opaque and arbitrary, and observers were blocked from monitoring some polls  but on most TV news channels, things looked different.

title: Amid Protests by Students and Others, CUNY Trustees Vote to Raise Tuition
description: With a raucous protest outside summoning all of the volume, but not the violence, of a similar clash last week, City University trustees approved on Monday a series of $300 annual tuition increases that will extend through 2015.

title: Exiting a Middle Seat With Gymnastics
description: IN general, I dont mind flying. But if some clever person invented teleportation like that in Star Trek, that would relieve a lot of the hassle of business travel.

title: Money Found in Britain May Belong to MF Global
description: About $200 million in customer money that vanished from MF Global is believed to have surfaced at JPMorgan Chase in Britain, according to people briefed on the matter. The discovery could be the most significant breakthrough in a monthlong hunt for the missing funds.

title: Woman Gave Councilman Part of Her Pay, She Testifies
description: A woman who had a romantic relationship with City Councilman Larry B. Seabrook testified on Monday that in instances in which she was hired as a consultant based on Mr. Seabrooks recommendation, she gave him part of the money she received from her employers.

title: Capitals and Hurricanes Change Coaches, With Different Expectations
description: For two N.H.L. coaches, it was Black Monday.

title: Germany Cuts Off Its Nose
description: Lords of Finance, Liaquat Ahameds magisterial 2009 history of the events that led first to the Great Depression and then to the Second World War, is, necessarily, a book about policy mistakes. Central bankers and Treasury secretaries, presidents and prime ministers: all of them are locked into their own economic and political orthodoxies. Each is certain that his is the only sensible course of action. Crippled by their blinders, they consistently make economic choices that appear to us, nearly a century later, to be insane but to them seemed completely sensible.

title: Telemarketer Abuse Statute Confounds Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON  This is the strangest statute I have ever seen, Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. said near the end of a Supreme Court argument on Monday.

title: Myanmar: A Welcome From China
description: Vice President Xi Jinping of China welcomed the leader of Myanmars military on Monday in a ceremony at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing and called for closer military ties between the countries, in what appeared to be a response to the visit by Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton to Myanmar later this week.

title: As Public Sector Sheds Jobs, Blacks Are Hit Hardest
description: Don Buckley lost his job driving a Chicago Transit Authority bus almost two years ago and has been looking for work ever since, even as other municipal bus drivers around the country are being laid off.

title: 2 Celebrities Point Fingers at Murdoch in Inquiry
description: LONDON  For weeks, the spotlight in inquiries into the practices of Britains rambunctious tabloids has been on James Murdoch, the 38-year-old scion of the family-run media empire operated by the News Corporation, and the extent of his knowledge of the wrongdoing at The News of the World, the newspaper under Mr. Murdochs authority that was shut down this summer.

title: A Not-So-Straight Story
description: Its funny the way close observation can change your perception of things. Heisenbergs uncertainty principle says something like this about observing quantum particles [1]; maybe borderology needs its own uncertainty principle. Consider: What is the longest straight-line international boundary? Why, that has to be the American-Canadian border between Lake of the Woods (Minnesota/Manitoba) and Boundary Bay (Washington State/British Columbia), which runs for 1,260 miles along the 49th parallel north. Right?

title: Putting Others Ahead, and Then Falling Behind
description: There is a certain type of woman who is good at taking care of everyone but herself.

title: Panel Urges Sharp Change for Hospitals in Brooklyn
description: The New York State health commissioner should be given sweeping new powers to replace the executives and board members of private hospitals, a group appointed by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo recommended Monday in a report on how to restructure Brooklyns failing hospitals and health system.

title: What Happened on the Border?
description: Its not clear what led to NATO strikes on two Pakistani border posts this weekend, but there can be no dispute that the loss of lives is tragic. At least 24 Pakistani troops were killed. We regret those deaths, as we do those of all American, NATO and Afghan troops and Pakistani and Afghan civilians killed by extremists.

title: Tuesday: Run to Las Vegas
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  I know times are tough for everyone, so it really shouldnt surprise me when cries for help start to get embedded in crossword puzzles.

title: Senate Democrats Propose Extending Payroll Tax Cut
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Democrats introduced legislation Monday to extend and expand an expiring payroll tax cut, setting the stage for a showdown with Republicans who are almost certain to reject the Democrats proposal for paying for the cut.

title: The S.E.C.s Enabling
description: Judge Jed Rakoff is furious. He should be. We all should be. On Monday, the Federal District Court judge rightly rejected a plan by the Securities and Exchange Commission to settle a securities fraud case against Citigroup, saying that the $285 million deal was neither fair, nor reasonable, nor adequate, nor in the public interest.

title: Boudreau Is Fired, Replaced by Hunter, a Former Capital
description: WASHINGTON  The Capitals took a page from their own record book Monday in an effort to regain their winning ways.

title: With Crosby in Form, Rangers Face Tough Task
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  It has taken only a week for Sidney Crosby to re-establish his credentials as hockeys best player. Consider his numbers since returning Nov. 21 from a 320-day absence: in four games, he has two goals and seven assists and is plus 7.

title: City Council Plans Suit Over Homeless Policy
description: Christine C. Quinn, the speaker of the City Council, announced plans Monday to sue the administration of Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg over a new policy that imposes stricter requirements on homeless people seeking shelter.

title: Reporting Abuse
description: Prosecutors have a long way to go before they unravel the sexual abuse scandals that have engulfed the athletic departments at Pennsylvania State University and Syracuse University. What is clear from both cases is that college administrators need to contact off-campus law enforcement authorities immediately when they receive allegations of criminal conduct. It should not take prolonged inquiries or complex new standards for universities to take this common-sense step.

title: Missing Girls Mother Freed, but Still a Suspect
description: PHOENIX  The mother of a missing 5-year-old girl from Glendale, Ariz., who was arrested last week on suspicion of child abuse, was released from jail on Monday morning after prosecutors failed to file formal charges in the case, the authorities said.

title: Lottery Numbers
A Victory for Grizzly Bears
description: Thanks to a federal appellate court ruling last week, grizzly bears in the Rocky Mountains will continue to enjoy protection as an endangered species. The United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit ruled that the Fish and Wildlife Service had not only acted prematurely when it removed the bear from the endangered species list in 2007 but had ignored clearly documented threats to the animals food supply  in effect putting politics ahead of science.

title: And the Gothams Winners Are

description: TRIPOLI, Libya  Tripoli is no longer the capital of a police state. But what it has become, in just a matter of weeks, can be both exhilarating and disturbing.

title: Rangers Unveil Winter Classic Jerseys
description: On Jan. 2, the New York Rangers will take to the ice against the Philadelphia Flyers for the Winter Classic at Citizens Bank Park, and theyll be sporting a special version of their jerseys for the outdoor game. The Rangers unveiled the new look at Wollman Rink in Central Park on Monday.

description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  Newt Gingrich is a historian. He earned a Ph.D. in history. If youve forgotten, hell remind you.

title: Obituary: Gary Speed, 42, Welsh National Soccer Coach
description: The Times obituary for Gary Speed, the former Wales soccer coach who died Sunday in an apparent suicide, has been posted online. Speed, who played for Leeds, Everton, Newcastle United, Bolton and Sheffield United before moving into management, was the first player to make 500 appearances in the Premier League. He was 42.

description: The Oregon State Board of Higher Education voted Monday afternoon to terminate the contract of the University of Oregon president, Richard W. Lariviere.

description: An investigation into the safety of the Chevrolet Volts battery pack could chill interest in the electric car market.

description: Michael Hastings, a British playwright whose best-known work, Tom and Viv, about the first marriage of T. S. Eliot, created a cultural brouhaha over the appropriateness of fictionalizing the lives of real people, died on Nov. 19, at his home in London. He was 74.

description: In 2010, the Monday after Thanksgiving was the largest online sales day to date.

description: Flavors.me started last year as a place where people with an array of social networking profiles could pull information from each of their accounts into one polished page.

title: Brees and Saints Have Their Way Against Giants
description: NEW ORLEANS  The sideline expressions of Giants Coach Tom Coughlin have become familiar to fans over the years. Coughlin has never been shy about showing his emotions, particularly when the Giants are not playing well, and it seems as if he has several variations he uses when he wants to indicate disappointed.

title: Giants Replay: Week 12
description: Images from the Giants 49-24 loss to the Saints in New Orleans on Nov. 28.

title: Why Are Primaries Hard to Predict?
description: Presidential elections are predictable. At the national level, economic conditions  measures like the change in per-capita income in the year or so preceding the election  usually do a good job predicting the popular vote. At the state level, you can usually predict the outcome given the vote last time, after adjusting for the economy and the home states and regions of the candidates. At the level of individual voters, preferences are largely predictable from political ideology, degree of partisanship, and, again, recent economic conditions.

title: No Consistent Running Game for the Giants
description: A capsule look at the Giants 49-24 loss to the Saints:

title: Newswallah: In the English-Language Press Tuesday
description: Opposition against the central governments decision to allow 51 percent foreign direct investment in multi-brand retail is mounting, prompting Prime Minister Manmohan Singh called for a rare all-party meeting to help reach a consensus (Business Standard). Commerce and Industry Minister Anand Sharma said on Monday that retail foreign direct investment would be allowed only if foreign companies source 30 percent of their products from Indias micro, small and medium enterprises, known as MSMEs. Analysts argue that diluting the policy in this manner could effectively make foreign investment in retail less attractive, Mint reports.

title: How to Succeed in Business? By Reading, India Says
description: It was a different kind of shopping trip for Pallavi Rao, 24, a trendy human-resources consultant who normally picks up things like sunglasses, bags and short jackets. After work last week, she browsed among dozens of stalls at Bangalores annual book fair and carefully selected a handful of titles on management and leadership.

title: A War Crimes Court and a Travesty of Justice
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  On the fourth floor of a nondescript pale-blue government building in Old Dhaka, clerks are stapling together copies of depositions from witnesses to the crimes committed during Bangladeshs 1971 war of secession from Pakistan  a conflict that may have killed up to three million people, according to the Bangladeshi government. Above them on the wall is a map showing the 11 sectors of what was then called East Pakistan.

title: Corrections: November 29
description: FRONT PAGE

title: News Quiz | Nov. 29, 2011
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper.

title: Nov. 29, 1947 | U.N. Partitions Palestine, Allowing for Creation of Israel
description: On Nov. 29, 1947, the United Nations General Assembly passed a resolution calling for Palestine to be partitioned between Arabs and Jews, allowing for the formation of the Jewish state of Israel.

title: Is Microsoft Running Out of Time for Tablets?
description: The window of opportunity for Microsoft to come out with a Windows tablet that successfully challenges the iPad is closing, according to a report from Forrester Research to be published Tuesday.

title: After Second Day of Voting in Egypt, Islamists Offer Challenge to Generals
description: CAIRO  Poised to dominate Egypts first parliamentary elections since the ouster of President Hosni Mubarak, leaders of the Muslim Brotherhoods political party laid down a new challenge to the authority of Egypts interim military rulers on Tuesday, even before polls had closed on the second day of voting.

title: Test Yourself | English, Nov. 29, 2011
description: The question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the article In Gloomy Economic Times, Santas Learn to Help by Curbing Expectations.

title: British Inquiry Is Told Hacking Is Worthy Tool
description: LONDON  He admitted that he and his colleagues hacked into peoples phones and paid police officers for tips. He confessed to lurking in unmarked vans outside peoples houses, stealing confidential documents, rifling through celebrity garbage cans and pretending that he was not a journalist pursuing a story but Brad the teenage rent boy, propositioning a priest.

title: School for Santas
description: WHO founded the Charles W. Howard Santa Claus School?

title: A World of Change on the Lower East Side
description: Harvey Wang was a young photographer when he moved into a fifth-floor Chinatown walk-up in 1979. It was an easy bike ride from the East Village clubs where he took pictures of strobe-lit dance floors and bohemian debauchery  and besides, rent was only $140 a month.

title: Is Too Much Meaningless Cricket Killing the Sport?
description: In 2014, Brazil will host the football World Cup for the first time in 64 years. Now, imagine that Brazil wins the tournament, sending the Brazilians into raptures. Six months later, the Brazilian Football Federation invites the English football team to play five games across the country. Brazil wins all of them by a comfortable margin, dominating the English team. Yet, the stadiums are half empty and attendance is lowest at the Maracan stadium in Rio de Janeiro. Even the TV ratings are down, far lower than forecasted.

title: App Smart Extra: Gift Cards for Apps
description: First, technology killed the typewriter industry. Wrapping paper could be next.

title: What Are You Good At?
description: A teenager in Connecticut has come to be in high demand as an interior decorator and is regarded as something of a rising star, according to a profile in the Timess Home and Garden section. What are your talents and skills? What products or services might you be able to provide, either free of charge, or for a fee?

title: Paris Nap Bar Provides Respite for Worn-Out Visitors
description: Sore feet, aching limbs and the midafternoon slump are all enemies of the ambitious tourist. Now, visitors to Paris can turn those unpleasantries into sweet dreams with a new bar devoted to naps. Located in the heart of the city, the Zen Bar  Sieste (29 Passage Choiseul; www.barasieste.com), the Zen Nap Bar, offers a dark and peaceful spot for a moment of rest.

title: Gingrich and the Destruction of Congressional Expertise
description: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of the coming book The Benefit and the Burden.

title: Navigating Turkey
description: ISTANBUL  G.P.S. navigator devices have started popping up on the dashboards of Istanbul taxis, but Ive assumed that, like furry dice and troll dolls with wobbly heads, they are fashion statements more than tools. Ive never seen a driver use one unprompted or even consult a conventional street atlas.

title: A View of the Queensboro Bridge, From India
description: The photograph above was taken in Kolkata, India, but the bridge looks as if might be crossing the East River, not the Hooghly. It isnt hard to picture the Dead End Kids in the foreground instead of Kushti wrestlers.

description: The AMR Corporation, the parent company of American Airlines, said on Tuesday that it had filed for bankruptcy protection in an effort to reduce labor costs and shed a heavy debt burden.

description: The Obama administration unveils proposed rules for tribal lands that would speed wind and solar energy projects. The president plans to meet with leaders of the 565 federally recognized tribes at the White House on Friday. [The Huffington Post]

description: LONDON  David Mayhew, one of Britains most respected bankers, has stepped down as chairman of J.P. Morgan Cazenove, the company announced on Tuesday.

description: 11:48 a.m. | Updated With Herman Cain reassessing his candidacy, the question now is who the beneficiary would be should he drop out  and whether that person will be able to hold on to the peripatetic portion of the Republican electorate that had latched onto Mr. Cain in the first place.

description: Art Basel Miami, which begins Thursday, has helped bolster the citys galleries and develop local artists.

title: Miami, City of Sun and Beaches, Is Now About Art
description: MIAMI  This city has worn many tags through the decades: It has been a place to honeymoon and retire, to buy cocaine and dodge bullets, to sample Little Havana and party all night. But art was never high on the to-do list.

title: Iranian Protesters Attack British Embassy
description: CAIRO  Iranian protesters shouting Death to England stormed the British Embassy compound and a diplomatic residence in Tehran on Tuesday, tearing down the British flag, smashing windows, defacing walls and briefly detaining six staff members in what appeared to be a state-sponsored protest against Britains tough new economic sanctions against Iran.

title: Flash Mob Hits Mumbai
description: Two hundred dancers took commuters at Mumbais hectic Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus railway station by surprise on Sunday, when they broke into dance accompanied by the title track from Bollywood hit Rang de Basanti.

title: Tuesday Reading: A Closer Look at Teeth May Mean More Fillings
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

title: Morning Take-Out
description: TOP STORIES

title: Breakfast Meeting, Nov. 29
description: The Republican presidential candidate Herman Cain, whose campaign had already been stung by accusations of sexual harassment, was confronted with allegations on Monday that he carried on a 13-year affair with an Atlanta businesswoman. Because the story broke while Mr. Cain was live on CNNs The Situation Room, he responded to the allegations by the woman, Ginger White, before they had actually aired on the Fox affiliate in Atlanta, WAGA-TV. According to The Huffington Post, the allegations didnt come up during Cains first segment with anchor Wolf Blitzer. Thats because Blitzer didnt know about them either when the two men sat down. During that first segment of three, CNN producers began to see posts to Twitter that mentioned the coming WAGA story. While seated during a commercial break, Blitzer then asked Cain about the Atlanta report and the candidate acknowledged that his campaign had been contacted about it and would be willing to discuss it on air, Michael Calderone of The Huffington Post reported. [Huffington Post]

title: Wade Phillipss Defensive Intervention in Houston
description: Wade Phillipshas performed one of the great coaching turnarounds in N.F.L. history. Each of the past few seasons, Gary Kubiaks Texans have been on the verge of making the playoffs but have been undone by inept defenses. Houston joined the league as an expansion team in 2002, and its defense has never been very good, struggling in various measures of efficiency. But the bottom fell out on the Texans in 2010, when they had one of the leagues worst defensive seasons. Consider that last season:

title: Barrons Heroes, Felders Ambitions and Other Bits of Politics
description: Take a few days off, and you never know what youll miss in this city. So for the benefit of those of you who had better things to do during the Thanksgiving break, heres a roundup of some political developments. They make up in eye-catching potential for what they may lack in cosmic value.

title: The ECBs Reverse FDR
description: Ryan Avent joins the chorus of those suggesting that the European Central Banks decision last spring to start raising rates  a decision that seemed crazy then, and looks even crazier now  was the point at which everything started to fall apart.

title: Big City Book Club: Breakfast at Tiffanys
description: Norman Mailer famously called Truman Capote the most perfect writer of his generation, saying of Breakfast at Tiffanys that he would not change two words. The 1961 film that came out three years after the novels publication of course changed many words, siphoning off the books abiding spirit of melancholy. When I encountered it for the first time, years ago, just out of college, I felt a race of fury over the liberties and licenses Hollywood had taken in its rendering. Hollys profession is hardly glossed over in the novel, and her neighbor, the books unnamed narrator, does not and cannot provide her with a happy ending. Im interested in hearing from all of you, but especially from those who have just read the book for the first time, presumably after some familiarity with the iconic film.

title: Counting the Underwater Homeowners
description: Analysts have been celebrating various pieces of good economic news, including an uptick in consumer spending. But the housing hangover is still raging.

title: Wide Response to Educational Plight of Mexican Immigrants
More Testing Time for Third to Eighth Graders?
Terre Haute

title: Debt History
description: As part of that long-term project, Ive been looking at the long-term debt history of the United States, using both the Feds flow of funds data (which start in 1952) and the earlier, not quite comparable, data from Millennial Historical Statistics. Heres what I think is a key chart; it shows nonfinancial private-sector debt as as percentage of GDP:

title: Double, Triple and Quadruple Toil: Alan Cumming Will Star in One-Man Macbeth
description: They dont call it the Scottish play for nothing: when a new National Theater of Scotland production of Macbeth comes to the Lincoln Center Festival in the summer it will have only one Scotsman composing its entire cast, thus lowering the risk if anyone says its title out loud. Alan Cumming, the Good Wife and Cabaret star (not to mention the voice of another great Scot, Gutsy Smurf), will perform every single role in the Shakespeare tragedy, including the regicidal schemer of its title and his devious, spot-obsessed wife (though were especially intrigued to see what he does with the three witches). The production, to be directed by John Tiffany and Andy Goldberg, will originate in June at the Tramway in Glasgow, and then be presented at the Lincoln Center Festival in New York from July 5 through July 14.

title: As Water Levels Drop, Texas Drought Reveals Secrets of the Deep
description: MARTINS MILL, Tex.  For more than three years, the lake on Jack Mewbourns ranch here held a secret at its murky bottom: A 1999 Chevrolet Monte Carlo. His grandson was the first one to notice the top of the car peeking out of the water. It wasnt luck, or even fate. It was drought.

title: Storming of British Embassy in Tehran Broadcast Live on State Television
description: Last Updated | 3:32 p.m. Iranian state television showed live images of student protesters breaking into the British Embassy in Tehran on Tuesday and hurling rocks and Molotov cocktails, my colleagues Alan Cowell and Rick Gladstone report.

title: Surprise Winners and Choice Quotes
description: Well, so much for predictions. The Gotham Awards, the first stop on the celebrity prize circuit, offered a slew of surprise winners on Monday night, and even a tie for its top category, best feature. That honor went to Beginners and The Tree of Life.

title: What Were Reading
description: Bloomberg Businessweek: Supermarket store brands (like those primordial cans marked beans or beets) were once mocked as cheesy copycat products, but recession-cautious shoppers have emboldened Safeway and Kroger to step up the quality of  and the marketing for  their own private labels. Via San Francisco Chronicle.  Glenn Collins

title: Jason Moran Is Named Kennedy Centers Jazz Adviser
description: The John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts said on Tuesday that the pianist and composer Jason Moran has been appointed its new artistic adviser for jazz. Mr. Moran, 36, is the second person to hold that post, which had been vacant since the death last year of Billy Taylor, the venerable pianist and educator who began advising the Kennedy Center in 1994.

title: Edible Selby | Danish Modern
description: The father of modern-day foraging, Ren Redzepi, is not short on accolades. His Copenhagen restaurant, Noma, has earned best restaurant in the world in San Pellegrinos foodie poll two years in a row, his abstract dishes comparisons to the paintings of Cy Twombly. Behind the chefs famously free-form approach is a highly studious investigation into the culinary possibilities of foraged ingredients. The El Bulli and French Laundry veteran has set up a nonprofit called the Nordic Food Lab on a nearby houseboat to create cornerstones for a new kind of cuisine, he says. The research lab, led by Lars Williams, a former Noma chef and an alum of New Yorks WD-50, has been experimenting with fermentation and umami for seven months, for instance. Its a bridge between science and the cooking world, but not for the sake of science, Redzepi says. For the sake of deliciousness. Go to interactive feature >>

title: Its Growth Slowing, Britain Extends Austerity Measures
description: On the eve of a huge strike by public sector workers to protest austerity measures, the British government said Tuesday that it was falling behind with its deficit reduction plan and that the measures would drag on for two more years.

title: The Saints: In Your Face and in Your End Zone
description: New Orleans

title: Protesters Storm British Embassy in Tehran
description: Iranian protesters entered the British Embassy compound, tearing down a British flag and ransacking offices.

title: Straight Talk on Climate Progress in California and Beyond
description: Dec. 7, 1:11 a.m. | Updated below |With the latest round of contentious international climate treaty negotiations getting under way in Durban, South Africa, its worth revisiting what would be required to meet ambitious targets set for greenhouse gases in California, a state that already has pledged meaningful action.

title: Bill Limiting Street Protests Moves Ahead in Malaysia
description: KUALA LUMPUR, MALAYSIA  The lower house of the Malaysian Parliament approved a measure Tuesday that would ban street demonstrations, hours after hundreds of lawyers and activists chanting freedom to the people protested against the legislation, which they said would further restrict democratic rights in the country.

title: Wheelies: The Block Party Edition
description: In which we bring you motoring news from around the Web:

title: Daily Report: Digital Makeovers
description: Body image and tech?

title: Perry Wins Endorsement of Sheriff Joe
description: 12:18 p.m. | Updated  AMHERST, N.H.  Gov. Rick Perry of Texas on Tuesday said he would back a federal policy to detain and to deport every illegal alien that we apprehend.

title: Barnett Newman at Craig F. Starr Gallery
description: Craig F. Starr Gallery

title: Sarah Bramans Yours at Mitchell-Innes & Nash
Adam McEwens Real Slow Drag at Marianne Boesky Gallery
description: Marianne Boesky

title: AMR Filing Is 2nd-Largest by a U.S. Airline
description: While the AMR Corporation, the parent of American Airlines, is the last of the legacy airline companies in the United States to file for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, its not the biggest filing. In 2002 UAL, the parent of United Airlines, filed with $25.2 billion in assets, slightly more than AMR at $24.7 billion.

title: Christmas Pends: Remember the Tree Man
description: The scent of turkey and yams has barely faded only to be quickly replaced by a piney reminder of the coming Christmas holiday. Noble firs once again line the sidewalks as we recall Tree Man, last Decembers City Room series that followed Nikola Ivkovic, a Christmas tree vendor, through his selling season.

title: Nomura Cuts Its Exposure to Euro Debt
description: 8:19 p.m. | Updated

title: The Buyers Remorse Primary
description: One of the features of this years Republican nomination calendar is an unusually large gap separating the first few voting states from the larger block of states that vote in March. The gap resulted because Florida, Iowa, Nevada, New Hampshire and South Carolina moved up their voting dates by roughly a month from their original schedule while most of the others remained in place.

title: Trying to Save W.P.S.: A Players View
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  When W.U.S.A. folded, one of the worst things I continued to hear was that it was too bad they [the general public] didnt know more about it. When I read that in an e-mail from a fellow W.P.S. player, I was moved to do my part.

title: Leading Off: Meyers About-Face
description: Today we are reeling with the shocking development that Urban Meyer has been introduced as Ohio States football coach. The sporting public is gobsmacked that Meyer would change course like this, taking over college footballs latest version of the Titanic only a year after tearfully walking away from Florida to embrace the family life he had neglected for so long. We were so convinced Meyer would gently fade from the scene in favor of enjoying his lovely wife and daughters, except when he was talking to us on ESPN every week.

title: Rabbit, Run: Harvey, With Jim Parsons, Sets Broadway Opening Date
description: The Jimmy Stewart vehicle Harvey  and the Emmy Award winner Jim Parsons (The Big Bang Theory)  are coming back to Broadway this spring. Roundabout Theater Company confirmed plans on Tuesday to mount the first Broadway revival of Harvey since 1970, when Stewart reprised his performance as Elwood P. Dowd from the 1950 film (as well as from the 1940s Broadway production.)

title: Patton Oswalt Steals the Scene at the Gotham Awards
description: Theres a scene-stealer at every Gotham Awards  last year it was Bill Murray. (His shadow is a better actor than 70 percent of the people in this room, Mr. Murray said, introducing the career honoree Robert Duvall.) This year the undisputed star of the night was Patton Oswalt, who plays a crippled, sensitive sad sack opposite Charlize Theron in Young Adult, the dark comedy written by Diablo Cody and directed by Jason Reitman. Mr. Oswalt introduced Ms. Theron for her career tribute award with a mostly improvised routine.

title: Nostalgia Trip With an Old Friend
description: Among traditional gamers  those who were playing before the likes of Wii Sports, Guitar Hero, Angry Birds and World of Warcraft returned interactive entertainment to the masses  there is no more hallowed franchise than The Legend of Zelda from Nintendo. If you grew up playing consoles in the late 1980s and the 90s, Zelda probably provided some of your touchstone gaming experiences.

title: Biden in Iraq to Prepare for Postwar Relations
description: BAGHDAD  Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. arrived here on Tuesday for a visit meant to inaugurate a new relationship between the United States and Iraq, just weeks before the last American troops are scheduled to leave the country.

title: Qatar, a Greenhouse Gas Titan, to Host U.N. Climate Meeting
description: The Persian Gulf nation of Qatar has been selected as the site of the United Nations climate change meeting next year, edging out South Korea. The announcement came as this years meeting opened in Durban, South Africa, with delegates from 194 nations facing growing concern about rising global temperatures and more frequent climate-related catastrophes.

title: Q&A: Its the Season To Earn, and Spend, Points
description: BRIAN KELLY started planning his fathers work trips  and managing his travel awards  when he was still a kid. At 13, he had collected enough points to book a family vacation in the Cayman Islands. Now Mr. Kellys blog, thepointsguy.com, helps frustrated travelers who dont know how to make the most of their awards. With so much gift-giving and family visiting, Mr. Kelly said, the holidays are the season for racking up travel points. Below are his five tips for giving  and getting.

title: Fete Accompli | Nothing Comes Between Me and My Calvins and Marriage Equality

title: Readers Respond to the Plight of Mexican Students
description: Last weeks article on the lagging academic achievement among Mexican students in New Yorks schools generated a wide range of responses from places around the country and abroad.

title: Stars of Ghost: The Musical in London to Move With Show to Broadway
description: Richard Fleeshman and Caissie Levy (Hair), who are playing the lead characters Sam and Molly in the London production of Ghost: The Musical, will reprise their performances in the Broadway staging this spring, the producers said on Tuesday.

title: Restraint Urged After Salvos Over Lebanon-Israel Line
description: JERUSALEM  The United Nations peacekeeping force in Lebanon called for maximum restraint on Tuesday after an exchange of fire over the Israel-Lebanon border overnight.

title: Christmas in the Family Car
description: Do we think 60 Minutes intentionally aired its second Hard Times Generation segment, profiling kids living in cars, brushing their teeth at gas stations and telling the reporter Scott Pelley that they just do what they have to do to get by, on the Sunday between Black Friday and Cyber Monday? We do.

title: Finding Good Apps for Children With Autism
description: The Apple iPad has been hailed as a savior for assisting children with autism spectrum disorder or other special needs. It was portrayed as a minor miracle in a recent segment on 60 Minutes and has been found to help even the very young quickly learn.

title: In Myanmar, Government Reforms Win Over Some Skeptics
description: YANGON, Myanmar  The waves of change sweeping Myanmar are trickling down to the broken sidewalks and potholed streets of this dilapidated city.

description: 9:23 p.m. | Updated The full report of this article is available here.

title: Zynga Readies for I.P.O. Roadshow
description: Zynga is approaching the finish line for its initial public offering.

title: Romney Nabs Influential Endorsements in Florida
description: MIAMI  Standing amid boxes of agua de coco and guava bites, Mitt Romney came to southern Florida and imbued his usual speech with some Spanish flair.

title: More Principals Speak Out Against State Evaluation System
Early Holiday Spending Comes Despite Tight Consumer Budgets
description: Continued housing distress and rising prices for food and gas are weighing heavily on American families finances as the holiday shopping season begins, a quarterly analysis shows.

title: McGruff Is Now Asking the Public to Take a Bite Out of Counterfeiting
description: McGruff, the dog that has been trying for decades to help humans take a bite out of crime, is setting his sight on a new target: counterfeit goods.

title: The View From Alabama: Looking for the Rematch
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala.  After Alabama rolled over in-state rival Auburn, the stage was set for a rematch between Louisiana State and Alabama in the B.C.S. national title game.

title: The View From L.S.U.: The Honey Badger Is Back
description: BATON ROUGE, La.  So many questions.

title: What Happens to Wall St. Donations to Barney Frank?
description: Wall Street went long on Barney Franks Congressional career, donating more cash to his upcoming campaign than any other industry.

title: For Contractors, How Quick Is Obamas QuickPay?
description: In September, The Agenda reported about the Obama administrations QuickPay program, an effort to reduce payment time for small-business invoices from 30 to 15 days. Earlier this month, a reader, Paul Kakert of Davenport, Ia., wrote to express his skepticism.Sure, it sounds good. Paid within 15 days, he commented. But within 15 days of when? He went on:

title: A Dash of Drama in the Pizza World
description: A heady perfume of cheese, tomatoes and crispy coal-fired crust wafts onto the sidewalk of Old Fulton Street, intoxicating enough to cause tourists to snap pictures and queue in stomach-growling anticipation.

title: Raikkonen Returns to Formula One
description: After a couple of years away from the series in a failed attempt at rally racing, Kimi Raikkonen, the 2007 world champion at Ferrari, will return to race in Formula One next season.

title: Raikkonen Returns to Formula One
description: After a couple of years away from the series in a failed attempt at rally racing, Kimi Raikkonen, the 2007 world champion at Ferrari, will return to race in Formula One next season.

title: Les Waters Named New Artistic Director at Actors Theater of Louisville
description: 4:30 p.m. | Updated Les Waters, an Obie-award winning director known for his work with Sarah Ruhl and other emerging playwrights, will become the new artistic director of the Actors Theater of Louisville on Jan. 9, officials at the Kentucky theater said on Tuesday. Mr. Waters, 59, has been the associate director of Berkeley Repertory Theater in California since 2003.

title: CUNY Board Approves Tuition Increases
description: Richard Prez-Pea reported in Tuesdays Times that tuition at the City University of New York will rise by 31 percent over the next five years after a vote by CUNY trustees on Monday. He wrote:

title: Profile in Style | Francesca Bonato
description: Francesca Bonatos accessories line, Hacienda Montaecristo, was born of necessity. When she and her husband, the model Nicolas Malleville, opened their hotel, Coqui Coqui, in Tulum, Mexico, 10 years ago, Calvin Klein didnt sell linens here, she says. So the couple made their own, working with local weavers for everything from towels to uniforms. Along the way, she fell in love with the traditional shawl called the rebozo, which she and her partner, Jacopo Janniello Ravagnan, use for their bags, sandles and jewelry. Were inspired by the synchronicity of the colonial and local traditions, she says, by the romanticism of Mexico. See more >>

title: In Protest Over NATO Strike, Pakistan Will Skip Afghan Conference
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Pakistan announced Tuesday that it would not attend an important international conference on Afghanistans security and development that is scheduled to begin in less than a week in protest over the weekend strikes that killed two dozen Pakistani soldiers.

title: For Blake, a Focus on Fund-Raising
description: James Blake did not have to rely on a big serve or the speediness of his quick feet Monday night. Instead, Blake, the American tennis star, needed a steady handshake, a broad smile and the ability to work a room full of family, friends and guests.

title: Gingrich Aims to Turn Immigration Issue on Foes
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C.  Newt Gingrich sought to turn the fractious issue of illegal immigration from an Achilles heel of his campaign into a spear aimed at opponents. He attacked both the Obama administration for failing to control the Mexican border, then pivoted in an interview to warn his Republican rivals Mitt Romney and Michele Bachmann that they would pay a price for distorting his position.

title: A Palm Beach Story, Millions Not Required
description: I sized up the 14th fairway overlooking the sea in Palm Beach, Fla., long a winter escape for millionaires, and pondered two questions:

title: Living Dead Fans Digging Up Funds to Keep Chapel from Going Under
description: Theyre coming to save you: though the reanimated corpses from George A. Romeros 1968 horror classic Night of the Living Dead are long since buried (and hopefully deceased this time), one original building remains from the shooting of that film, and its fans are fighting to preserve it. The Pittsburgh Post-Gazette reported that in September, the Evans City Cemetery Association gave Gary Streiner one year to raise $50,000 to repair a run-down chapel in that Pennsylvania town  a building that Living Dead aficionados may remember from the graveyard where Barbra is teased by her brother, Johnny, Theyre coming to get you. (No spoilers, but lets just say Johnny comes to regret that taunt.)

title: Mathew Cerletty: Susan at Algus Greenspon
description: Algus Greenspon

title: Empire State Building on Track to Be Part of I.P.O.
description: 8:36 p.m. | Updated

title: TimesCast | November 29, 2011
description: Protesters ransack the British Embassy in Tehran; and American Airlines' parent company files for Chapter 11.

title: Clintons Visit to Myanmar Raises Hopes and Concerns
description: BUSAN, South Korea  Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clintons trip to Myanmar this week is raising hopes for greater freedom in the isolated country, but also concerns that the Obama administration is rushing to reward the leaders of one of the worlds most repressive countries.

title: Jacksons Doctor Is Sentenced to Four Years
description: LOS ANGELES  Dr. Conrad Murray, the physician convicted of involuntary manslaughter in the 2009 death of Michael Jackson, was sentenced to four years, the maximum he was facing, though how many days he will actually spend behind bars remains unclear. The sentencing comes three weeks after a jury found Dr. Murray guilty.

title: The Politicization of the Solicitor General
description: It is customary in Washington to handle allegations of wrongdoing by accusing the other side of the same, often in a purely optical attempt to establish parity. With the health care reform case soon to come before the Supreme Court, calls for Justice Clarence Thomas to recuse himself have been met by calls for Justice Elena Kagan to recuse herself.

title: The Poorest and Richest Counties
description: The county with the lowest poverty rate in America last year was Falls Church, Va.  actually an independent city  where about 3 percent of residents live in poverty, according to a new data release from the Census Bureau. The highest poverty rate was in Ziebach County, S.D., where about half of residents are below the poverty line.

title: Wings Eaves Pays the Price for Blocking Shot
description: If youre ordering a smoothie today, consider drinking it in honor of Detroit Red Wings forward Patrick Eaves. Milkshakes, pureed and liquefied foods, smoothies and energy drinks will be Eaves diet for the near future, after a gruesome accident during Saturdays 4-1 win over Nashville left him with a broken jaw.

title: Look of the Moment | Stella Tennant
description: The Look: Black on Black on Black. Varying textures of noir  reflective, matte and furry  are cut with a sharp, plunging V and gold accessories.

title: More Parents Skip Childhood Vaccines
description: Health officials have struggled for years to reassure parents that childhood vaccinations are safe, but the number of parents who skip the shots continues to grow, according to a new analysis by The Associated Press.

title: Judge Says Islamic Center Can Stay, but Owes Rent
description: Consolidated Edison cannot evict the developer of a controversial Islamic community center in Lower Manhattan, though the tenant does owe at least hundreds of thousands of dollars in back rent, according to a Manhattan judge.

title: Official Calls for Urgency on College Costs
description: As Occupy movement protests helped push spiraling college costs into the national spotlight, Education Secretary Arne Duncan urged higher-education officials Tuesday to think more creatively  and with much greater urgency about ways to contain costs and reduce student debt.

title: For Maybach, a Long Slouch Before the Fall
description: On July 2, 2002, two luxury barges idled in New York Harbor. One, the Queen Elizabeth 2, had just completed a transatlantic crossing from Southampton, England. The other, the first Maybach 62 sedan ever produced, had stowed away for the voyage in a glass box on the ships sun deck. The box was eventually lifted, gingerly, by a cargo helicopter and set down on a nearby pier, from which the V-12-powered car departed for a news conference on Wall Street.

title: Q&A: Installing Software on Linux
description: Q.

title: Another Tethering App Bites the Dust
description: Apple has removed from its App Store a tethering app that granted customers the ability to share an iPhones Internet connection with a computer after paying a one-time fee.

title: Worker Transit Benefits Scheduled to Shrink
